" And whose are the writings on the wall of [the caves through which [we]1017-we have passed on [the road]2952-the road]3153-the caves through which we have passed on the road ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , referring to the Egyptian - like sculptures that [we]1017-we had seen .

" [[My]162-infadoos lord]3088-my lord , [the hands that made [the road]2952-the road]3156-the hands that made the road wrote the wonderful writings . [We]1017-we know not who wrote them . "[162-infadoos]

" When did [the Kukuana people]3110-the kukuana people come into [this country]2870-this country ? "[162-infadoos]

" [[My]1021-my lord]3088-my lord , [the race]3161-the race came down here like the breath of a storm ten thousand thousand moons ago , from [the great lands which lie [there beyond]3163-there beyond]3162-the great lands which lie there beyond , "[1021-my] and [he]1021-my pointed to [the north]1022-the north . " [They]3110-the kukuana people could travel no further because of [the high mountains which ring in [the land]3165-the land]3164-the high mountains which ring in the land , so say the old voices of [[our]1017-we fathers]3166-our fathers that have descended to [us]1017-we [the children]3167-the children , and so says [Gagool]122-gagool , [the wise woman]3168-the wise woman , [the smeller out of [witches]3170-witches]3169-the smeller out of witches , "[1021-my] and again [he]1021-my pointed to the snow - clad peaks . " [The country]300-the country , too , was good , so [they]3110-the kukuana people settled [here]2924-here and grew strong and powerful , and now [our]1017-we numbers are like the sea sand , and when [Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king calls up [his]2791-the king regiments [their]3110-the kukuana people plumes cover [the plain]725-the plain so far as the eye of [man]2819-man can reach . "[1021-my]

" And if [the land]3165-the land is walled in with mountains , who is there for [the regiments to fight with]3177-the regiments to fight with ? "[162-infadoos]

" Nay , [[my]1021-my lord]3088-my lord , [the country]300-the country is open there towards [the north]1022-the north , and now and again [warriors]3181-warriors sweep down upon [us]1017-we in clouds from [a land [we]1017-we know not]3182-a land we know not , and [we]1017-we slay [them]3181-warriors . It is the third part of the life of [a man]2655-a man since there was a war . [Many thousands]3184-many thousands died in it , but [we]1017-we destroyed those who came to eat [us]1017-we up . So since then there has been no war . "[1021-my]

" [[Your]1021-my warriors]3185-your warriors must grow weary of resting on [their]3185-your warriors spears , [Infadoos]162-infadoos . "[162-infadoos]

" [[My]1021-my lord]3088-my lord , there was one war , just after [we]1017-we destroyed [the people that came down upon [us]1017-we]3187-the people that came down upon us , but it was a civil war ; dog ate dog . "[1021-my]

" How was that ? "[162-infadoos]

" [[My]1021-my lord [the king]2791-the king]3188-my lord the king , [[my]1021-my half - brother]3190-my half - brother , had [a brother born at the same birth]3191-a brother born at the same birth , and of [the same woman]3192-the same woman . It is not [our]1017-we custom , [[my]1021-my lord]3088-my lord , to suffer [twins to live]3194-twins to live ; [the weaker]3195-the weaker must always die . But [the mother of [the king]2791-the king]3196-the mother of the king hid away [the feebler child , which was born the last]3198-the feebler child , which was born the last , for [her]3196-the mother of the king heart yearned over it , and [that child]3199-that child is [Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king . [I]1021-my am [[his]2791-the king younger brother]3201-his younger brother , born of [another wife]3202-another wife . "[1021-my]

" Well ? "[162-infadoos]

" [[My]1021-my lord]3088-my lord , [Kafa]163-kafa , [[our]1017-we father]2658-our father , died when [we]1017-we came to manhood , and [[my]1021-my brother]2648-my brother [Imotu]168-imotu was made king in [his]168-imotu place , and for a space reigned and had [a son]2836-a son by [[his]168-imotu favourite wife]3207-his favourite wife . When [the babe]3208-the babe was three years old , just after the great war , during which [no man]3209-no man could sow or reap , a famine came upon [the land]3165-the land , and [the people]3142-the people murmured because of the famine , and looked round like a starved lion for something to rend . Then it was that [Gagool]122-gagool , [the wise and terrible woman , who does not die]3212-the wise and terrible woman , who does not die , made a proclamation to [the people]3142-the people , saying , ' [The king Imotu]3214-the king imotu is [no king]3215-no king . ' And at the time [Imotu]168-imotu was sick with a wound , and lay in [his]168-imotu kraal not able to move .[1021-my]

" Then [Gagool]122-gagool went into [a hut]3216-a hut and led out [Twala]165-twala , [[my]162-infadoos half - brother]3190-my half - brother , and [twin brother to [the king]2791-the king , whom [she]122-gagool had hidden among [the caves and rocks]3220-the caves and rocks since [he]2791-the king was born]3218-twin brother to the king , whom she had hidden among the caves and rocks since he was born , and stripping the ' moocha ' waist - cloth off [his]2791-the king loins , showed [the people of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]3221-the people of the kukuanas the mark of the sacred snake coiled round [his]2791-the king middle , wherewith [the eldest son of [the king]2791-the king]3222-the eldest son of the king is marked at birth , and cried out loud , ' Behold [[your]3221-the people of the kukuanas king]3224-your king whom [I]162-infadoos have saved for [you]3221-the people of the kukuanas even to this day ! '[162-infadoos]

" Now [the people being mad with hunger , and altogether bereft of reason and the knowledge of truth]3225-the people being mad with hunger , and altogether bereft of reason and the knowledge of truth , cried out - ' [The king]2791-the king ! [The king]2791-the king ! ' but [I]1021-my knew that it was not so , for [Imotu]168-imotu [[my]1021-my brother]2648-my brother was [the elder of [the twins]3230-the twins]3229-the elder of the twins , and [[our]3231-our lawful king]3232-our lawful king . Then just as the tumult was at its height [Imotu]168-imotu [the king]2791-the king , though [he]2791-the king was very sick , crawled from [[his]2791-the king hut]3234-his hut holding [[his]2791-the king wife]3235-his wife by the hand , and followed by [[his]2791-the king little son]3236-his little son [Ignosi]169-ignosi - that is , by interpretation , [the Lightning]170-the lightning .[1021-my]

" ' What is this noise ? ' [he]2791-the king asked . ' Why cry [ye]1021-my [The king]2791-the king ! [The king]2791-the king ! '[162-infadoos]

" Then [Twala]165-twala , [[his]2791-the king twin brother]3239-his twin brother , born of [the same woman]3192-the same woman , and in the same hour , ran to [him]165-twala , and taking [him]165-twala by the hair , stabbed [him]165-twala through the heart with [his]165-twala knife . And [the people]3142-the people being fickle , and ever ready to worship the rising sun , clapped [their]3142-the people hands and cried , ' [Twala]165-twala is [king]554-king ! Now [we]3142-the people know that [Twala]165-twala is [king]554-king ! ' "[1021-my]

" And what became of [[Imotu]168-imotu 's wife]3244-imotu 's wife and [[her]3244-imotu 's wife son]3245-her son [Ignosi]169-ignosi ? Did [Twala]165-twala kill [them]3246-them too ? "[162-infadoos]

" Nay , [[my]1021-my lord]3088-my lord . When [she]3244-imotu 's wife saw that [[her]3244-imotu 's wife lord]3248-her lord was dead [the queen]334-the queen seized [the child]3250-the child with a cry and ran away . Two days afterward [she]3244-imotu 's wife came to a kraal very hungry , and none would give [her]3244-imotu 's wife milk or food , now that [[her]3244-imotu 's wife lord [the king]2791-the king]3251-her lord the king was dead , for [all men]3253-all men hate [the unfortunate]3254-the unfortunate . But at nightfall [a little child]3255-a little child , [a girl]720-a girl , crept out and brought [her]3255-a little child corn to eat , and [she]3255-a little child blessed [the child]3250-the child , and went on towards [the mountains]2771-the mountains with [[her]3255-a little child boy]3259-her boy before the sun rose again , and there [she]3255-a little child must have perished , for [none]2774-none have seen [her]3255-a little child since , nor [the child Ignosi]3261-the child ignosi . "[1021-my]

" Then if [this child Ignosi]3262-this child ignosi had lived [he]3262-this child ignosi would be [the true king of [the Kukuana people]3110-the kukuana people]3263-the true king of the kukuana people ? "[162-infadoos]

" That is so , [[my]1021-my lord]3088-my lord ; the sacred snake is round [his]3262-this child ignosi middle . If [he]3262-this child ignosi lives [he]3262-this child ignosi is [king]554-king ; but , alas ! [he]3262-this child ignosi is long dead . "[1021-my]

" See , [[my]162-infadoos lord]3088-my lord , "[162-infadoos] and [Infadoos]162-infadoos pointed to [a vast collection of huts surrounded by a fence , which was in [its]1023-a vast collection of huts surrounded by a fence , which was in its turn encircled by a great ditch , that lay on the plain beneath us turn encircled by a great ditch , that lay on [the plain]725-the plain beneath [us]1025-we]1023-a vast collection of huts surrounded by a fence , which was in its turn encircled by a great ditch , that lay on the plain beneath us . " That is [the kraal]3268-the kraal where [the wife of Imotu]3269-the wife of imotu was last seen with [the child [Ignosi]169-ignosi]3261-the child ignosi . It is there that [we]1025-we shall sleep to - night , if , indeed , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos added doubtfully , " [[my]162-infadoos lords]3091-my lords sleep at all upon [this earth]2964-this earth . "[162-infadoos]

" When [we]1025-we are among [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas , [[my]0-i good friend]3273-my good friend [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [we]1025-we do as [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas do , "[0-i] [I]0-i said majestically , and turned round quickly to address Good , who was tramping along sullenly behind , [his]162-infadoos mind fully occupied with unsatisfactory attempts to prevent [his]162-infadoos flannel shirt from flapping in the evening breeze . To [my]0-i astonishment [I]0-i butted into [Umbopa]169-ignosi , who was walking along immediately behind [me]0-i , and very evidently had been listening with the greatest interest to [my]0-i conversation with [Infadoos]162-infadoos . The expression on [his]169-ignosi face was most curious , and gave [me]0-i the idea of [a man who was struggling with partial success to bring something long ago forgotten back into [his]1026-a man who was struggling with partial success to bring something long ago forgotten back into his mind mind]1026-a man who was struggling with partial success to bring something long ago forgotten back into his mind .

All this while [we]1027-we had been pressing on at a good rate towards [the undulating plain beneath [us]1027-we]1028-the undulating plain beneath us . [The mountains [we]1027-we had crossed]1029-the mountains we had crossed now loomed high above [our]1027-we heads , and [Sheba]121-sheba 's Breasts were veiled modestly in diaphanous wreaths of mist . As [we]1027-we went [the country]300-the country grew more and more lovely . The vegetation was luxuriant , without being tropical ; the sun was bright and warm , but not burning ; and a gracious breeze blew softly along the odorous slopes of [the mountains]2771-the mountains . Indeed , [this new land]1032-this new land was little less than [an earthly paradise]1033-an earthly paradise ; in beauty , in natural wealth , and in climate [I]0-i have never seen [its]1032-this new land like . [The Transvaal]21-the transvaal is [a fine country]1034-a fine country , but it is nothing to [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland .

So soon as [we]1027-we started [Infadoos]162-infadoos had despatched a runner to warn [the people]3142-the people of [the kraal]67-the kraal , which , by the way , was in [his]162-infadoos military command , of [our]1027-we arrival . [This man]532-this man had departed at an extraordinary speed , which [Infadoos]162-infadoos informed [me]0-i [he]162-infadoos would keep up all the way , as running was an exercise much practised among [[his]162-infadoos people]676-his people .

The result of this message now became apparent . When [we]1027-we arrived within two miles of [the kraal]3268-the kraal [we]1027-we could see [that company after company of [men]326-men]1039-that company after company of men were issuing from [its]1039-that company after company of men gates and marching towards [us]1027-we .

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry laid [his]97-sir henry hand upon [my]0-i arm , and remarked that it looked as though [we]1027-we were going to meet with a warm reception . Something in [his]97-sir henry tone attracted [Infadoos]162-infadoos ' attention .

" Let not [[my]97-sir henry lords]3091-my lords be afraid , "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry said hastily , " for in [my]97-sir henry breast there dwells no guile . [This regiment]3275-this regiment is [one under [my]97-sir henry command]3276-one under my command , and comes out by [my]97-sir henry orders to greet [you]0-i . "[97-sir henry]

[I]0-i nodded easily , though [I]0-i was not quite easy in [my]0-i mind .

About half a mile from [the gates of [this kraal]1042-this kraal]1041-the gates of this kraal is a long stretch of rising ground sloping gently upwards from [the road]2952-the road , and here [the companies]1044-the companies formed . It was a splendid sight to see [them]1044-the companies , each company about three hundred strong , charging swiftly up the rise , with flashing spears and waving plumes , to take [their]1044-the companies appointed place . By the time [we]1045-we reached the slope [twelve such companies , or in [all three thousand six hundred men]1047-all three thousand six hundred men]1046-twelve such companies , or in all three thousand six hundred men , had passed out and taken up [their]1046-twelve such companies , or in all three thousand six hundred men positions along [the road]2952-the road .

Presently [we]1045-we came to [the first company]1049-the first company , and were able to gaze in astonishment on [the most magnificent set of warriors that [I]0-i have ever seen]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen . [They]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen were [all men of mature age]1051-all men of mature age , mostly [veterans of about forty]1052-veterans of about forty , and not one of [them]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen was under six feet in height , whilst [many stood six feet three or four]1053-many stood six feet three or four . [They]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen wore upon [their]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen heads heavy black plumes of Sakaboola feathers , like those which adorned [[our]1045-we guides]1054-our guides . About [their]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen waists and beneath the right knees were bound circlets of white ox tails , while in [their]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen left hands [they]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen carried round shields measuring about twenty inches across . These shields are very curious . The framework is made of an iron plate beaten out thin , over which is stretched milk - white ox - hide .

The weapons that [each man]1055-each man bore were simple , but most effective , consisting of a short and very heavy two - edged spear with a wooden shaft , the blade being about six inches across at the widest part . These spears are not used for throwing but like [the Zulu " bangwan]3277-the zulu " bangwan , "[3277-the zulu " bangwan] or stabbing assegai , are for close quarters only , when the wound inflicted by [them]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen is terrible . In addition to [his]1055-each man bangwan [every man]1056-every man carried three large and heavy knives , each knife weighing about two pounds . One knife was fixed in the ox - tail girdle , and the other two at the back of the round shield . These knives , which are called " tollas "[93-the kukuanas] by [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas , take the place of the throwing assegai of [the Zulus]1011-the zulus . [The Kukuana warriors]1058-the kukuana warriors can cast [them]1050-the most magnificent set of warriors that i have ever seen with great accuracy to a distance of fifty yards , and it is [their]1058-the kukuana warriors custom on charging to hurl a volley of them at [the enemy]1059-the enemy as [they]1058-the kukuana warriors come to close quarters .

[Each company]1060-each company remained still as a collection of bronze statues till [we]1045-we were opposite to [it]1060-each company , when at a signal given by [[its]1060-each company commanding officer]1061-its commanding officer , who , distinguished by a leopard skin cloak , stood some paces in front , every spear was raised into the air , and from three hundred throats sprang forth with a sudden roar the royal salute of " Koom . "[1062-the company] Then , so soon as [we]1045-we had passed , [the company]1062-the company formed up behind [us]1045-we and followed [us]1045-we towards [the kraal]3268-the kraal , till at last [the whole regiment of the " Greys]3278-the whole regiment of the " greys "[3278-the whole regiment of the " greys] - so called from [their]1058-the kukuana warriors white shields - [the crack corps of [the Kukuana people]3110-the kukuana people]1064-the crack corps of the kukuana people , was marching in [our]1045-we rear with a tread that shook the ground .

At length , branching off from [Solomon 's Great Road]68-solomon 's great road , [we]1045-we came to [the wide fosse surrounding [the kraal]3268-the kraal]1066-the wide fosse surrounding the kraal , which is at least a mile round , and fenced with a strong palisade of piles formed of the trunks of trees . At the gateway [this fosse]1068-this fosse is spanned by a primitive drawbridge , which was let down by [the guard]1069-the guard to allow [us]1045-we to pass in . [The kraal]3268-the kraal is exceedingly well laid out . Through the centre runs [a wide pathway intersected at right angles by other pathways]1071-a wide pathway intersected at right angles by other pathways so arranged as to cut [the huts]1072-the huts into [square blocks]1073-square blocks , each block being [the quarters of [a company]1075-a company]1074-the quarters of a company . [The huts]1072-the huts are dome - shaped , and built , like those of [the Zulus]1011-the zulus , of a framework of wattle , beautifully thatched with grass ; but , unlike [the Zulu huts]1078-the zulu huts , [they]1072-the huts have doorways through which [men]326-men could walk . Also [they]1072-the huts are much larger , and surrounded by [a verandah about six feet wide , beautifully paved with powdered lime trodden hard]1080-a verandah about six feet wide , beautifully paved with powdered lime trodden hard .

All along each side of [this wide pathway that pierces [the kraal]3268-the kraal]1081-this wide pathway that pierces the kraal were ranged hundreds of [women , brought out by curiosity]1083-women , brought out by curiosity to look at [us]1045-we . [These women]1084-these women , for [a native race]1085-a native race , are exceedingly handsome . [They]1084-these women are tall and graceful , and [their]1084-these women figures are wonderfully fine . The hair , though short , is rather curly than woolly , the features are frequently aquiline , and the lips are not unpleasantly thick , as is the case among [most African races]1086-most african races . But what struck [us]1045-we most was [their]1084-these women exceedingly quiet and dignified air . [They]1084-these women were as well - bred in [their]1084-these women way as the habituées of [a fashionable drawing - room]1087-a fashionable drawing - room , and in this respect [they]1084-these women differ from [Zulu women]1088-zulu women and [[their]1088-zulu women cousins the Masai who inhabit [the district beyond [Zanzibar]69-zanzibar]1090-the district beyond zanzibar]1089-their cousins the masai who inhabit the district beyond zanzibar . [Their]1084-these women curiosity had brought [them]1084-these women out to see [us]1045-we , but [they]1084-these women allowed no rude expressions of astonishment or savage criticism to pass [their]1084-these women lips as [we]1045-we trudged wearily in front of [them]1084-these women . Not even when [old Infadoos]162-infadoos with a surreptitious motion of the hand pointed out the crowning wonder of poor Good 's " beautiful white legs , "[1084-these women] did [they]1084-these women suffer the feeling of intense admiration which evidently mastered [their]1084-these women minds to find expression . [They]1084-these women fixed [their]1084-these women dark eyes upon this new and snowy loveliness , for , as [I]0-i think [I]0-i have said , Good 's skin is exceedingly white , and that was all . But it was quite enough for Good , who is modest by nature .

When [we]1045-we reached [the centre of [the kraal]3268-the kraal]1091-the centre of the kraal , [Infadoos]162-infadoos halted at the door of [a large hut]1093-a large hut , which was surrounded at a distance by a circle of [smaller ones]1094-smaller ones .

" Enter , [Sons of the Stars]3279-sons of the stars , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos said , in a magniloquent voice , " and deign to rest awhile in [[our]1045-we humble habitations]3280-our humble habitations . A little food shall be brought to [you]0-i , so that [ye]0-i may have no need to draw [your]0-i belts tight from hunger ; some honey and some milk , and an ox or two , and a few sheep ; not much , [[my]162-infadoos lords]3091-my lords , but still a little food . "[162-infadoos]

" It is good , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [Infadoos]162-infadoos ; [we]1045-we are weary with travelling through [realms of air]3282-realms of air ; now let [us]1045-we rest . "[0-i]

Accordingly [we]1045-we entered [the hut]1095-the hut , which [we]1045-we found amply prepared for [our]1045-we comfort . Couches of tanned skins were spread for [us]1045-we to lie on , and water was placed for [us]1045-we to wash in .

Presently [we]1045-we heard a shouting outside , and stepping to the door , saw a line of damsels bearing milk and roasted mealies , and honey in a pot . Behind these were some youths driving a fat young ox . [We]1045-we received the gifts , and then one of [the young men]1096-the young men drew the knife from [his]1097-his girdle and dexterously cut the ox 's throat . In ten minutes it was dead , skinned , and jointed . The best of the meat was then cut off for [us]1045-we , and the rest , in the name of [[our]1045-we party]3145-our party , [I]0-i presented to [the warriors round [us]1045-we]1099-the warriors round us , who took it and distributed the " [white lords]3283-white lords ' gift . "[169-ignosi]

[Umbopa]169-ignosi set to work , with the assistance of [an extremely prepossessing young woman]1100-an extremely prepossessing young woman , to boil [our]1045-we portion in a large earthenware pot over a fire which was built outside [the hut]1095-the hut , and when it was nearly ready [we]1045-we sent a message to [Infadoos]162-infadoos , and asked [him]162-infadoos and [Scragga]164-scragga , [[the king]2791-the king 's son]3093-the king 's son , to join [us]1045-we .

Presently [they]1104-they came , and sitting down upon little stools , of which there were several about [the hut]1095-the hut , for [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas do not in general squat upon [their]93-the kukuanas haunches like [the Zulus]1011-the zulus , [they]1104-they helped [us]1045-we to get through [our]1045-we dinner . [The old gentleman]3032-the old gentleman was most affable and polite , but it struck [me]0-i that [the young one]1108-the young one regarded [us]1045-we with doubt . Together with [the rest of [the party]1110-the party]1109-the rest of the party , [he]1108-the young one had been overawed by [our]1045-we white appearance and by [our]1045-we magic properties ; but it seemed to [me]0-i that , on discovering that [we]1045-we ate , drank , and slept like [other mortals]1111-other mortals , [his]1108-the young one awe was beginning to wear off , and to be replaced by a sullen suspicion - which made [me]0-i feel rather uncomfortable .

In the course of [our]1045-we meal [Sir Henry]97-sir henry suggested to [me]0-i that it might be well to try to discover if [[our]1045-we hosts]1112-our hosts knew anything of [[his]97-sir henry brother]376-his brother 's fate , or if [they]1112-our hosts had ever seen or heard of [him]376-his brother ; but , on the whole , [I]0-i thought that it would be wiser to say nothing of the matter at this time . It was difficult to explain a relative lost from " [the Stars]70-the stars . "[162-infadoos]

After supper [we]1045-we produced [our]1045-we pipes and lit them ; a proceeding which filled [Infadoos]162-infadoos and [Scragga]164-scragga with astonishment . [The Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas were evidently unacquainted with the divine delights of tobacco - smoke . The herb is grown among [them]93-the kukuanas extensively ; but , like [the Zulus]1011-the zulus , [they]1011-the zulus use it for snuff only , and quite failed to identify it in its new form .

Presently [I]0-i asked [Infadoos]162-infadoos when [we]1045-we were to proceed on [our]1045-we journey , and was delighted to learn that preparations had been made for [us]1045-we to leave on the following morning , [messengers]1115-messengers having already departed to inform [Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king of [our]1045-we coming .

It appeared that [Twala]165-twala was at [[his]165-twala principal place , known as [Loo]3-loo]1117-his principal place , known as loo , making ready for the great annual feast which was to be held in the first week of June . At this gathering [all the regiments , with the exception of certain detachments left behind for garrison purposes]1118-all the regiments , with the exception of certain detachments left behind for garrison purposes , are brought up and paraded before [the king]2791-the king ; and the great annual witch - hunt , of which more by - and - by , is held .

[We]1045-we were to start at dawn ; and [Infadoos]162-infadoos , who was to accompany [us]1045-we , expected that [we]1045-we should reach [Loo]3-loo on the night of the second day , unless [we]1045-we were detained by accident or by [swollen rivers]1120-swollen rivers .

When [they]1121-they had given [us]1045-we this information [[our]1045-we visitors]1122-our visitors bade [us]1045-we good - night ; and , having arranged to watch turn and turn about , [three of [us]1045-we]1123-three of us flung [ourselves]1045-we down and slept the sweet sleep of the weary , whilst [the fourth]1124-the fourth sat up on the look - out for possible treachery .

CHAPTER IX

[TWALA]64-twala [THE KING]2791-the king

It will not be necessary for [me]0-i to detail at length the incidents of [our]1045-we journey to [Loo]3-loo . It took two full days ' travelling along [Solomon 's Great Road]68-solomon 's great road , which pursued [its]68-solomon 's great road even course right into [the heart of [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland]1126-the heart of kukuanaland . Suffice it to say that as [we]1045-we went [the country]300-the country seemed to grow richer and richer , and the kraals , with [[their]1128-their wide surrounding belts of cultivation]1129-their wide surrounding belts of cultivation , more and more numerous . [They]1128-their were all built upon the same principles as [the first camp which [we]1045-we had reached]1130-the first camp which we had reached , and were guarded by [ample garrisons of [troops]1132-troops]1131-ample garrisons of troops . Indeed , in [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland , as among [the Germans]171-the germans , [the Zulus]114-the zulus , and [the Masai]1133-the masai , [every able - bodied man]1134-every able - bodied man is [a soldier]1135-a soldier , so that [the whole force of [the nation]1137-the nation]1136-the whole force of the nation is available for its wars , offensive or defensive . As [we]1045-we travelled [we]1045-we were overtaken by [thousands of [warriors]3181-warriors hurrying up to [Loo]3-loo to be present at the great annual review and festival , and more splendid troops [I]0-i never saw]1138-thousands of warriors hurrying up to loo to be present at the great annual review and festival , and more splendid troops i never saw .

At sunset on the second day , [we]1045-we stopped to rest awhile upon the summit of some heights over which [the road]2952-the road ran , and there on [a beautiful and fertile plain before [us]1045-we]1141-a beautiful and fertile plain before us lay [Loo]3-loo itself . For [a native town]1142-a native town [it]3-loo is an enormous place , quite five miles round , [I]0-i should say , with outlying kraals projecting from [it]3-loo , that serve on grand occasions as [cantonments for [the regiments]1144-the regiments]1143-cantonments for the regiments , and [a curious horseshoe - shaped hill]1145-a curious horseshoe - shaped hill , with which [we]1045-we were destined to become better acquainted , about [two miles to the north]1146-two miles to the north . [It]3-loo is beautifully situated , and through [the centre of [the kraal]3268-the kraal]1091-the centre of the kraal , dividing [it]3-loo into two portions , runs [a river]1149-a river , which appeared to be bridged in several places , the same indeed that [we]1045-we had seen from [the slopes of [Sheba 's Breasts]61-sheba 's breasts]1150-the slopes of sheba 's breasts . Sixty or seventy miles away [three great snow - capped mountains , placed at the points of a triangle , started out of [the level plain]1152-the level plain]1151-three great snow - capped mountains , placed at the points of a triangle , started out of the level plain . The conformation of [these mountains]1153-these mountains is unlike that of [Sheba 's Breasts]61-sheba 's breasts , being sheer and precipitous , instead of smooth and rounded .

[Infadoos]162-infadoos saw [us]1045-we looking at [them]1153-these mountains , and volunteered a remark .

" [The road]2952-the road ends there , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos said , pointing to [the mountains known among [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]1154-the mountains known among the kukuanas as [the " Three Witches]3285-the " three witches . "[162-infadoos]

" Why does it end ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Who knows ? "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos answered with a shrug ; " [the mountains]2771-the mountains are full of caves , and there is a great pit between [them]2771-the mountains . It is there that [the wise men of old time]3287-the wise men of old time used to go to get whatever it was [they]3287-the wise men of old time came for to [this country]2870-this country , and it is there now that [[our]1045-we kings]3289-our kings are buried in [the Place of]3290-the place of [Death]152-death . "[162-infadoos]

" What was it [they]3287-the wise men of old time came for ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked eagerly .

" Nay , [I]162-infadoos know not . [[My]162-infadoos lords who have dropped from the Stars]3291-my lords who have dropped from the stars should know , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos answered with a quick look . Evidently [he]162-infadoos knew more than [he]162-infadoos chose to say .

" Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i went on , " [you]162-infadoos are right , in [the Stars]3292-the stars [we]1045-we learn many things . [I]0-i have heard , for instance , that [the wise men of old]3293-the wise men of old came to [these mountains]1153-these mountains to find bright stones , pretty playthings , and yellow iron . "[0-i]

" [[My]162-infadoos lord]3088-my lord is wise , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos answered coldly ; " [I]162-infadoos am but [a child]2893-a child and can not talk with [[my]162-infadoos lord]3088-my lord on such matters . [[My]162-infadoos lord]3088-my lord must speak with [Gagool the old]122-gagool , at [[the king]2791-the king 's place]3300-the king 's place , who is wise even as [[my]162-infadoos lord]3088-my lord , "[162-infadoos] and [he]162-infadoos went away .

So soon as [he]162-infadoos was gone [I]0-i turned to [the others]595-the others , and pointed out [the mountains]2771-the mountains . " There are [[Solomon]90-solomon 's diamond mines]3302-solomon 's diamond mines , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

[Umbopa]169-ignosi was standing with them , apparently plunged in one of the fits of abstraction which were common to [him]169-ignosi , and caught [my]0-i words .

" Yes , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi put in , in Zulu , " the diamonds are surely there , and [you]0-i shall have them , since [[you]0-i white men]3303-you white men are so fond of toys and money . "[169-ignosi]

" How dost [thou]169-ignosi know that , [Umbopa]169-ignosi ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked sharply , for [I]0-i did not like [his]169-ignosi mysterious ways .

[He]169-ignosi laughed . " [I]169-ignosi dreamed it in the night , [white men]2713-white men ; "[169-ignosi] then [he]169-ignosi too turned on [his]169-ignosi heel and went .

" Now what , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , " is [[our]3305-our black friend]3306-our black friend driving at ? [He]3306-our black friend knows more than [he]3306-our black friend chooses to say , that is clear . By the way , [Quatermain]107-quatermain , has [he]3306-our black friend heard anything of - of [[my]97-sir henry brother]2648-my brother ? "[97-sir henry]

" Nothing ; [he]3306-our black friend has asked [everyone]3308-everyone [he]3306-our black friend has become friendly with , but [they]3308-everyone all declare that [no white man]3309-no white man has ever been seen in [the country]300-the country before . "[169-ignosi]

" Do [you]98-good suppose that [he]3306-our black friend got [here]2924-here at all ? "[98-good] suggested [Good]98-good ; " [we]3312-we have only reached [the place]3034-the place by a miracle ; is it likely [he]3306-our black friend could have reached [it]3034-the place without the map ? "[98-good]

" [I]97-sir henry do n't know , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry gloomily , " but somehow [I]97-sir henry think that [I]97-sir henry shall find [him]3306-our black friend . "[97-sir henry]

Slowly the sun sank , then suddenly darkness rushed down on [the land]3165-the land like a tangible thing . There was no breathing - space between the day and night , no soft transformation scene , for in these latitudes twilight does not exist . The change from day to night is as quick and as absolute as the change from life to death . The sun sank and [the world]248-the world was wreathed in shadows . But not for long , for see in the west there is a glow , then come rays of silver light , and at last the full and glorious moon lights up [the plain]725-the plain and shoots its gleaming arrows far and wide , filling [the earth]632-the earth with a faint refulgence .

[We]1161-we stood and watched the lovely sight , whilst the stars grew pale before this chastened majesty , and felt [our]1161-we hearts lifted up in the presence of a beauty that [I]0-i can not describe . [Mine]0-i has been a rough life , but there are a few things [I]0-i am thankful to have lived for , and one of them is to have seen that moon shine over [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland .

Presently [our]1161-we meditations were broken in upon by [[our]1161-we polite friend [Infadoos]162-infadoos]1162-our polite friend infadoos .

" If [[my]1161-we lords]3091-my lords are rested [we]1161-we will journey on to [Loo]3-loo , where [a hut]3216-a hut is made ready for [[my]1161-we lords]3091-my lords to - night . The moon is now bright , so that [we]1161-we shall not fall by the way . "[1161-we]

[We]1161-we assented , and in an hour 's time were at [the outskirts of [the town]1164-the town]1163-the outskirts of the town , of which the extent , mapped out as it was by thousands of camp fires , appeared absolutely endless . Indeed , [Good , who is always fond of a bad joke]1165-good , who is always fond of a bad joke , christened it " [Unlimited Loo]72-unlimited loo . "[1165-good , who is always fond of a bad joke] Soon [we]1161-we came to a moat with a drawbridge , where [we]1161-we were met by the rattling of arms and the hoarse challenge of [a sentry]1166-a sentry . [Infadoos]162-infadoos gave some password that [I]0-i could not catch , which was met with a salute , and [we]1161-we passed on through [the central street of [the great grass city]1168-the great grass city]1167-the central street of the great grass city . After nearly half an hour 's tramp , past endless lines of [huts]1169-huts , [Infadoos]162-infadoos halted at last by the gate of a little group of huts which surrounded [a small courtyard of powdered limestone]1170-a small courtyard of powdered limestone , and informed [us]1161-we that these were to be [[our]1161-we " poor "[162-infadoos] quarters]1171-our " poor " quarters .

[We]1161-we entered , and found that [a hut]3216-a hut had been assigned to [each of [us]1161-we]2907-each of us . [These huts]1174-these huts were superior to any that [we]1161-we had yet seen , and in each was a most comfortable bed made of tanned skins , spread upon mattresses of aromatic grass . Food too was ready for [us]1161-we , and so soon as [we]1161-we had washed [ourselves]1161-we with water , which stood ready in earthenware jars , [some young women of handsome appearance]1175-some young women of handsome appearance brought [us]1161-we roasted meats , and mealie cobs daintily served on wooden platters , and presented [them]1176-them to [us]1161-we with deep obeisances .

[We]1161-we ate and drank , and then , the beds having been all moved into [one hut]1177-one hut by [our]1161-we request , a precaution at which [the amiable young ladies]1178-the amiable young ladies smiled , [we]1161-we flung [ourselves]1161-we down to sleep , thoroughly wearied with [our]1161-we long journey .

When [we]1161-we woke it was to find the sun high in the heavens , and [the female attendants , who did not seem to be troubled by any false shame , already standing inside [the hut]1095-the hut]1179-the female attendants , who did not seem to be troubled by any false shame , already standing inside the hut , having been ordered to attend and help [us]1161-we to " make ready . "[2791-the king]

" Make ready , indeed , "[98-good] growled [Good]98-good ; " when one has only a flannel shirt and a pair of boots , that does not take long . [I]98-good wish [you]1182-the young ladies would ask [them]1178-the amiable young ladies for [my]98-good trousers , [Quatermain]107-quatermain . "[98-good]

[I]0-i asked accordingly , but was informed that these sacred relics had already been taken to [the king]2791-the king , who would see [us]1161-we in the forenoon .

Somewhat to [their]1178-the amiable young ladies astonishment and disappointment , having requested [the young ladies]1182-the young ladies to step outside , [we]1161-we proceeded to make the best toilet of which [the circumstances]1183-the circumstances admitted . Good even went the length of again shaving the right side of [his]2791-the king face ; the left , on which now appeared a very fair crop of whiskers , [we]1161-we impressed upon [him]2791-the king [he]2791-the king must on no account touch . As for [ourselves]1161-we , [we]1161-we were contented with a good wash and combing [our]1161-we hair . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's yellow locks were now almost upon [his]2791-the king shoulders , and [he]2791-the king looked more like [an ancient Dane than ever]1184-an ancient dane than ever , while [my]0-i grizzled scrub was fully an inch long , instead of half an inch , which in a general way [I]0-i considered [my]0-i maximum length .

By the time that [we]1161-we had eaten [our]1161-we breakfast , and smoked a pipe , a message was brought to [us]1161-we by no less a personage than [Infadoos]162-infadoos [himself]162-infadoos that Twala [the king]2791-the king was ready to see [us]1161-we , if [we]1161-we would be pleased to come .

[We]1161-we remarked in reply that [we]1161-we should prefer to wait till the sun was a little higher , [we]1161-we were yet weary with [our]1161-we journey , c. , c. It is always well , when dealing with [uncivilised people]1186-uncivilised people , not to be in too great a hurry . [They]1186-uncivilised people are apt to mistake politeness for awe or servility . So , although [we]1161-we were quite as anxious to see [Twala]165-twala as [Twala]165-twala could be to see [us]1161-we , [we]1161-we sat down and waited for an hour , employing the interval in preparing such presents as [our]1161-we slender stock of goods permitted - namely , the Winchester rifle which had been used by [poor Ventv"gel]151-ventv"gel , and some beads . The rifle and ammunition [we]1161-we determined to present to [[his]2791-the king royal highness]3317-his royal highness , and the beads were for [[his]2791-the king wives]3318-his wives and [courtiers]3319-courtiers . [We]1161-we had already given a few to [Infadoos]162-infadoos and [Scragga]164-scragga , and found that [they]3320-they were delighted with [them]3320-they , never having seen such things before . At length [we]1161-we declared that [we]1161-we were ready , and guided by [Infadoos]162-infadoos , started off to [the audience]981-the audience , [Umbopa]169-ignosi carrying the rifle and beads .[165-twala]

After walking a few hundred yards [we]1161-we came to an enclosure , something like that surrounding [the huts which had been allotted to [us]1161-we]1187-the huts which had been allotted to us , only fifty times as big , for [it]1188-it could not have covered less than six or seven acres of ground . All round the outside fence stood a row of huts , which were the habitations of [[the king]2791-the king 's wives]1190-the king 's wives . Exactly opposite the gateway , on the further side of [the open space]1191-the open space , was a very large hut , built by [itself]1192-itself , in which [[his]2791-the king majesty]1193-his majesty resided . All the rest was open ground ; that is to say , [it]1194-it would have been open had [it]1194-it not been filled by [company]1195-company after company of [warriors , who were mustered there to the number of seven or eight thousand]1196-warriors , who were mustered there to the number of seven or eight thousand . [These men]1197-these men stood still as statues as [we]1161-we advanced through [them]1197-these men , and it would be impossible to give an adequate idea of the grandeur of the spectacle which [they]1197-these men presented , with [their]1197-these men waving plumes , [their]1197-these men glancing spears , and iron - backed ox - hide shields .

[The space in front of [the large hut]1199-the large hut]1198-the space in front of the large hut was empty , but before it were placed several stools . On three of these , at a sign from [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [we]1161-we seated [ourselves]1161-we , [Umbopa]169-ignosi standing behind [us]1161-we . As for [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [he]169-ignosi took up a position by the door of [the hut]1095-the hut . So [we]1161-we waited for ten minutes or more in the midst of a dead silence , but conscious that [we]1161-we were the object of the concentrated gaze of some eight thousand pairs of eyes . It was a somewhat trying ordeal , but [we]1161-we carried it off as best [we]1161-we could . At length the door of [the hut]1095-the hut opened , and a gigantic figure , with a splendid tiger - skin karross flung over its shoulders , stepped out , followed by [the boy Scragga]1202-the boy scragga , and what appeared to [us]1161-we to be a withered - up monkey , wrapped in a fur cloak . [The figure]2745-the figure seated itself upon a stool , [Scragga]164-scragga took [his]164-scragga stand behind it , and [the withered - up monkey]1204-the withered - up monkey crept on all fours into the shade of [the hut]1095-the hut and squatted down .

Still there was silence .

Then [the gigantic figure]1206-the gigantic figure slipped off the karross and stood up before [us]1161-we , a truly alarming spectacle . It was that of [an enormous man with the most entirely repulsive countenance [we]1161-we had ever beheld]1207-an enormous man with the most entirely repulsive countenance we had ever beheld . [This man]532-this man 's lips were as thick as a Negro 's , the nose was flat , [he]532-this man had but one gleaming black eye , for the other was represented by a hollow in the face , and [his]532-this man whole expression was cruel and sensual to a degree . From the large head rose a magnificent plume of white ostrich feathers , [his]532-this man body was clad in a shirt of shining chain armour , whilst round the waist and right knee were the usual garnishes of white ox - tail . In [his]532-this man right hand was a huge spear , about the neck a thick torque of gold , and bound on the forehead shone dully a single and enormous uncut diamond .

Still there was silence ; but not for long . Presently [the man]371-the man , whom [we]1161-we rightly guessed to be [the king]2791-the king , raised the great javelin in [his]532-this man hand . Instantly eight thousand spears were lifted in answer , and from eight thousand throats rang out the royal salute of " Koom . "[371-the man] Three times this was repeated , and each time [the earth]632-the earth shook with the noise , that can only be compared to the deepest notes of thunder .

" Be humble , [O people]3322-o people , "[371-the man] piped out a thin voice which seemed to come from the monkey in the shade , " it is [the king]2791-the king . "[371-the man]

" It is [the king]2791-the king , "[165-twala] boomed out the eight thousand throats in answer . " Be humble , [O people]3322-o people , it is [the king]2791-the king . "[165-twala]

Then there was silence again - dead silence . Presently , however , it was broken . [A soldier on]1212-a soldier on [our]1161-we left dropped [his]1212-a soldier on shield , which fell with a clatter on to the limestone flooring .

[Twala]165-twala turned [his]165-twala one cold eye in the direction of the noise .

" Come hither , [thou]3327-thou , "[165-twala] [he]165-twala said , in a cold voice .

[A fine young man]1213-a fine young man stepped out of the ranks , and stood before [him]1213-a fine young man .

" It was [thy]1213-a fine young man shield that fell , [thou]1213-a fine young man awkward dog . Wilt [thou]3327-thou make [me]1213-a fine young man a reproach in the eyes of [these strangers from the Stars]3328-these strangers from the stars ? What hast [thou]3327-thou to say for [thyself]1213-a fine young man ? "[1213-a fine young man]

[We]1161-we saw [the poor fellow]1214-the poor fellow turn pale under [his]1214-the poor fellow dusky skin .

" It was by chance , [O Calf of [the Black Cow]3330-the black cow]3329-o calf of the black cow , "[1214-the poor fellow] [he]1214-the poor fellow murmured .

" Then it is a chance for which [thou]3327-thou must pay . [Thou]3327-thou hast made [me]1214-the poor fellow foolish ; prepare for death . "[1214-the poor fellow]

" [I]164-scragga am [the king]2791-the king 's ox , "[164-scragga] was the low answer .

" [Scragga]164-scragga , "[2791-the king] roared [the king]2791-the king , " let [me]2791-the king see how [thou]3327-thou canst use [thy]3327-thou spear . Kill [me]2791-the king [this blundering fool]3332-this blundering fool . "[2791-the king]

[Scragga]164-scragga stepped forward with an ill - favoured grin , and lifted [his]164-scragga spear . [The poor victim]1216-the poor victim covered [his]1216-the poor victim eyes with [his]1216-the poor victim hand and stood still . As for [us]1217-we , [we]1217-we were petrified with horror .

" Once , twice , "[2791-the king] [he]2791-the king waved the spear , and then struck , ah ! right home - the spear stood out a foot behind [the soldier]1218-the soldier 's back . [He]1216-the poor victim flung up [his]1216-the poor victim hands and dropped dead . From the multitude about [us]1217-we rose something like a murmur , it rolled round and round , and died away . The tragedy was finished ; there lay the corpse , and [we]1217-we had not yet realised that it had been enacted . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry sprang up and swore a great oath , then , overpowered by the sense of silence , sat down again .

" The thrust was a good one , "[2791-the king] said [the king]2791-the king ; " take [him]1221-the murdered man away . "[2791-the king]

[Four men]1220-four men stepped out of the ranks , and lifting the body of [the murdered man]1221-the murdered man , carried it thence .

" Cover up the blood - stains , cover them up , "[1222-the monkey - like figure] piped out the thin voice that proceeded from [the monkey - like figure]1222-the monkey - like figure ; " [the king]2791-the king 's word is spoken , [the king]2791-the king 's doom is done ! "[1222-the monkey - like figure]

Thereupon [a girl]720-a girl came forward from behind [the hut]1095-the hut , bearing a jar filled with powdered lime , which [she]720-a girl scattered over the red mark , blotting it from sight .

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry meanwhile was boiling with rage at what had happened ; indeed , it was with difficulty that [we]1217-we could keep [him]97-sir henry still .

" Sit down , for heaven 's sake , "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered ; " [our]1217-we lives depend on it . "[0-i]

[He]97-sir henry yielded and remained quiet .

[Twala]165-twala sat silent until the traces of the tragedy had been removed , then [he]165-twala addressed [us]1217-we .

" [White people]3335-white people , "[165-twala] [he]165-twala said , " who come hither , whence [I]165-twala know not , and why [I]165-twala know not , greeting . "[165-twala]

" Greeting , [Twala]165-twala , [King of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]3336-king of the kukuanas , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" [White people]3335-white people , whence come [ye]3335-white people , and what seek [ye]3335-white people ? "[165-twala]

" [We]1217-we come from [the Stars]70-the stars , ask [us]1217-we not how . [We]1217-we come to see [this land]3338-this land . "[165-twala]

" [Ye]3335-white people journey from far to see a little thing . And [that man with [you]3335-white people]3339-that man with you , "[165-twala] pointing to [Umbopa]169-ignosi , " does [he]3339-that man with you also come from [the Stars]70-the stars ? "[165-twala]

" Even so ; there are [people of]3340-people of [thy]3335-white people colour in the heavens above ; but ask not of matters too high for [thee]3335-white people , [Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king . "[165-twala]

" [Ye]3335-white people speak with a loud voice , [people of the Stars]3342-people of the stars , "[165-twala] [Twala]165-twala answered in a tone which [I]0-i scarcely liked . " Remember that [the Stars]70-the stars are far off , and [ye]3335-white people are here . How if [I]165-twala make [you]3335-white people as [him]3339-that man with you whom [they]3342-people of the stars bore away ? "[165-twala]

[I]0-i laughed out loud , though there was little laughter in [my]0-i heart .

" [O king]3343-o king , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " be careful , walk warily over hot stones , lest [thou]3335-white people shouldst burn [thy]3335-white people feet ; hold the spear by the handle , lest [thou]3335-white people should cut [thy]3335-white people hands . Touch but one hair of [our]3344-we heads , and destruction shall come upon [thee]3335-white people . What , have not these "[0-i] - pointing to [Infadoos]162-infadoos and [Scragga]164-scragga , who , [young villain that [he]164-scragga was]1225-young villain that he was , was employed in cleaning the blood of [the soldier]1218-the soldier off [his]164-scragga spear - " told [thee]3335-white people what manner of [men]326-men [we]3344-we are ? Hast [thou]3335-white people seen the like of [us]3344-we ? "[0-i] and [I]0-i pointed to [Good]98-good , feeling quite sure that [he]98-good had never seen [anybody]2621-anybody before who looked in the least like [him]98-good as [he]98-good then appeared .

" It is true , [I]2791-the king have not , "[2791-the king] said [the king]2791-the king , surveying [Good]98-good with interest .

" Have [they]326-men not told [thee]3335-white people how [we]3344-we strike with death from afar ? "[0-i] [I]0-i went on .

" [They]326-men have told [me]2791-the king , but [I]2791-the king believe [them]326-men not . Let [me]2791-the king see [you]2791-the king kill . Kill [me]2791-the king a man among [those who stand yonder]3346-those who stand yonder "[2791-the king] - and [he]2791-the king pointed to [the opposite side of [the kraal]3268-the kraal]1229-the opposite side of the kraal - " and [I]2791-the king will believe . "[2791-the king]

" Nay , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " [we]3344-we shed no blood of [men]326-men except in just punishment ; but if [thou]3348-thou wilt see , bid [[thy]3348-thou servants]3349-thy servants drive in an ox through the kraal gates , and before [he]3350-he has run twenty paces [I]0-i will strike [him]3350-he dead . "[0-i]

" Nay , "[2791-the king] laughed [the king]2791-the king , " kill [me]2791-the king [a man]2655-a man and [I]2791-the king will believe . "[2791-the king]

" Good , [O king]3343-o king , so be it , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered coolly ; " do [thou]3348-thou walk across [the open space]1191-the open space , and before [thy]3348-thou feet reach the gate [thou]3348-thou shalt be dead ; or if [thou]3348-thou wilt not , send [[thy]3348-thou son]3354-thy son [Scragga]164-scragga "[0-i] whom at that moment it would have given [me]0-i much pleasure to shoot .

On hearing this suggestion [Scragga]164-scragga uttered a sort of howl , and bolted into [the hut]1095-the hut .

[Twala]165-twala frowned majestically ; the suggestion did not please [him]165-twala .

" Let [a young ox]3355-a young ox be driven in , "[165-twala] [he]165-twala said .

[Two men]1233-two men at once departed , running swiftly .

" Now , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " do [you]97-sir henry shoot . [I]0-i want to show [this ruffian]3356-this ruffian that [I]0-i am not [the only magician of [the party]1110-the party]3357-the only magician of the party . "[0-i]

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry accordingly took [his]97-sir henry " express , "[165-twala] and made ready .

" [I]97-sir henry hope [I]97-sir henry shall make a good shot , "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry groaned .

" [You]97-sir henry must , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " If [you]97-sir henry miss with the first barrel , let [him]3356-this ruffian have the second . Sight for 150 yards , and wait till the beast turns broadside on . "[0-i]

Then came a pause , until presently [we]1234-we caught sight of an ox running straight for the kraal gate . [It]1235-it came on through the gate , then , catching sight of [the vast concourse of [people]1237-people]1236-the vast concourse of people , stopped stupidly , turned round , and bellowed .

" Now 's [your]97-sir henry time , "[0-i] [I]0-i whispered .

Up went the rifle .

Bang ! thud ! and the ox was kicking on [his]1235-it back , shot in the ribs . The semi - hollow bullet had done its work well , and a sigh of astonishment went up from [the assembled thousands]1238-the assembled thousands .

[I]0-i turned round coolly -

" Have [I]0-i lied , [O king]3343-o king ? "[0-i]

" Nay , [white man]3360-white man , it is the truth , "[0-i] was the somewhat awed answer .

" Listen , [Twala]165-twala , "[0-i] [I]0-i went on . " [Thou]3361-thou hast seen . Now know [we]1234-we come in peace , not in war . See , "[0-i] and [I]0-i held up the Winchester repeater ; " here is a hollow staff that shall enable [thee]97-sir henry to kill even as [we]1234-we kill , only [I]0-i lay this charm upon it , [thou]3361-thou shalt kill [no man with it]3362-no man with it . If [thou]3361-thou liftest it against [a man]2655-a man , it shall kill [thee]97-sir henry . Stay , [I]0-i will show [thee]97-sir henry . Bid [a soldier]1135-a soldier step forty paces and place the shaft of a spear in the ground so that the flat blade looks towards [us]1234-we . "[0-i]

In a few seconds it was done .

" Now , see , [I]0-i will break yonder spear . "[0-i]

Taking a careful sight [I]0-i fired . The bullet struck the flat of the spear , and shattered the blade into fragments .

Again the sigh of astonishment went up .

" Now , [Twala]165-twala , [we]1234-we give this magic tube to [thee]97-sir henry , and by - and - by [I]0-i will show [thee]97-sir henry how to use it ; but beware how [thou]97-sir henry turnest the magic of the Stars against [a man of earth]3365-a man of earth , "[0-i] and [I]0-i handed [him]1239-him the rifle .

[The king]2791-the king took it very gingerly , and laid it down at [his]2791-the king feet . As [he]2791-the king did so [I]0-i observed the wizened monkey - like figure creeping from the shadow of [the hut]1095-the hut . It crept on all fours , but when it reached the place where [the king]2791-the king sat it rose upon [its]1243-i feet , and throwing the furry covering from [its]1243-i face , revealed [a most extraordinary and weird countenance]1244-a most extraordinary and weird countenance . Apparently it was that of [a woman of great age so shrunken that in size it seemed no larger than the face of a year - old child , although made up of a number of deep and yellow wrinkles]1245-a woman of great age so shrunken that in size it seemed no larger than the face of a year - old child , although made up of a number of deep and yellow wrinkles . Set in these wrinkles was a sunken slit , that represented the mouth , beneath which the chin curved outwards to a point . There was no nose to speak of ; indeed , the visage might have been taken for that of a sun - dried corpse had it not been for a pair of large black eyes , still full of fire and intelligence , which gleamed and played under the snow - white eyebrows , and the projecting parchment - coloured skull , like jewels in [a charnel - house]1246-a charnel - house . As for the head itself , it was perfectly bare , and yellow in hue , while its wrinkled scalp moved and contracted like the hood of a cobra .

The figure to which [this fearful countenance]1247-this fearful countenance belonged , a countenance so fearful indeed that it caused a shiver of fear to pass through [us]1248-us as [we]1248-us gazed on it , stood still for a moment . Then suddenly [it]1243-i projected a skinny claw armed with nails nearly an inch long , and laying it on the shoulder of [Twala the king]1249-twala the king , began to speak in a thin and piercing voice -

" Listen , [O king]3343-o king ! Listen , [O warriors]3367-o warriors ! Listen , [O mountains]3368-o mountains and [plains and rivers]3369-plains and rivers , [home of [the Kukuana race]3371-the kukuana race]3370-home of the kukuana race ! Listen , O skies and sun , O rain and storm and mist ! Listen , [O men]3372-o men and [women]3373-women , [O youths]3374-o youths and [maidens]3375-maidens , and O [ye]3376-ye babes unborn ! Listen , [all things that live and must die]3377-all things that live and must die ! Listen , all dead things that shall live again - again to die ! Listen , the spirit of life is in [me]1243-i and [I]1243-i prophesy . [I]1243-i prophesy ! [I]1243-i prophesy ! "[1243-i]

The words died away in a faint wail , and dread seemed to seize upon the hearts of all who heard them , including [our]1248-us own . [This old woman]1250-this old woman was very terrible .

" Blood ! blood ! blood ! rivers of blood ; blood everywhere . [I]1253-i see it , [I]1253-i smell it , [I]1253-i taste it - it is salt ! it runs red upon the ground , it rains down from the skies .[1253-i]

" Footsteps ! footsteps ! footsteps ! the tread of [the white man coming from afar]3378-the white man coming from afar . It shakes [the earth]632-the earth ; [the earth]632-the earth trembles before [[her]1250-this old woman master]3381-her master .[1253-i]

" Blood is good , the red blood is bright ; there is no smell like the smell of new - shed blood . The lions shall lap it and roar , the vultures shall wash [their]3382-their wings in it and shriek with joy .[1253-i]

" [I]1251-i am old ! [I]1251-i am old ! [I]1251-i have seen much blood ; ha , ha ! but [I]1251-i shall see more ere [I]1251-i die , and be merry . How old am [I]1251-i , think [ye]3383-ye ? [[Your]3383-ye fathers]3384-your fathers knew [me]1251-i , and [[their]3384-your fathers fathers]3385-their fathers knew [me]1251-i , and [[[their]3384-your fathers fathers]3385-their fathers ' fathers ' fathers]3387-their fathers ' fathers ' fathers . [I]1251-i have seen [the white man]243-the white man and know [his]243-the white man desires . [I]1251-i am old , but [the mountains]2771-the mountains are older than [I.]1251-i Who made [the great road]3117-the great road , tell [me]1251-i ? Who wrote the pictures on the rocks , tell [me]1251-i ? Who reared up the three Silent Ones yonder , that gaze across [the pit]3391-the pit , tell [me]1251-i ? "[1251-i] and [she]1251-i pointed towards the three precipitous mountains which [we]1252-we had noticed on the previous night .

" [Ye]3392-ye know not , but [I]1251-i know . It was [a white people who were before [ye]3392-ye are , who shall be when [ye]3392-ye are not , who shall eat [you]3392-ye up and destroy [you]3392-ye . Yea ! yea ! yea ![1251-i]

" And what came [they]3393-a white people who were before ye are , who shall be when ye are not , who shall eat you up and destroy you . yea ! yea ! yea ! " and what came they for for]3393-a white people who were before ye are , who shall be when ye are not , who shall eat you up and destroy you . yea ! yea ! yea ! " and what came they for , [the White Ones]172-the white ones , [the Terrible Ones]3394-the terrible ones , [the skilled in magic and all learning]3395-the skilled in magic and all learning , the strong , the unswerving ? What is that bright stone upon [thy]3392-ye forehead , [O king]3343-o king ? Whose hands made the iron garments upon [thy]3392-ye breast , [O king]3343-o king ? [Ye]3392-ye know not , but [I]1253-i know . [I]1253-i the Old One , [I]1253-i [the Wise One]173-the wise one , [I]1253-i [the Isanusi]3398-the isanusi , [the witch doctress]3399-the witch doctress ! "[1253-i]

Then [she]1253-i turned [her]1253-i bald vulture - head towards [us]1254-us .

" What seek [ye]3392-ye , [white men of [the Stars]70-the stars]3400-white men of the stars - ah , yes , of [the Stars]70-the stars ? Do [ye]3392-ye seek a lost one ? [Ye]3392-ye shall not find [him]3401-he here . [He]3401-he is not here . Never for ages upon ages has a white foot pressed [this land]3338-this land ; never except once , and [I]1253-i remember that [he]3401-he left it but to die . [Ye]3392-ye come for bright stones ; [I]1253-i know it - [I]1253-i know it ; [ye]3392-ye shall find them when the blood is dry ; but shall [ye]3392-ye return whence [ye]3392-ye came , or shall [ye]3392-ye stop with [me]1253-i ? Ha ! ha ! ha ![1253-i]

" And [thou]3403-thou , [thou]3403-thou with the dark skin and the proud bearing , "[1255-she] and [she]1255-she pointed [her]1255-she skinny finger at [Umbopa]169-ignosi , " who art [thou]3403-thou , and what seekest [thou]3403-thou ? Not stones that shine , not yellow metal that gleams , these [thou]3403-thou leavest to ' [white men from [the Stars]70-the stars]3404-white men from the stars . ' Methinks [I]1255-she know [thee]3403-thou ; methinks [I]1255-she can smell the smell of the blood in [thy]3403-thou heart . Strip off the girdle - "[1255-she]

Here the features of [this extraordinary creature]1256-this extraordinary creature became convulsed , and [she]1255-she fell to the ground foaming in an epileptic fit , and was carried into [the hut]1095-the hut .

[The king]2791-the king rose up trembling , and waved [his]2791-the king hand . Instantly [the regiments]1144-the regiments began to file off , and in ten minutes , save for [ourselves]1260-we , [the king]2791-the king , and [a few attendants]1262-a few attendants , [the great space]1263-the great space was left empty .

" [White people]3335-white people , "[2791-the king] [he]2791-the king said , " it passes in [my]2791-the king mind to kill [you]3335-white people . [Gagool]122-gagool has spoken strange words . What say [ye]3335-white people ? "[2791-the king]

[I]0-i laughed . " Be careful , [O king]3343-o king , [we]1260-we are not easy to slay . [Thou]3407-thou hast seen the fate of the ox ; wouldst [thou]3407-thou be as the ox is ? "[0-i]

[The king]2791-the king frowned . " It is not well to threaten [a king]3408-a king . "[2791-the king]

" [We]1260-we threaten not , [we]1260-we speak what is true . Try to kill [us]1260-we , [O king]3343-o king , and learn . "[2791-the king]

[The great savage]1265-the great savage put [his]1265-the great savage hand to [his]1265-the great savage forehead and thought .

" Go in peace , "[2791-the king] [he]2791-the king said at length . " To - night is the great dance . [Ye]3410-ye shall see it . Fear not that [I]2791-the king shall set a snare for [you]3410-ye . To - morrow [I]2791-the king will think . "[2791-the king]

" It is well , [O king]3343-o king , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered unconcernedly , and then , accompanied by [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [we]1266-we rose and went back to [[our]1266-we kraal]1267-our kraal .

CHAPTER X

[THE WITCH - HUNT]1268-the witch - hunt

On reaching [[our]1266-we hut]1269-our hut [I]0-i motioned to [Infadoos]162-infadoos to enter with [us]1266-we .

" Now , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [we]1266-we would speak with [thee]162-infadoos . "[0-i]

" Let [[my]1268-the witch - hunt lords]3091-my lords say on . "[1268-the witch - hunt]

" It seems to [us]1266-we , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , that [Twala]64-twala [the king]2791-the king is [a cruel man]3414-a cruel man . "[0-i]

" It is so , [[my]1268-the witch - hunt lords]3091-my lords . Alas ! [the land]3165-the land cries out because of [his]2791-the king cruelties . To - night [ye]3417-ye shall see . It is the great witch - hunt , and [many]3418-many will be smelt out as [wizards]3104-wizards and slain . [No man]3209-no man 's life is safe . If [the king]2791-the king covets [a man]2655-a man 's cattle , or [[a man]2655-a man 's wife]3424-a man 's wife , or if [he]2791-the king fears [a man]2655-a man that [he]2791-the king should excite a rebellion against [him]2791-the king , then [Gagool]122-gagool , whom [ye]3417-ye saw , or [some of [the witch - finding women whom [she]122-gagool has taught]3427-the witch - finding women whom she has taught]3426-some of the witch - finding women whom she has taught , will smell [that man]3428-that man out as [a wizard]3429-a wizard , and [he]3428-that man will be killed . [Many]3418-many must die before the moon grows pale to - night . It is ever so . Perhaps [I]1268-the witch - hunt too shall be killed . As yet [I]1268-the witch - hunt have been spared because [I]1268-the witch - hunt am skilled in war , and am beloved by [the soldiers]3431-the soldiers ; but [I]1268-the witch - hunt know not how long [I]1268-the witch - hunt have to live . [The land]3165-the land groans at the cruelties of [Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king ; it is wearied of [him]2791-the king and [his]2791-the king red ways . "[1268-the witch - hunt]

" Then why is it , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , that [the people]3142-the people do not cast [him]2791-the king down ? "[0-i]

" Nay , [[my]1268-the witch - hunt lords]3091-my lords , [he]2791-the king is [the king]2791-the king , and if [he]2791-the king were killed [Scragga]164-scragga would reign in [his]2791-the king place , and the heart of [Scragga]164-scragga is blacker than the heart of [Twala]165-twala [[his]164-scragga father]678-his father . If [Scragga]164-scragga were [king]554-king [his]164-scragga yoke upon [our]1270-thou neck would be heavier than the yoke of [Twala]165-twala . If [Imotu]168-imotu had never been slain , or if [Ignosi]169-ignosi [[his]168-imotu son]3439-his son had lived , it might have been otherwise ; but [they]3440-they are both dead . "[1268-the witch - hunt]

" How knowest [thou]1270-thou that [Ignosi]169-ignosi is dead ? "[0-i] said a voice behind [us]1270-thou . [We]1270-thou looked round astonished to see who spoke . It was [Umbopa]169-ignosi .

" What meanest [thou]1270-thou , [boy]2814-boy ? "[162-infadoos] asked [Infadoos]162-infadoos ; " who told [thee]1270-thou to speak ? "[162-infadoos]

" Listen , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , "[1268-the witch - hunt] was the answer , " and [I]1268-the witch - hunt will tell [thee]1270-thou a story . Years ago [the king Imotu]3214-the king imotu was killed in [this country]2870-this country and [[his]3214-the king imotu wife]3235-his wife fled with [the boy Ignosi]3445-the boy ignosi . Is it not so ? "[1268-the witch - hunt]

" It is so . "[162-infadoos]

" It was said that [the woman]3446-the woman and [[her]3446-the woman son]3245-her son died upon [the mountains]2771-the mountains . Is it not so ? "[1268-the witch - hunt]

" It is even so . "[162-infadoos]

" Well , it came to pass that [the mother]3449-the mother and [the boy Ignosi]3445-the boy ignosi did not die . [They]3451-they crossed [the mountains]2771-the mountains and were led by [a tribe of wandering desert men]3453-a tribe of wandering desert men across [the sands beyond]3454-the sands beyond , till at last [they]3451-they came to water and grass and trees again . "[1268-the witch - hunt]

" How knowest [thou]1270-thou this ? "[162-infadoos]

" Listen . [They]3451-they travelled on and on , many months ' journey , till [they]3451-they reached [a land where [a people called the Amazulu , who also are of [the Kukuana stock]3457-the kukuana stock]3456-a people called the amazulu , who also are of the kukuana stock]3455-a land where a people called the amazulu , who also are of the kukuana stock , live by war , and with [them]3456-a people called the amazulu , who also are of the kukuana stock [they]3451-they tarried many years , till at length [the mother]3449-the mother died . Then [the son Ignosi]3459-the son ignosi became [a wanderer]3460-a wanderer again , and journeyed into [a land of wonders]3461-a land of wonders , where [white people]3335-white people live , and for many more years [he]3459-the son ignosi learned the wisdom of [the white people]3463-the white people . "[1268-the witch - hunt]

" It is a pretty story , "[162-infadoos] said [Infadoos]162-infadoos incredulously .

" For years [he]3459-the son ignosi lived [there]2626-there working as [a servant]3465-a servant and [a soldier]1135-a soldier , but holding in [his]3459-the son ignosi heart all that [[his]3459-the son ignosi mother]3467-his mother had told [him]3459-the son ignosi of [[his]3459-the son ignosi own place]3468-his own place , and casting about in [his]3459-the son ignosi mind to find how [he]3459-the son ignosi might journey thither to see [[his]3459-the son ignosi people]676-his people and [[[his]3459-the son ignosi father]678-his father 's house]3471-his father 's house before [he]3459-the son ignosi died . For long years [he]3459-the son ignosi lived and waited , and at last the time came , as it ever comes to [him]3459-the son ignosi who can wait for it , and [he]3459-the son ignosi met [some white men who would seek [this unknown land]3473-this unknown land , and joined [himself]3459-the son ignosi to [them]3472-some white men who would seek this unknown land , and joined himself to them]3472-some white men who would seek this unknown land , and joined himself to them . [The white men]3474-the white men started and travelled on and on , seeking for one who is lost . [They]3474-the white men crossed [the burning desert]682-the burning desert , [they]3474-the white men crossed [the snow - clad mountains]3476-the snow - clad mountains , and at last reached [the land of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]3073-the land of the kukuanas , and there [they]3474-the white men found [thee]3478-thee , O [Infadoos]162-infadoos . "[1268-the witch - hunt]

" Surely [thou]3478-thee art mad to talk thus , "[1271-the astonished old soldier] said [the astonished old soldier]1271-the astonished old soldier .

" [Thou]3478-thee thinkest so ; see , [I]1268-the witch - hunt will show [thee]3478-thee , O [[my]1268-the witch - hunt uncle]3102-my uncle .[1268-the witch - hunt]

" [I]1268-the witch - hunt am [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [rightful king of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]3480-rightful king of the kukuanas ! "[1268-the witch - hunt]

Then with a single movement [Umbopa]169-ignosi slipped off [his]169-ignosi " moocha "[1268-the witch - hunt] or girdle , and stood naked before [us]1272-us .

" Look , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi said ; " what is this ? "[169-ignosi] and [he]169-ignosi pointed to the picture of a great snake tattooed in blue round [his]169-ignosi middle , its tail disappearing into its open mouth just above where the thighs are set into the body .

[Infadoos]162-infadoos looked , [his]162-infadoos eyes starting nearly out of [his]162-infadoos head . Then [he]162-infadoos fell upon [his]162-infadoos knees .

" [Koom]167-koom ! [Koom]167-koom ! "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos ejaculated ; " it is [[[my]162-infadoos brother]2648-my brother 's son]3482-my brother 's son ; it is [the king]2791-the king . "[162-infadoos]

" Did [I]971-the old man not tell [thee]162-infadoos so , [[my]971-the old man uncle]3102-my uncle ? Rise ; [I]971-the old man am not yet [the king]2791-the king , but with [thy]162-infadoos help , and with the help of [these brave white men , who are [[my]971-the old man friends]3487-my friends]3486-these brave white men , who are my friends , [I]971-the old man shall be . Yet [the old witch]3488-the old witch [Gagool]122-gagool was right , [the land]3165-the land shall run with blood first , and [hers]3488-the old witch shall run with it , if [she]3488-the old witch has any and can die , for [she]3488-the old witch killed [[my]971-the old man father]2882-my father with [her]3488-the old witch words , and drove [[my]971-the old man mother]3491-my mother forth . And now , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , choose [thou]162-infadoos . Wilt [thou]162-infadoos put [thy]162-infadoos hands between [my]971-the old man hands and be [[my]971-the old man man]3492-my man ? Wilt [thou]162-infadoos share the dangers that lie before [me]971-the old man , and help [me]971-the old man to overthrow [this tyrant and murderer]3493-this tyrant and murderer , or wilt [thou]162-infadoos not ? Choose [thou]162-infadoos . "[971-the old man]

[The old man]971-the old man put [his]971-the old man hand to [his]971-the old man head and thought . Then [he]971-the old man rose , and advancing to where [Umbopa]169-ignosi , or rather [Ignosi]169-ignosi , stood , [he]971-the old man knelt before [him]971-the old man , and took [his]971-the old man hand .

" [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [rightful king of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]3480-rightful king of the kukuanas , [I]971-the old man put [my]971-the old man hand between [thy]971-the old man hands , and am [[thy]971-the old man man]3495-thy man till death . When [thou]162-infadoos wast [a babe]3496-a babe [I]971-the old man dandled [thee]162-infadoos upon [my]971-the old man knees , now shall [my]971-the old man old arm strike for [thee]162-infadoos and freedom . "[971-the old man]

" It is well , [Infadoos]162-infadoos ; if [I]971-the old man conquer , [thou]162-infadoos shalt be [the greatest man in [the kingdom]3498-the kingdom after [its king]3499-its king]3497-the greatest man in the kingdom after its king . If [I]971-the old man fail , [thou]162-infadoos canst only die , and death is not far off from [thee]162-infadoos . Rise , [[my]971-the old man uncle]3102-my uncle . "[971-the old man]

" And [ye]162-infadoos , [white men]2713-white men , will [ye]162-infadoos help [me]971-the old man ? What have [I]971-the old man to offer [you]162-infadoos ! The white stones ! [I]0-i translated this remark .

" Tell [him]3499-its king , "[97-sir henry] answered [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , " that [he]3499-its king mistakes [an Englishman]3502-an englishman . Wealth is good , and if it comes in [our]3503-our way [we]3503-our will take it ; but [a gentleman]2609-a gentleman does not sell [himself]2609-a gentleman for wealth . Still , speaking for [myself]97-sir henry , [I]97-sir henry say this . [I]97-sir henry have always liked [Umbopa]169-ignosi , and so far as lies in [me]97-sir henry [I]97-sir henry will stand by [him]169-ignosi in this business . " Well , "[98-good] said [Good]98-good , " to adopt the language of hyperbole , in which [all these people]3507-all these people seem to indulge , [you]169-ignosi can tell [him]169-ignosi that a row is surely good , and warms the cockles of the heart , and that so far as [I]98-good am concerned [I]98-good 'm [[his]169-ignosi boy]3508-his boy . [My]98-good only stipulation is that [he]169-ignosi allows [me]98-good to wear trousers . "[98-good]

" It is well , [[my]169-ignosi friends]3487-my friends , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi , late [Umbopa]169-ignosi ; " and what sayest [thou]3487-my friends , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , art [thou]3487-my friends also with [me]169-ignosi , [old hunter]3510-old hunter , cleverer than a wounded buffalo ? "[169-ignosi]

[I]0-i thought awhile and scratched [my]0-i head .

" [Umbopa]169-ignosi , or [Ignosi]169-ignosi , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i do n't like revolutions . [I]0-i am [a man of peace and a bit of a coward]3511-a man of peace and a bit of a coward "[0-i] - here [Umbopa]169-ignosi smiled - " but , on the other hand , [I]169-ignosi stick up for [[my]169-ignosi friends]3487-my friends , [Ignosi]169-ignosi . " That [I]169-ignosi will do , "[169-ignosi] answered [Ignosi]169-ignosi . " Stay , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , by the sign of the snake about [my]169-ignosi middle , tell [me]169-ignosi the truth .
