" None , O [Ignosi]169-ignosi . "[169-ignosi]

" If [any white man]2676-any white man had been seen or heard of , wouldst [thou]169-ignosi have known ? "[169-ignosi]

" [I]169-ignosi should certainly have known . "[169-ignosi]

" [Thou]169-ignosi hearest , [Incubu]150-incubu , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi to [Sir Henry]97-sir henry ; " [he]3516-incubu 's sir henry 's lost brother has not been [here]2924-here . "[169-ignosi]

" Well , well , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , with a sigh ; " there it is ; [I]97-sir henry suppose that [he]3516-incubu 's sir henry 's lost brother never got so far . [Poor fellow]2686-poor fellow , [poor fellow]2686-poor fellow ! So it has all been for nothing . [God]102-god 's will be done . "[97-sir henry]

" Now for business , "[0-i] [I]0-i put in , anxious to escape from a painful subject . " It is very well to be [a king by right divine]3524-a king by right divine , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , but how dost [thou]169-ignosi propose to become [a king]3408-a king indeed ? "[0-i]

" Nay , [I]97-sir henry know not . [Infadoos]162-infadoos , hast [thou]169-ignosi a plan ? "[97-sir henry]

" [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [Son of the Lightning]3526-son of the lightning , "[3094-his uncle] answered [[his]0-i uncle]3094-his uncle , " to - night is the great dance and witch - hunt . [Many]3418-many shall be smelt out and perish , and in the hearts of [many others]3528-many others there will be grief and anguish and fury against [the king Twala]3529-the king twala . When the dance is over , then [I]3094-his uncle will speak to some of [the great chiefs]3530-the great chiefs , who in turn , if [I]3094-his uncle can win [them]3530-the great chiefs over , will speak to [[their]3530-the great chiefs regiments]3531-their regiments . [I]3094-his uncle shall speak to [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs softly at first , and bring [them]3532-the chiefs to see that [thou]169-ignosi art indeed [the king]2791-the king , and [I]3094-his uncle think that by to - morrow 's light [thou]169-ignosi shalt have twenty thousand spears at [thy]169-ignosi command . And now [I]3094-his uncle must go and think , and hear , and make ready . After the dance is done , if [I]3094-his uncle am yet alive , and [we]1275-we are all alive , [I]3094-his uncle will meet [thee]169-ignosi here , and [we]1275-we can talk . At the best there must be war . "[3094-his uncle]

At this moment [our]1275-we conference was interrupted by the cry that [messengers]1115-messengers had come from [the king]2791-the king . Advancing to the door of [the hut]1095-the hut [we]1275-we ordered that [they]1279-they should be admitted , and presently [three men]1280-three men entered , each bearing a shining shirt of chain armour , and a magnificent battle - axe .

" The gifts of [[my]1281-a herald who came with them lord]3088-my lord [the king]2791-the king to [the white men from [the Stars]70-the stars]3536-the white men from the stars ! "[1281-a herald who came with them] said [a herald who came with [them]1280-three men]1281-a herald who came with them .

" [We]1275-we thank [the king]2791-the king , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " withdraw . "[0-i]

[The men]975-the men went , and [we]1275-we examined the armour with great interest . It was the most wonderful chain work that either of [us]1275-we had ever seen . A whole coat fell together so closely that it formed a mass of links scarcely too big to be covered with both hands .

" Do [you]3538-you make these things in [this country]2870-this country , [Infadoos]162-infadoos ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked ; " they are very beautiful . "[0-i]

" Nay , [[my]1275-we lord]3088-my lord , they came down to [us]1275-we from [[our]1275-we forefathers]3541-our forefathers . [We]1275-we know not who made [them]3542-them , and there are but [few left]3543-few left . 1 None but [those of royal blood]3544-those of royal blood may be clad in them . [They]3542-them are magic coats through which no spear can pass , and [those who wear them]3545-those who wear them are well - nigh safe in the battle . [The king]2791-the king is well pleased or much afraid , or [he]2791-the king would not have sent these garments of steel . Clothe [yourselves]1283-we in them to - night , [[my]1275-we lords]3091-my lords . "[1275-we]

The remainder of that day [we]1283-we spent quietly , resting and talking over the situation , which was sufficiently exciting . At last the sun went down , the thousand watch fires glowed out , and through the darkness [we]1283-we heard the tramp of many feet and the clashing of hundreds of spears , as [the regiments]1144-the regiments passed to [their]1144-the regiments appointed places to be ready for the great dance . Then the full moon shone out in splendour , and as [we]1283-we stood watching [her]1285-her rays , [Infadoos]162-infadoos arrived , clad in [his]162-infadoos war dress , and accompanied by [a guard of [twenty men]1287-twenty men]1286-a guard of twenty men to escort [us]1283-we to the dance . As [he]162-infadoos recommended , [we]1283-we had already donned the shirts of chain armour which [the king]2791-the king had sent [us]1283-we , putting them on under [our]1283-we ordinary clothing , and finding to [our]1283-we surprise that they were neither very heavy nor uncomfortable . These steel shirts , which evidently had been made for [men of a very large stature]1289-men of a very large stature , hung somewhat loosely upon [Good]98-good and [myself]0-i , but [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's fitted [his]97-sir henry magnificent frame like a glove . Then strapping [our]1283-we revolvers round [our]1283-we waists , and taking in [our]1283-we hands the battle - axes which [the king]2791-the king had sent with the armour , [we]1283-we started .

On arriving at [the great kraal , where [we]1283-we had that morning been received by [the king]2791-the king]1291-the great kraal , where we had that morning been received by the king , [we]1283-we found that [it]1291-the great kraal , where we had that morning been received by the king was closely packed with [some twenty thousand men]1293-some twenty thousand men arranged round [it]1291-the great kraal , where we had that morning been received by the king in [regiments]1294-regiments . [These regiments]1295-these regiments were in turn divided into [companies]1296-companies , and between [each company]1060-each company ran a little path to allow space for [the witch - finders]1298-the witch - finders to pass up and down . Anything more imposing than the sight that was presented by [this vast and orderly concourse of armed men]1299-this vast and orderly concourse of armed men it is impossible to conceive . There [they]1299-this vast and orderly concourse of armed men stood perfectly silent , and the moon poured her light upon the forest of [their]1299-this vast and orderly concourse of armed men raised spears , upon their majestic forms , waving plumes , and the harmonious shading of [their]1299-this vast and orderly concourse of armed men various - coloured shields . Wherever [we]1283-we looked were [line upon line of dim faces surmounted by range upon range of shimmering spears]1300-line upon line of dim faces surmounted by range upon range of shimmering spears .

" Surely , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [Infadoos]162-infadoos , " [the whole army]3548-the whole army is here ? "[0-i]

" Nay , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos answered , " but a third of it . [One third]3549-one third is present at this dance each year , [another third]3550-another third is mustered outside in case there should be trouble when the killing begins , [ten thousand more garrison [the outposts round [Loo]3-loo]3552-the outposts round loo , and the rest watch at [the kraals in [the country]300-the country]3553-the kraals in the country]3551-ten thousand more garrison the outposts round loo , and the rest watch at the kraals in the country . [Thou]3555-thou seest it is [a great people]3556-a great people . "[162-infadoos]

" [They]3556-a great people are very silent , "[98-good] said [Good]98-good ; and indeed the intense stillness among [such a vast concourse of living men]1301-such a vast concourse of living men was almost overpowering .

" What says [Bougwan]144-bougwan ? "[162-infadoos] asked [Infadoos]162-infadoos .

[I]0-i translated .

" [Those over whom the shadow of Death is hovering]3557-those over whom the shadow of death is hovering are silent , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos answered grimly .

" Will many be killed ? "[98-good]

" Very many . "[98-good]

" It seems , "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [the others]595-the others , " that [we]1303-we are going to assist at a gladiatorial show arranged regardless of expense . "[0-i]

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry shivered , and [Good]98-good said [he]98-good wished that [we]1303-we could get out of it .

" Tell [me]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i asked [Infadoos]162-infadoos , " are [we]1303-we in danger ? "[0-i]

" [I]98-good know not , [[my]98-good lords]3091-my lords , [I]98-good trust not ; but do not seem afraid . If [ye]3091-my lords live through the night all may go well with [you]3091-my lords . [The soldiers]3431-the soldiers murmur against [the king]2791-the king . "[98-good]

All this while [we]1303-we had been advancing steadily towards the centre of [the open space]1191-the open space , in the midst of which were placed some stools . As [we]1303-we proceeded [we]1303-we perceived [another small party coming from the direction of [the royal hut]1306-the royal hut]1305-another small party coming from the direction of the royal hut .

" It is [the king [Twala]165-twala]3529-the king twala , [Scragga]164-scragga [[his]165-twala son]3439-his son , and [Gagool the old]122-gagool ; and see , with [them]1307-a little group of about a dozen gigantic and savage - looking men , armed with spears in one hand and heavy kerries in the other are those who slay , "[162-infadoos] said [Infadoos]162-infadoos , pointing to [a little group of about a dozen gigantic and savage - looking men , armed with spears in one hand and heavy kerries in the other]1307-a little group of about a dozen gigantic and savage - looking men , armed with spears in one hand and heavy kerries in the other .

[The king]2791-the king seated [himself]2791-the king upon the centre stool , [Gagool]122-gagool crouched at [his]2791-the king feet , and [the others]595-the others stood behind [him]2791-the king .

" Greeting , [white lords]3283-white lords , "[165-twala] [Twala]165-twala cried , as [we]1303-we came up ; " be seated , waste not precious time - the night is all too short for the deeds that must be done . [Ye]3283-white lords come in a good hour , and shall see a glorious show . Look round , [white lords]3283-white lords ; look round , "[165-twala] and [he]165-twala rolled [his]165-twala one wicked eye from regiment to regiment . " Can [the Stars]3292-the stars show [you]3283-white lords such a sight as this ? See how [they]3292-the stars shake in [their]3292-the stars wickedness , all those who have evil in [their]3292-the stars hearts and fear the judgment of ' Heaven above . ' "[165-twala]

" Begin ! begin ! "[122-gagool] piped [Gagool]122-gagool , in [her]122-gagool thin piercing voice ; " the hyænas are hungry , [they]3292-the stars howl for food . Begin ! begin ! "[122-gagool]

Then for a moment there was intense stillness , made horrible by a presage of what was to come .

[The king]2791-the king lifted [his]2791-the king spear , and suddenly twenty thousand feet were raised , as though they belonged to [one man , and brought down with a stamp upon]1311-one man , and brought down with a stamp upon [the earth]632-the earth . This was repeated three times , causing the solid ground to shake and tremble . Then from a far point of the circle a solitary voice began a wailing song , of which the refrain ran something as follows : -

" What is [the lot of [man]2819-man born of [woman]3568-woman]3566-the lot of man born of woman ? "[1195-company]

Back came the answer rolling out from every throat in that vast company -

" Death ! "[1195-company]

Gradually , however , the song was taken up by [company]1195-company after [company]1195-company , till [the whole armed multitude]1315-the whole armed multitude were singing it , and [I]0-i could no longer follow the words , except in so far as they appeared to represent various phases of human passions , fears , and joys . Now it seemed to be a love song , now a majestic swelling war chant , and last of all a death dirge ending suddenly in one heart - breaking wail that went echoing and rolling away in a volume of blood - curdling sound .

Again silence fell upon [the place]3034-the place , and again it was broken by [the king]2791-the king lifting [his]2791-the king hand . Instantly [we]1318-we heard a pattering of feet , and from out of the masses of [warriors strange and awful figures]1319-warriors strange and awful figures appeared running towards [us]1318-we . As [they]1319-warriors strange and awful figures drew near [we]1318-we saw that these were [women]3373-women , most of [them]3373-women aged , for [their]3373-women white hair , ornamented with small bladders taken from fish , streamed out behind [them]3373-women . [Their]3373-women faces were painted in stripes of white and yellow ; down [their]3373-women backs hung snake - skins , and round [their]3373-women waists rattled circlets of human bones , while [each]1321-each held a small forked wand in [her]1321-each shrivelled hand . In all there were [ten of [them]3373-women]1322-ten of them . When [they]1319-warriors strange and awful figures arrived in front of [us]1318-we [they]1319-warriors strange and awful figures halted , and one of [them]1319-warriors strange and awful figures , pointing with [her]1321-each wand towards [the crouching figure of [Gagool]122-gagool]1323-the crouching figure of gagool , cried out -

" [Mother]3569-mother , [old mother]3570-old mother , [we]1318-we are here . "[1321-each]

" Good ! good ! good ! "[1321-each] answered that aged Iniquity . " Are [your]122-gagool eyes keen , [[Isanusis]174-isanusis witch doctresses]3571-isanusis witch doctresses , [ye]122-gagool seers in [dark places]3572-dark places ? "[1321-each]

" [Mother]3569-mother , [they]3574-they are keen . "[1321-each]

" Good ! good ! good ! Are [your]122-gagool ears open , [Isanusis]174-isanusis , [ye]122-gagool who hear words that come not from the tongue ? "[1321-each]

" [Mother]3569-mother , they are open . "[1321-each]

" Good ! good ! good ! Are [your]122-gagool senses awake , [Isanusis]174-isanusis - can [ye]122-gagool smell blood , can [ye]122-gagool purge the land of [the wicked ones who compass evil against the king]3576-the wicked ones who compass evil against the king and against [[their]3576-the wicked ones who compass evil against the king neighbours]3577-their neighbours ? Are [ye]122-gagool ready to do the justice of ' [Heaven above]2970-heaven above , ' [ye]122-gagool whom [I]1321-each have taught , who have eaten of the bread of [my]1321-each wisdom , and drunk of the water of [my]1321-each magic ? "[1321-each]

" [Mother]3569-mother , [we]1326-we can . "[1321-each]

" Then go ! [Tarry]175-tarry not , [ye]122-gagool vultures ; see , [the slayers]3580-the slayers "[1321-each] - pointing to [the ominous group of [executioners behind]1325-executioners behind]1324-the ominous group of executioners behind - " make sharp [their]1324-the ominous group of executioners behind spears ; [the white men from afar]3581-the white men from afar are hungry to see . Go ! "[1321-each]

With a wild yell Gagool 's horrid ministers broke away in every direction , like fragments from a shell , the dry bones round [their]1324-the ominous group of executioners behind waists rattling as [they]1324-the ominous group of executioners behind ran , and headed for various points of the dense human circle . [We]1326-we could not watch [them]1327-them all , so [we]1326-we fixed [our]1326-we eyes upon [the Isanusi nearest to [us]1326-we]1328-the isanusi nearest to us . When [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us came to within a few paces of [the warriors]1329-the warriors [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us halted and began to dance wildly , turning round and round with an almost incredible rapidity , and shrieking out sentences such as " [I]1328-the isanusi nearest to us smell [him]3582-him , [the evil - doer]3583-the evil - doer ! "[1328-the isanusi nearest to us] " [He]3582-him is near , [[he]3582-him who poisoned [[his]3582-him mother]3467-his mother]3584-he who poisoned his mother ! "[1328-the isanusi nearest to us] " [I]1328-the isanusi nearest to us hear the thoughts of [him]3582-him who thought evil of [the king]2791-the king ! "[1328-the isanusi nearest to us]

Quicker and quicker [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us danced , till [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us lashed [herself]1328-the isanusi nearest to us into such a frenzy of excitement that the foam flew in specks from [her]1328-the isanusi nearest to us gnashing jaws , till [her]1328-the isanusi nearest to us eyes seemed to start from [her]1328-the isanusi nearest to us head , and [her]1328-the isanusi nearest to us flesh to quiver visibly . Suddenly [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us stopped dead and stiffened all over , like a pointer dog when [he]1330-he scents game , and then with outstretched wand [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us began to creep stealthily towards [the soldiers before [her]1328-the isanusi nearest to us]1331-the soldiers before her . It seemed to [us]1332-we that as [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us came [their]1331-the soldiers before her stoicism gave way , and that [they]1331-the soldiers before her shrank from [her]1328-the isanusi nearest to us . As for [ourselves]1332-we , [we]1332-we followed [her]1328-the isanusi nearest to us movements with a horrible fascination . Presently , still creeping and crouching like a dog , [the Isanusi]122-gagool was before [them]1331-the soldiers before her . Then [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us halted and pointed , and again crept on a pace or two .

Suddenly the end came . With a shriek [she]1328-the isanusi nearest to us sprang in and touched [a tall warrior]1333-a tall warrior with [her]1328-the isanusi nearest to us forked wand . Instantly [two of [[his]1330-he comrades]1335-his comrades , [those standing immediately next to [him]1330-he]1336-those standing immediately next to him]1334-two of his comrades , those standing immediately next to him , seized [the doomed man]1337-the doomed man , each by one arm , and advanced with [him]1337-the doomed man towards [the king]2791-the king .

[He]1330-he did not resist , but [we]1332-we saw that [he]1330-he dragged [his]1330-he limbs as though they were paralysed , and that [his]1330-he fingers , from which the spear had fallen , were limp like those of [a man newly dead]1339-a man newly dead .

As [he]1330-he came , [two of [the villainous executioners]1341-the villainous executioners]1340-two of the villainous executioners stepped forward to meet [him]1330-he . Presently [they]1340-two of the villainous executioners met , and [the executioners]1342-the executioners turned round , looking towards [the king]2791-the king as though for orders .

" Kill ! "[2791-the king] said [the king]2791-the king .

" Kill ! "[122-gagool] squeaked [Gagool]122-gagool .

" Kill ! "[164-scragga] re - echoed [Scragga]164-scragga , with a hollow chuckle .

Almost before the words were uttered the horrible dead was done . [One man]1345-one man had driven [his]1345-one man spear into [the victim]1346-the victim 's heart , and to make assurance double sure , [the other]1347-the other had dashed out [his]1347-the other brains with a great club .

" One , "[165-twala] counted [Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king , just like a black [Madame Defarge]176-madame defarge , as [Good]98-good said , and the body was dragged a few paces away and stretched out .

Hardly was the thing done before [another poor wretch]1349-another poor wretch was brought up , like an ox to the slaughter . This time [we]1350-we could see , from the leopard - skin cloak which [he]1349-another poor wretch wore , that [the man]371-the man was [a person of rank]1352-a person of rank . Again the awful syllables were spoken , and [the victim]1346-the victim fell dead .

" Two , "[2791-the king] counted [the king]2791-the king .

And so the deadly game went on , till about a hundred bodies were stretched in rows behind [us]1350-we . [I]0-i have heard of the gladiatorial shows of [the Cæsars]1355-the cæsars , and of the Spanish bull - fights , but [I]0-i take the liberty of doubting if either of them could be half so horrible as this Kukuana witch - hunt . Gladiatorial shows and Spanish bull - fights at any rate contributed to the public amusement , which certainly was not the case here . [The most confirmed sensation - monger]1356-the most confirmed sensation - monger would fight shy of sensation if [he]1356-the most confirmed sensation - monger knew that it was well on the cards that [he]1356-the most confirmed sensation - monger would , in [[his]1356-the most confirmed sensation - monger own proper person]1357-his own proper person , be the subject of the next " event . "[1356-the most confirmed sensation - monger]

Once [we]1350-we rose and tried to remonstrate , but were sternly repressed by [Twala]165-twala .

" Let the law take its course , [white men]2713-white men . [These dogs]3588-these dogs are [magicians]3589-magicians and [evil - doers]3590-evil - doers ; it is well that [they]3588-these dogs should die , "[165-twala] was the only answer vouchsafed to [us]1350-we .

About half - past ten there was a pause . [The witch - finders]1298-the witch - finders gathered [themselves]1298-the witch - finders together , apparently exhausted with [their]1298-the witch - finders bloody work , and [we]1350-we thought that the performance was done with . But it was not so , for presently , to [our]1350-we surprise , [the ancient woman]1359-the ancient woman , [Gagool]122-gagool , rose from [her]122-gagool crouching position , and supporting [herself]122-gagool with a stick , staggered off into [the open space]1191-the open space . It was an extraordinary sight to see this frightful vulture - headed old creature , bent nearly double with extreme age , gather strength by degrees , until at last [she]122-gagool rushed about almost as actively as [her]122-gagool ill - omened pupils . To and fro [she]122-gagool ran , chanting to [herself]122-gagool , till suddenly [she]122-gagool made a dash at [a tall man standing in front of one of [the regiments]1144-the regiments]1361-a tall man standing in front of one of the regiments , and touched [him]1361-a tall man standing in front of one of the regiments . As [she]122-gagool did this a sort of groan went up from [the regiment which evidently [he]1361-a tall man standing in front of one of the regiments commanded]1363-the regiment which evidently he commanded . But [two of [its officers]1365-its officers]1364-two of its officers seized [him]1361-a tall man standing in front of one of the regiments all the same , and brought [him]1361-a tall man standing in front of one of the regiments up for execution . [We]1366-us learned afterwards that [he]1361-a tall man standing in front of one of the regiments was [a man of great wealth and importance]1367-a man of great wealth and importance , being indeed [a cousin of [the king]2791-the king]1368-a cousin of the king .

[He]1361-a tall man standing in front of one of the regiments was slain , and [Twala]165-twala counted one hundred and three . Then [Gagool]122-gagool again sprang to and fro , gradually drawing nearer and nearer to [ourselves]1366-us .

" Hang [me]98-good if [I]98-good do n't believe [she]122-gagool is going to try [her]122-gagool games on [us]1366-us , "[98-good] ejaculated [Good]98-good in horror .

" Nonsense ! "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry .

As for [myself]0-i , when [I]0-i saw [that old fiend]1370-that old fiend dancing nearer and nearer , [my]0-i heart positively sank into [my]0-i boots . [I]0-i glanced behind [us]1366-us at the long rows of corpses , and shivered .

Nearer and nearer waltzed [Gagool]122-gagool , looking for all [the world]248-the world like an animated crooked stick or comma , [her]122-gagool horrid eyes gleaming and glowing with a most unholy lustre .

Nearer [she]122-gagool came , and yet nearer , [every creature in that vast assemblage]1372-every creature in that vast assemblage watching [her]122-gagool movements with intense anxiety . At last [she]122-gagool stood still and pointed .

" Which is it to be ? "[97-sir henry] asked [Sir Henry]97-sir henry to [himself]97-sir henry .

In a moment all doubts were at rest , for [the old hag]1373-the old hag had rushed in and touched [Umbopa]169-ignosi , alias [Ignosi]169-ignosi , on the shoulder .

" [I]122-gagool smell [him]1370-that old fiend out , "[122-gagool] [she]122-gagool shrieked . " Kill [him]1370-that old fiend , kill [him]1370-that old fiend , [he]1370-that old fiend is full of evil ; kill [him]1370-that old fiend , [the stranger]3591-the stranger , before blood flows from [him]1370-that old fiend . Slay [him]1370-that old fiend , [O king]3343-o king . "[122-gagool]

There was a pause , of which [I]0-i instantly took advantage .

" [O king]3343-o king , "[0-i] [I]0-i called out , rising from [my]0-i seat , " [this man]532-this man is [the servant of [[thy]3343-o king guests]3596-thy guests]3595-the servant of thy guests , [he]532-this man is [their]3596-thy guests dog ; whosoever sheds the blood of [our]3343-o king dog sheds [our]3343-o king blood . By the sacred law of hospitality [I]0-i claim protection for [him]532-this man . "[0-i]

" [Gagool]122-gagool , [mother of [the witch - finders]1298-the witch - finders]3597-mother of the witch - finders , has smelt [him]532-this man out ; [he]532-this man must die , [white men]2713-white men , "[165-twala] was the sullen answer .

" Nay , [he]532-this man shall not die , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied ; " [he]532-this man who tries to touch [him]532-this man shall die indeed . "[0-i]

" Seize [him]532-this man ! "[165-twala] roared [Twala]165-twala to [the executioners]1342-the executioners ; who stood round red to the eyes with the blood of [[their]1342-the executioners victims]1375-their victims .

[They]1342-the executioners advanced towards [us]1376-us , and then hesitated . As for [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [he]169-ignosi clutched [his]169-ignosi spear , and raised it as though determined to sell [his]169-ignosi life dearly .

" Stand back , [[ye]1342-the executioners dogs]3600-ye dogs ! "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted , " if [ye]1342-the executioners would see to - morrow 's light . Touch one hair of [his]165-twala head and [[your]1342-the executioners king]3224-your king dies , "[0-i] and [I]0-i covered [Twala]165-twala with [my]0-i revolver . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [Good]98-good also drew [their]1377-their pistols , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry pointing [his]97-sir henry at [the leading executioner , who was advancing to carry out the sentence , and [Good]98-good taking a deliberate aim at [Gagool]122-gagool]1378-the leading executioner , who was advancing to carry out the sentence , and good taking a deliberate aim at gagool .

[Twala]165-twala winced perceptibly as [my]0-i barrel came in a line with [his]165-twala broad chest .

" Well , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " what is it to be , [Twala]165-twala ? "[0-i]

Then [he]165-twala spoke .

" Put away [your]0-i magic tubes , "[165-twala] [he]165-twala said ; " [ye]0-i have adjured [me]165-twala in the name of hospitality , and for that reason , but not from fear of what [ye]0-i can do , [I]165-twala spare [him]165-twala . Go in peace . "[165-twala]

" It is well , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered unconcernedly ; " [we]1381-we are weary of slaughter , and would sleep . Is the dance ended ? "[0-i]

" It is ended , "[165-twala] [Twala]165-twala answered sulkily . " Let these dead dogs , "[165-twala] pointing to the long rows of corpses , " be flung out to the hyænas and the vultures , "[165-twala] and [he]165-twala lifted [his]165-twala spear .

Instantly [the regiments]1144-the regiments began to defile through the kraal gateway in perfect silence , a fatigue party only remaining behind to drag away the corpses of [those who had been sacrificed]1380-those who had been sacrificed .

Then [we]1381-we rose also , and making [our]1381-we salaam to [[his]165-twala majesty]1193-his majesty , which [he]165-twala hardly deigned to acknowledge , [we]1381-we departed to [[our]1381-we huts]1383-our huts .

" Well , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , as [we]1381-we sat down , having first lit a lamp of the sort used by [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas , of which the wick is made from the fibre of a species of palm leaf , and the oil from clarified hippopotamus fat , " well , [I]98-good feel uncommonly inclined to be sick . "[98-good]

" If [I]98-good had any doubts about helping [Umbopa]169-ignosi to rebel against [that infernal blackguard]3602-that infernal blackguard , "[98-good] put in [Good]98-good , " [they]3603-they are gone now . It was as much as [I]98-good could do to sit still while that slaughter was going on . [I]98-good tried to keep [my]98-good eyes shut , but they would open just at the wrong time . [I]98-good wonder where [Infadoos]162-infadoos is . [Umbopa]169-ignosi , [[my]98-good friend]315-my friend , [you]169-ignosi ought to be grateful to [us]1384-we ; [your]169-ignosi skin came near to having an air - hole made in it . "[98-good]

" [I]169-ignosi am grateful , [Bougwan]144-bougwan , "[169-ignosi] was [Umbopa]169-ignosi 's answer , when [I]0-i had translated , " and [I]169-ignosi shall not forget . As for [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [he]162-infadoos will be here by - and - by . [We]1384-we must wait . "[169-ignosi]

So [we]1384-we lit [our]1384-we pipes and waited .

1 In the Soudan swords and coats of mail are still worn by [Arabs , whose ancestors]1385-arabs , whose ancestors must have stripped [them]1385-arabs , whose ancestors from the bodies of [Crusaders]177-crusaders . - [Editor]112-editor .

CHAPTER XI

[WE]1384-we GIVE A SIGN

For a long while - two hours , [I]0-i should think - [we]1384-we sat there in silence , being too much overwhelmed by the recollection of the horrors [we]1384-we had seen to talk . At last , just as [we]1384-we were thinking of turning in - for the night drew nigh to dawn - [we]1384-we heard a sound of steps . Then came the challenge of a sentry posted at the kraal gate , which apparently was answered , though not in an audible tone , for the steps still advanced ; and in another second [Infadoos]162-infadoos had entered [the hut]1095-the hut , followed by [some half - dozen stately - looking chiefs]1387-some half - dozen stately - looking chiefs .

" [[My]162-infadoos lords]3091-my lords , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos said , " [I]162-infadoos have come according to [my]162-infadoos word . [[My]162-infadoos lords]3091-my lords and [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [rightful king of [the Kukuanas]3116-the kukuanas]3480-rightful king of the kukuanas , [I]162-infadoos have brought with [me]162-infadoos [these men]1197-these men , "[162-infadoos] pointing to the row of [chiefs]538-chiefs , " who are [great men among [us]1384-we]3610-great men among us , having each one of [them]1197-these men the command of [three thousand soldiers]3611-three thousand soldiers , that live but to do [their]1197-these men bidding , under [the king]2791-the king 's . [I]162-infadoos have told [them]1197-these men of what [I]162-infadoos have seen , and what [my]162-infadoos ears have heard . Now let [them]1197-these men also behold the sacred snake around [thee]3613-ye , and hear [thy]3613-ye story , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , that [they]1197-these men may say whether or no [they]1197-these men will make cause with [thee]3613-ye against [Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king . "[162-infadoos]

By way of answer [Ignosi]169-ignosi again stripped off [his]169-ignosi girdle , and exhibited the snake tattooed about [him]169-ignosi . [Each chief]1389-each chief in turn drew near and examined the sign by the dim light of the lamp , and without saying a word passed on to the other side .

Then [Ignosi]169-ignosi resumed [his]169-ignosi moocha , and addressing [them]1390-them , repeated the history [he]169-ignosi had detailed in the morning .

" Now [ye]3613-ye have heard , [chiefs]538-chiefs , "[162-infadoos] said [Infadoos]162-infadoos , when [he]162-infadoos had done , " what say [ye]3613-ye : will [ye]3613-ye stand by [this man]532-this man and help [him]532-this man to [[his]532-this man father]678-his father 's throne , or will [ye]3613-ye not ? [The land]3165-the land cries out against [Twala]165-twala , and the blood of [the people]3142-the people flows like the waters in spring . [Ye]3613-ye have seen to - night . [Two other chiefs there]3620-two other chiefs there were with whom [I]162-infadoos had it in [my]162-infadoos mind to speak , and where are [they]3620-two other chiefs there now ? The hyænas howl over [their]3620-two other chiefs there corpses . Soon shall [ye]3613-ye be as [they]3620-two other chiefs there are if [ye]3613-ye strike not . Choose then , [[my]162-infadoos brothers]3621-my brothers . "[162-infadoos]

[The eldest of the six men]1391-the eldest of the six men , [a short , thick - set warrior , with white hair]1392-a short , thick - set warrior , with white hair , stepped forward a pace and answered -

" [Thy]162-infadoos words are true , [Infadoos]162-infadoos ; [the land]3165-the land cries out . [[My]1391-the eldest of the six men own brother]3623-my own brother is among [those who died to - night]3624-those who died to - night ; but this is a great matter , and the thing is hard to believe . How know [we]3625-us that if [we]3625-us lift [our]3625-us spears it may not be for [a thief]3626-a thief and [a liar]3627-a liar ? It is a great matter , [I]1391-the eldest of the six men say , of which [none]2774-none can see the end . For of this be sure , blood will flow in rivers before the deed is done ; [many]3418-many will still cleave to [the king]2791-the king , for [men]326-men worship the sun that still shines bright in the heavens , rather than that which has not risen . [These white men from the Stars]3632-these white men from the stars , [their]3632-these white men from the stars magic is great , and [Ignosi]169-ignosi is under the cover of [their]3632-these white men from the stars wing . If [he]169-ignosi be indeed [the rightful king]3633-the rightful king , let [them]3632-these white men from the stars give [us]3625-us a sign , and let [the people]3142-the people have a sign , that [all]3635-all may see . So shall [men]326-men cleave to [us]3625-us , knowing of a truth that [the white man]243-the white man 's magic is with [them]326-men . "[1391-the eldest of the six men]

" [Ye]0-i have the sign of the snake , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" [[My]1391-the eldest of the six men lord]3088-my lord , it is not enough . The snake may have been placed there since [the man]371-the man 's childhood . Show [us]3625-us a sign , and it will suffice . But [we]3625-us will not move without a sign . "[1391-the eldest of the six men]

[The others]595-the others gave a decided assent , and [I]0-i turned in perplexity to [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [Good]98-good , and explained the situation .

" [I]98-good think that [I]98-good have it , "[98-good] said [Good]98-good exultingly ; " ask [them]3532-the chiefs to give [us]3625-us a moment to think . "[98-good]

[I]0-i did so , and [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs withdrew . So soon as [they]3532-the chiefs had gone [Good]98-good went to the little box where [he]98-good kept [his]98-good medicines , unlocked it , and took out a note - book , in the fly - leaves of which was an almanack . " Now look here , [[you]1395-we fellows]3640-you fellows , is n't to - morrow the 4th of June ? "[98-good] [he]98-good said .

[We]1395-we had kept a careful note of the days , so were able to answer that it was .

" Very good ; then here [we]1395-we have it - ' 4 June , total eclipse of the moon commences at 8.15 Greenwich time , visible in [Teneriffe]74-teneriffe - [South Africa]23-south africa , c. ' There 's a sign for [you]1395-we . Tell [them]3532-the chiefs [we]1395-we will darken the moon to - morrow night . "[98-good]

The idea was a splendid one ; indeed , the only weak spot about it was a fear lest [Good]98-good 's almanack might be incorrect . If [we]1395-we made a false prophecy on such a subject , [our]1395-we prestige would be gone for ever , and so would [Ignosi]169-ignosi 's chance of the throne of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas .

" Suppose that the almanack is wrong , "[97-sir henry] suggested [Sir Henry]97-sir henry to Good , who was busily employed in working out something on a blank page of the book .

" [I]98-good see no reason to suppose anything of the sort , "[98-good] was [his]98-good answer . " Eclipses always come up to time ; at least that is [my]98-good experience of them , and it especially states that this one will be visible in [South Africa]23-south africa . [I]98-good have worked out the reckonings as well as [I]98-good can , without knowing [our]1395-we exact position ; and [I]98-good make out that the eclipse should begin here about ten o'clock tomorrow night , and last till half - past twelve . For an hour and a half or so there should be almost total darkness . "[98-good]

" Well , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , " [I]97-sir henry suppose [we]1395-we had better risk it . "[97-sir henry]

[I]0-i acquiesced , though doubtfully , for eclipses are queer cattle to deal with - it might be a cloudy night , for instance , or [our]1395-we dates might be wrong - and sent [Umbopa]169-ignosi to summon [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs back . Presently [they]3532-the chiefs came , and [I]0-i addressed [them]3532-the chiefs thus -

" [Great men of [the Kukuanas]3116-the kukuanas]3641-great men of the kukuanas , and [thou]3643-thou , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , listen . [We]1395-we love not to show [our]1395-we powers , for to do so is to interfere with the course of nature , and to plunge [the world]248-the world into fear and confusion . But since this matter is a great one , and as [we]1395-we are angered against [the king]2791-the king because of the slaughter [we]1395-we have seen , and because of the act of [the Isanusi Gagool]122-gagool , who would have put [[our]1395-we friend]3646-our friend [Ignosi]169-ignosi to death , [we]1395-we have determined to break a rule , and to give such a sign as [all men]3253-all men may see . Come hither "[0-i] ; and [I]0-i led [them]3532-the chiefs to the door of [the hut]1095-the hut and pointed to the red ball of the moon . " What see [ye]3532-the chiefs there ? "[0-i]

" [We]1395-we see the sinking moon , "[1398-the spokesman of the party] answered [the spokesman of [the party]1110-the party]1398-the spokesman of the party .

" It is so . Now tell [me]0-i , can [any mortal man]3648-any mortal man put out that moon before [her]3649-her hour of setting , and bring the curtain of black night down upon [the land]3165-the land ? "[0-i]

[The chief]2881-the chief laughed a little at the question . " No , [[my]2881-the chief lord]3088-my lord , that [no man]3209-no man can do . The moon is stronger than man who looks on [her]3649-her , nor can [she]3649-her vary in [her]3649-her courses . "[2881-the chief]

" [Ye]2881-the chief say so . Yet [I]2881-the chief tell [you]2881-the chief that to - morrow night , about two hours before midnight , [we]1395-we will cause the moon to be eaten up for a space of an hour and half an hour . Yes , deep darkness shall cover [the earth]632-the earth , and it shall be for a sign that [Ignosi]169-ignosi is indeed [king of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]3336-king of the kukuanas . If [we]1395-we do this thing , will [ye]2881-the chief be satisfied ? "[2881-the chief]

" Yea , [[my]1401-the old chief lords]3091-my lords , "[1401-the old chief] answered [the old chief]1401-the old chief with a smile , which was reflected on the faces of [[his]1401-the old chief companions]1402-his companions ; " if [ye]2881-the chief do this thing , [we]1395-we will be satisfied indeed . "[1401-the old chief]

" It shall be done ; [we]1395-we three , [Incubu]150-incubu , [Bougwan]144-bougwan , and [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , have said it , and it shall be done . Dost [thou]2881-the chief hear , [Infadoos]162-infadoos ? "[2881-the chief]

" [I]1401-the old chief hear , [[my]1401-the old chief lord]3088-my lord , but it is a wonderful thing that [ye]2881-the chief promise , to put out the moon , [the mother of [the world]248-the world]3657-the mother of the world , when [she]3657-the mother of the world is at [her]3657-the mother of the world full . "[1401-the old chief]

" Yet shall [we]1395-we do it , [Infadoos]162-infadoos . "[2881-the chief]

" It is well , [[my]1403-my lords]3091-my lords . To - day , two hours after sunset , [Twala]165-twala will send for [[my]1403-my lords]3091-my lords to witness [the girls]3661-the girls dance , and one hour after the dance begins [the girl whom [Twala]165-twala thinks the fairest]3662-the girl whom twala thinks the fairest shall be killed by [Scragga]164-scragga , [[the king]2791-the king 's son]3093-the king 's son , as a sacrifice to the Silent Ones , who sit and keep watch by [the mountains yonder]3665-the mountains yonder , "[1403-my] and [he]1403-my pointed towards the three strange - looking peaks where [[Solomon]90-solomon 's road]1404-solomon 's road was supposed to end . " Then let [[my]1403-my lords]3091-my lords darken the moon , and save [the maiden]3667-the maiden 's life , and [the people]3142-the people will believe indeed . "[1403-my]

" Ay , "[1401-the old chief] said [the old chief]1401-the old chief , still smiling a little , " [the people]3142-the people will believe indeed . "[1401-the old chief]

" Two miles from [Loo]3-loo , "[162-infadoos] went on [Infadoos]162-infadoos , " there is [a hill curved like a new moon]3670-a hill curved like a new moon , [a stronghold]3671-a stronghold , where [my]162-infadoos regiment , and [three other regiments which [these chiefs]3673-these chiefs command]3672-three other regiments which these chiefs command , are stationed . This morning [we]3674-we will make a plan whereby [two or three other regiments]3675-two or three other regiments may be moved [there]2626-there also . Then , if in truth [[my]162-infadoos lords]3091-my lords can darken the moon , in the darkness [I]162-infadoos will take [[my]162-infadoos lords]3091-my lords by the hand and lead [them]3091-my lords out of [Loo]3-loo to [this place , where [they]3091-my lords shall be safe]3679-this place , where they shall be safe , and thence [we]3674-we can make war upon [[Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king]1249-twala the king . "[162-infadoos]

" It is good , "[1406-i.] said [I.]1406-i. " Let leave [us]3674-we to sleep awhile and to make ready [our]3674-we magic . "[1406-i.]

[Infadoos]162-infadoos rose , and , having saluted [us]1407-us , departed with [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs .

" [[My]169-ignosi friends]3487-my friends , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi , so soon as [they]3532-the chiefs were gone , " can [ye]3487-my friends do this wonderful thing , or were [ye]3487-my friends speaking empty words to [the captains]3683-the captains ? "[169-ignosi]

" [We]3674-we believe that [we]3674-we can do it , [Umbopa - Ignosi]169-ignosi , [I]1406-i. mean . "[1406-i.]

" It is strange , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi answered , " and had [ye]3487-my friends not been [Englishmen]3684-englishmen [I]169-ignosi would not have believed it ; but [I]169-ignosi have learned that [English ' gentlemen]3685-english ' gentlemen ' tell no lies . If [we]3674-we live through the matter , be sure that [I]169-ignosi will repay [you]3487-my friends . "[169-ignosi]

" [Ignosi]169-ignosi , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , " promise [me]97-sir henry one thing . "[97-sir henry]

" [I]316-the big man will promise , [Incubu]150-incubu , [[my]316-the big man friend]315-my friend , even before [I]316-the big man hear it , "[316-the big man] answered [the big man]316-the big man with a smile . " What is it ? "[316-the big man]

" This : that if ever [you]3487-my friends come to be [king of [this people]972-this people]3687-king of this people [you]3487-my friends will do away with the smelling out of [wizards]3104-wizards such as [we]3674-we saw last night ; and that the killing of [men without trial]3690-men without trial shall no longer take place in [the land]3165-the land . "[169-ignosi]

[Ignosi]169-ignosi thought for a moment after [I]0-i had translated this request , and then answered -

" The ways of [black people]3692-black people are not as the ways of [white men]2713-white men , [Incubu]150-incubu , nor do [we]1410-we value life so highly . Yet [I]169-ignosi will promise . If it be in [my]169-ignosi power to hold [them]3692-black people back , [the witch - finders]1298-the witch - finders shall hunt no more , nor shall [any man die the death without trial or judgment]3695-any man die the death without trial or judgment . "[169-ignosi]

" That 's a bargain , then , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry ; " and now let [us]1410-we get a little rest . "[97-sir henry]

[Thoroughly]178-thoroughly wearied out , [we]1410-we were soon sound asleep , and slept till [Ignosi]169-ignosi woke [us]1410-we about eleven o'clock . Then [we]1410-we rose , washed , and ate a hearty breakfast . After that [we]1410-we went outside [the hut]1095-the hut and walked about , amusing [ourselves]1410-we with examining [the structure of [the Kukuana huts]1413-the kukuana huts]1412-the structure of the kukuana huts and observing the customs of [the women]1414-the women .

" [I]97-sir henry hope that eclipse will come off , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry presently .

" If it does not it will soon be all up with [us]1410-we , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered mournfully ; " for so sure as [we]1410-we are living men [some of [those chiefs]3697-those chiefs]3696-some of those chiefs will tell the whole story to [the king]2791-the king , and then there will be another sort of eclipse , and one that [we]1410-we shall certainly not like . "[0-i]

Returning to [the hut]1095-the hut [we]1410-we ate some dinner , and passed the rest of the day in receiving visits of ceremony and curiosity . At length the sun set , and [we]1410-we enjoyed a couple of hours of such quiet as [our]1410-we melancholy forebodings would allow to [us]1410-we . Finally , about half - past eight , [a messenger]1416-a messenger came from [Twala]64-twala to bid [us]1410-we to the great annual " dance of [girls]3699-girls "[1416-a messenger] which was about to be celebrated .

Hastily [we]1410-we put on the chain shirts that [the king]2791-the king had sent [us]1410-we , and taking [our]1410-we rifles and ammunition with [us]1410-we , so as to have them handy in case [we]1410-we had to fly , as suggested by [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [we]1410-we started boldly enough , though with inward fear and trembling . [The great space in front of [the king]2791-the king 's kraal]1418-the great space in front of the king 's kraal bore a very different appearance from that which [it]1418-the great space in front of the king 's kraal had presented on the previous evening . In place of [the grim ranks of [serried warriors]1421-serried warriors]1420-the grim ranks of serried warriors were [company after company of Kukuana girls]1422-company after company of kukuana girls , not over - dressed , so far as clothing went , but each crowned with a wreath of flowers , and holding a palm leaf in one hand and a white arum lily in the other . In the centre of [the open moonlit space]1423-the open moonlit space sat [[Twala]165-twala the king]1249-twala the king , with old Gagool at [his]165-twala feet , attended by [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [the boy Scragga]1202-the boy scragga , and [twelve guards]1426-twelve guards . There were also present about [a score of [chiefs]538-chiefs , amongst whom [I]0-i recognised most of [[our]1410-we friends]1008-our friends of the night before]1427-a score of chiefs , amongst whom i recognised most of our friends of the night before .

[Twala]165-twala greeted [us]1410-we with much apparent cordiality , though [I]0-i saw [him]165-twala fix [his]165-twala one eye viciously on [Umbopa]169-ignosi .

" Welcome , [white men from [the Stars]70-the stars]3404-white men from the stars , "[165-twala] [he]165-twala said ; " this is another sight from that which [your]1430-ye eyes gazed on by the light of last night 's moon , but it is not so good a sight . [Girls]3699-girls are pleasant , and were it not for such as these , "[165-twala] and [he]165-twala pointed round [him]1430-ye , " [we]1410-we should none of [us]1410-we be here this day ; but [men]326-men are better . Kisses and the tender words of [women]3373-women are sweet , but the sound of the clashing of the spears of [warriors]3181-warriors , and the smell of [men]326-men 's blood , are sweeter far ! Would [ye]1430-ye have [wives]3706-wives from among [[our]1410-we people]3106-our people , [white men]2713-white men ? If so , choose the fairest here , and [ye]1430-ye shall have [them]3706-wives , as many as [ye]1430-ye will , "[165-twala] and [he]165-twala paused for an answer .

As the prospect did not seem to be without attractions for Good , who , like [most sailors]1431-most sailors , is of a susceptible nature , - being elderly and wise , foreseeing the endless complications that anything of the sort would involve , for [women]3373-women bring trouble so surely as the night follows the day , [I]0-i put in a hasty answer -

" Thanks to [thee]2791-the king , [O king]3343-o king , but [[we]1410-we white men [we]1410-we d only with [white women like [ourselves]1410-we]3711-white women like ourselves]3710-we white men we d only with white women like ourselves . [[Your]2791-the king maidens]3712-your maidens are fair , but they are not for [us]1410-we ! "[0-i]

[The king]2791-the king laughed . " It is well . In [[our]1410-we land]3713-our land there is a proverb which runs , ' [Women]3373-women 's eyes are always bright , whatever the colour , ' and another that says , ' Love [her]3373-women who is present , for be sure [she]3373-women who is absent is false to [thee]2791-the king ; ' but perhaps these things are not so in [the Stars]70-the stars . In [a land where [men are white all things are possible]3716-men are white all things are possible]3715-a land where men are white all things are possible . So be it , [white men]2713-white men ; [the girls]3661-the girls will not go begging ! Welcome again ; and welcome , too , [thou]2791-the king black one ; if [Gagool]122-gagool here had won [her]122-gagool way , [thou]2791-the king wouldst have been stiff and cold by now . It is lucky for [thee]2791-the king that [thou]2791-the king too camest from the Stars ; ha ! ha ! "[2791-the king]

" [I]169-ignosi can kill [thee]2791-the king before [thou]2791-the king killest [me]169-ignosi , [O king]3343-o king , "[169-ignosi] was [Ignosi]169-ignosi 's calm answer , " and [thou]2791-the king shalt be stiff before [my]169-ignosi limbs cease to bend . "[169-ignosi]

[Twala]165-twala started . " [Thou]2791-the king speakest boldly , [boy]2814-boy , "[165-twala] [he]165-twala replied angrily ; " presume not too far . "[165-twala]

" [He]165-twala may well be bold in whose lips are truth . The truth is a sharp spear which flies [home]2616-home and misses not . It is a message from ' the Stars , ' O [king]554-king . "[165-twala]

[Twala]165-twala scowled , and [his]165-twala one eye gleamed fiercely , but [he]165-twala said nothing more .

" Let the dance begin , "[165-twala] [he]165-twala cried , and then [the flower - crowned girls]1434-the flower - crowned girls sprang forward in companies , singing a sweet song and waving the delicate palms and white lilies . On [they]1434-the flower - crowned girls danced , looking faint and spiritual in the soft , sad light of the risen moon ; now whirling round and round , now meeting in mimic warfare , swaying , eddying here and there , coming forward , falling back in an ordered confusion delightful to witness . At last [they]1434-the flower - crowned girls paused , and [a beautiful young woman]1435-a beautiful young woman sprang out of the ranks and began to pirouette in front of [us]1436-us with a grace and vigour which would have put [most ballet girls]1437-most ballet girls to shame . At length [she]1435-a beautiful young woman retired exhausted , and another took [her]1435-a beautiful young woman place , then another and another , but none of [them]1434-the flower - crowned girls , either in grace , skill , or personal attractions , came up to the first .

When [the chosen girls]1438-the chosen girls had all danced , [the king]2791-the king lifted [his]2791-the king hand .

" Which deem [ye]1438-the chosen girls the fairest , [white men]2713-white men ? "[2791-the king] [he]2791-the king asked .

" The first , "[0-i] said [I]0-i unthinkingly . Next second [I]0-i regretted it , for [I]0-i remembered that [Infadoos]162-infadoos had told [us]1436-us that [the fairest woman]1440-the fairest woman must be offered up as a sacrifice .

" Then is [my]162-infadoos mind as [your]1438-the chosen girls minds , and [my]162-infadoos eyes as [your]1438-the chosen girls eyes . [She]1440-the fairest woman is the fairest ! and a sorry thing it is for [her]1440-the fairest woman , for [she]1440-the fairest woman must die ! "[162-infadoos]

" Ay , must die ! "[122-gagool] piped out [Gagool]122-gagool , casting a glance of [her]122-gagool quick eyes in the direction of [the poor girl]1441-the poor girl , who , as yet ignorant of the awful fate in store for [her]1441-the poor girl , was standing some ten yards off in front of [a company of [maidens]3375-maidens]1442-a company of maidens , engaged in nervously picking a flower from [her]1441-the poor girl wreath to pieces , petal by petal .

" Why , [O king]3343-o king ? "[0-i] said [I]0-i , restraining [my]0-i indignation with difficulty ; " [the girl]3725-the girl has danced well , and pleased [us]3726-us ; [she]3725-the girl is fair too ; it would be hard to reward [her]3725-the girl with death . "[0-i]

[Twala]165-twala laughed as [he]165-twala answered -

" It is [our]3726-us custom , and [the figures who sit in stone yonder]3727-the figures who sit in stone yonder , "[165-twala] and [he]165-twala pointed towards [the three distant peaks]1444-the three distant peaks , " must have [their]3727-the figures who sit in stone yonder due . Did [I]165-twala fail to put [the fairest girl]3728-the fairest girl to death to - day , misfortune would fall upon [me]165-twala and [[my]165-twala house]3729-my house . Thus runs the prophecy of [[my]165-twala people]3730-my people : ' If [the king]2791-the king offer not a sacrifice of [a fair girl]3732-a fair girl , on the day of the dance of [maidens]3375-maidens , to [the Old Ones who sit and watch on [the mountains]2771-the mountains]3734-the old ones who sit and watch on the mountains , then shall [he]2791-the king fall , and [[his]2791-the king house]3736-his house . ' Look [ye]3737-ye , [white men]2713-white men , [[my]165-twala brother who reigned before [me]165-twala]3739-my brother who reigned before me offered not the sacrifice , because of the tears of [the woman]3446-the woman , and [he]3739-my brother who reigned before me fell , and [[his]3739-my brother who reigned before me house]3736-his house , and [I]165-twala reign in [his]3739-my brother who reigned before me stead . It is finished ; [she]3725-the girl must die ! "[165-twala] Then turning to [the guards]1445-the guards - " Bring [her]3725-the girl hither ; [Scragga]164-scragga , make sharp [thy]164-scragga spear . "[165-twala]

[Two of [the men]975-the men]1446-two of the men stepped forward , and as [they]1446-two of the men advanced , [the girl]3725-the girl , for the first time realising [her]3725-the girl impending fate , screamed aloud and turned to fly . But the strong hands caught [her]3725-the girl fast , and brought [her]3725-the girl , struggling and weeping , before [us]1449-us .

" What is [thy]3725-the girl name , [girl]3742-girl ? "[122-gagool] piped [Gagool]122-gagool . " What ! wilt [thou]3725-the girl not answer ? Shall [[the king]2791-the king 's son]3093-the king 's son do [his]3093-the king 's son work at once ? "[122-gagool]

At this hint , [Scragga]164-scragga , looking more evil than ever , advanced a step and lifted [his]164-scragga great spear , and at that moment [I]0-i saw [Good]98-good 's hand creep to [his]98-good revolver . [The poor girl]1441-the poor girl caught the faint glint of steel through [her]1441-the poor girl tears , and it sobered [her]1441-the poor girl anguish . [She]3725-the girl ceased struggling , and clasping [her]3725-the girl hands convulsively , stood shuddering from head to foot .

" See , "[164-scragga] cried [Scragga]164-scragga in high glee , ' [she]3725-the girl shrinks from the sight of [my]0-i little plaything even before [she]3725-the girl has tasted it , " and [he]0-i tapped the broad blade of [his]0-i spear .[3725-the girl]

" If ever [I]98-good get the chance [you]1441-the poor girl shall pay for that , [[you]1441-the poor girl young hound]3745-you young hound ! "[98-good] [I]0-i heard [Good]98-good mutter beneath [his]98-good breath .

" Now that [thou]1441-the poor girl art quiet , give [us]1441-the poor girl [thy]1441-the poor girl name , [[my]122-gagool dear]3746-my dear . Come , speak out , and fear not , "[122-gagool] said [Gagool]122-gagool in mockery .

" Oh , [mother]3569-mother , "[3725-the girl] answered [the girl]3725-the girl , in trembling accents , " [my]3725-the girl name is [Foulata]99-foulata , of [the house of [Suko]179-suko]3748-the house of suko . " Be comforted , "[1452-the old woman] went on [the old woman]1452-the old woman in [her]1452-the old woman hateful tone of mockery . " [Thou]3750-thou must die , indeed , as a sacrifice to [the Old Ones who sit yonder]3751-the old ones who sit yonder , "[1452-the old woman] and [she]1452-the old woman pointed to [the peaks]1453-the peaks ; " but it is better to sleep in the night than to toil in the daytime ; it is better to die than to live , and [thou]3750-thou shalt die by the royal hand of [[the king]2791-the king 's own son]3753-the king 's own son . "[1452-the old woman]

[The girl]3725-the girl [Foulata]99-foulata wrung [her]99-foulata hands in anguish , and cried out aloud , " Oh , cruel ! and [I]99-foulata so young ! What have [I]99-foulata done that [I]99-foulata should never again see the sun rise out of the night , or the stars come following on [his]2791-the king track in the evening , that [I]99-foulata may no more gather the flowers when the dew is heavy , or listen to the laughing of the waters ? Woe is [me]99-foulata , that [I]99-foulata shall never see [[[my]99-foulata father]2882-my father 's hut]3755-my father 's hut again , nor feel [[my]99-foulata mother]3491-my mother 's kiss , nor tend [the lamb that is sick]3757-the lamb that is sick ! Woe is [me]99-foulata , that [no lover]3758-no lover shall put [his]2791-the king arm around [me]99-foulata and look into [my]99-foulata eyes , nor shall [men children]3759-men children be born of [me]99-foulata ! Oh , cruel , cruel ! "[99-foulata]

And again [she]1455-her wrung [her]1455-her hands and turned [her]1455-her tear - stained flower - crowned face to Heaven , looking so lovely in [her]1455-her despair - for [she]1455-her was indeed [a beautiful woman]1456-a beautiful woman - that assuredly the sight of [her]1455-her would have melted the hearts of any less cruel than were [the three fiends before [us]1458-us]1457-the three fiends before us . [Prince Arthur]180-prince arthur 's appeal to [the ruffians who came to blind [him]180-prince arthur]1459-the ruffians who came to blind him was not more touching than that of [this savage girl]1460-this savage girl .

But it did not move [Gagool]122-gagool or [[Gagool]122-gagool 's master]1461-gagool 's master , though [I]0-i saw signs of pity among [the guards behind]1462-the guards behind , and on the faces of [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs ; and as for Good , [he]180-prince arthur gave a fierce snort of indignation , and made a motion as though to go to [her]1455-her assistance . With all [a woman]272-a woman 's quickness , [the doomed girl]1465-the doomed girl interpreted what was passing in [his]180-prince arthur mind , and by a sudden movement flung [herself]1465-the doomed girl before [him]180-prince arthur , and clasped [his]180-prince arthur " beautiful white legs "[1465-the doomed girl] with [her]1465-the doomed girl hands .

" Oh , [white father from [the Stars]70-the stars]3760-white father from the stars ! "[1465-the doomed girl] [she]1465-the doomed girl cried , " throw over [me]1465-the doomed girl the mantle of [thy]180-prince arthur protection ; let [me]1465-the doomed girl creep into the shadow of [thy]180-prince arthur strength , that [I]1465-the doomed girl may be saved . Oh , keep [me]1465-the doomed girl from [these cruel men]3761-these cruel men and from the mercies of [Gagool]122-gagool ! "[1465-the doomed girl]

" All right , [my]181-saxon hearty , [I]181-saxon 'll look after [you]1465-the doomed girl , "[181-saxon] sang out Good in nervous [Saxon]181-saxon . " Come , get up , there 's [a good girl]3762-a good girl , "[180-prince arthur] and [he]180-prince arthur stooped and caught [her]1465-the doomed girl hand .

[Twala]165-twala turned and motioned to [[his]165-twala son]3439-his son , who advanced with [his]180-prince arthur spear lifted .

" Now 's [your]0-i time , "[97-sir henry] whispered [Sir Henry]97-sir henry to [me]0-i ; " what are [you]0-i waiting for ? "[97-sir henry]

" [I]0-i am waiting for that eclipse , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " [I]0-i have had [my]0-i eye on the moon for the last half - hour , and [I]0-i never saw it look healthier . "[0-i]

" Well , [you]0-i must risk it now , or [the girl]3725-the girl will be killed . [Twala]165-twala is losing patience . "[97-sir henry]

Recognising the force of the argument , and having cast one more despairing look at the bright face of [the moon]1467-the moon , for never did [the most ardent astronomer with a theory to prove await a celestial event with such anxiety]1468-the most ardent astronomer with a theory to prove await a celestial event with such anxiety , [I]0-i stepped with all the dignity that [I]0-i could command between [the prostrate girl]1469-the prostrate girl and the advancing spear of [Scragga]164-scragga .

" [King]554-king , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " it shall not be ; [we]1471-we will not endure this thing ; let [the girl]3725-the girl go in safety . "[0-i]

[Twala]165-twala rose from [his]165-twala seat in wrath and astonishment , and from [the chiefs and serried ranks of maidens who had closed in slowly upon [us]1471-we in anticipation of the tragedy came a murmur of amazement]1470-the chiefs and serried ranks of maidens who had closed in slowly upon us in anticipation of the tragedy came a murmur of amazement .

" Shall not be ! [thou]3766-thou white dog , that yappest at the lion in [[his]164-scragga cave]3767-his cave ; shall not be ! art [thou]3766-thou mad ? Be careful , lest [this chicken]3768-this chicken 's fate overtake [thee]3766-thou , and those with [thee]3766-thou . How canst [thou]3766-thou save [her]3725-the girl or [thyself]3769-thyself ? Who art [thou]3766-thou that [thou]3766-thou settest thyself between [me]1472-me and [my]1472-me will ? Back , [I]1472-me say . [Scragga]164-scragga , kill [her]3725-the girl ! Ho , [guards]3770-guards ! seize [these men]1197-these men . "[1472-me]

At [his]1472-me cry [armed men]1473-armed men ran swiftly from behind [the hut]1095-the hut , where [they]1473-armed men had evidently been placed beforehand .

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry , Good , and [Umbopa]169-ignosi ranged [themselves]1473-armed men alongside of [me]0-i , and lifted [their]1473-armed men rifles .

" Stop ! "[0-i] [I]0-i shouted boldly , though at the moment [my]0-i heart was in [my]0-i boots . " Stop ! [we]3772-we , [the white men from [the Stars]70-the stars]3536-the white men from the stars , say that it shall not be . Come but one pace nearer , and [we]3772-we will put out the moon like a wind - blown lamp , as [we]3772-we who dwell in [[her]3774-her House]3775-her house can do , and plunge [the land]3165-the land in darkness . Dare to disobey , and [ye]3777-ye shall taste of [our]3772-we magic . "[0-i]

[My]0-i threat produced an effect ; [the men]975-the men halted , and [Scragga]164-scragga stood still before [us]1476-us , [his]164-scragga spear lifted .

" Hear [him]164-scragga ! hear [him]164-scragga ! "[122-gagool] piped [Gagool]122-gagool ; " hear [the liar]3778-the liar who says that [he]164-scragga will put out the moon like a lamp . Let [him]164-scragga do it , and [the girl]3725-the girl shall be speared . Yes , let [him]164-scragga do it , or die by [the girl]3725-the girl , [he]164-scragga and [those with [him]164-scragga]3781-those with him . "[122-gagool]

[I]0-i glanced up at the moon despairingly , and now to [my]0-i intense joy and relief saw that [we]1476-us - or rather the almanack - had made no mistake . On the edge of the great orb lay a faint rim of shadow , while a smoky hue grew and gathered upon its bright surface . Never shall [I]0-i forget that supreme , that superb moment of relief .

Then [I]0-i lifted [my]0-i hand solemnly towards the sky , an example which [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [Good]98-good followed , and quoted a line or two from the " Ingoldsby Legends "[98-good] at it in the most impressive tones that [I]0-i could command . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry followed suit with a verse out of the Old Testament , and something about [Balbus]182-balbus building a wall , in Latin , whilst [Good]98-good addressed [the Queen of Night]1477-the queen of night in a volume of the most classical bad language which [he]98-good could think of .

Slowly the penumbra , the shadow of a shadow , crept on over the bright surface , and as it crept [I]0-i heard deep gasps of fear rising from the multitude around .

" Look , [O king]3343-o king ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried ; " look , [Gagool]122-gagool ! Look , [chiefs]538-chiefs and [people]1237-people and [women]3373-women , and see if [the white men from [the Stars]70-the stars]3536-the white men from the stars keep [their]3536-the white men from the stars word , or if [they]3536-the white men from the stars be but [empty liars]3787-empty liars ![0-i]

" The moon grows black before [your]3788-your eyes ; soon there will be darkness - ay , darkness in the hour of the full moon . [Ye]3788-your have asked for a sign ; it is given to [you]3788-your . Grow dark , O Moon ! withdraw [thy]3788-your light , [thou]3788-your pure and holy One ; bring the proud heart of usurping murderers to the dust , and eat up [the world]248-the world with shadows . "[1478-the onlookers]

A groan of terror burst from [the onlookers]1478-the onlookers . [Some]1479-some stood petrified with dread , [others]841-others threw [themselves]841-others upon [their]841-others knees and cried aloud . As for [the king]2791-the king , [he]2791-the king sat still and turned pale beneath [his]2791-the king dusky skin . Only [Gagool]122-gagool kept [her]122-gagool courage .

" It will pass , "[122-gagool] [she]122-gagool cried ; " [I]122-gagool have often seen the like before ; [no man]3209-no man can put out the moon ; lose not heart ; sit still - the shadow will pass . "[122-gagool]

" Wait , and [ye]122-gagool shall see , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied , hopping with excitement . " O [Moon]183-moon ! Moon ! Moon ! wherefore art [thou]122-gagool so cold and fickle ? "[0-i] This appropriate quotation was from the pages of a popular romance that [I]0-i chanced to have read recently , though now [I]0-i come to think of it , it was ungrateful of [me]0-i to abuse [the Lady of [the Heavens]1483-the heavens]1482-the lady of the heavens , who was showing [herself]1482-the lady of the heavens to be [the truest of friends to [us]1485-us]1484-the truest of friends to us , however [she]1482-the lady of the heavens may have behaved to [the impassioned lover in the novel]1486-the impassioned lover in the novel . Then [I]0-i added : " Keep it up , [Good]493-good , [I]0-i ca n't remember any more poetry . Curse away , there 's [a good fellow]3792-a good fellow . "[0-i]

[Good]98-good responded nobly to this tax upon [his]98-good inventive faculties . Never before had [I]0-i the faintest conception of the breadth and depth and height of [a naval officer]319-a naval officer 's objurgatory powers . For ten minutes [he]98-good went on in several languages without stopping , and [he]98-good scarcely ever repeated [himself]98-good .

Meanwhile the dark ring crept on , while [all that great assembly]1488-all that great assembly fixed [their]1488-all that great assembly eyes upon the sky and stared and stared in fascinated silence . Strange and unholy shadows encroached upon the moonlight , an ominous quiet filled [the place]3034-the place . Everything grew still as death . Slowly and in the midst of this most solemn silence the minutes sped away , and while [they]1490-they sped the full moon passed deeper and deeper into the shadow of [the earth]632-the earth , as the inky segment of its circle slid in awful majesty across [the lunar craters]1492-the lunar craters . The great pale orb seemed to draw near and to grow in size . [She]1482-the lady of the heavens turned a coppery hue , then that portion of [her]1482-the lady of the heavens surface which was unobscured as yet grew grey and ashen , and at length , as totality approached , [[her]1482-the lady of the heavens mountains]1493-her mountains and [[her]1482-the lady of the heavens plains]1494-her plains were to be seen glowing luridly through a crimson gloom .

On , yet on , crept the ring of darkness ; it was now more than half across the blood - red orb . The air grew thick , and still more deeply tinged with dusky crimson . On , yet on , till [we]1495-we could scarcely see the fierce faces of [the group before [us]1495-we]994-the group before us . No sound rose now from [the spectators]1497-the spectators , and at last [Good]98-good stopped swearing .

" The moon is dying - [the white wizards]3793-the white wizards have killed the moon , "[1498-the prince scragga] yelled [the prince Scragga]1498-the prince scragga at last . " [We]1495-we shall all perish in the dark , "[1498-the prince scragga] and animated by fear or fury , or by both , [he]1498-the prince scragga lifted [his]1498-the prince scragga spear and drove it with all [his]1498-the prince scragga force at [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's breast . But [he]1498-the prince scragga forgot the mail shirts that [the king]2791-the king had given [us]1495-we , and which [we]1495-we wore beneath [our]1495-we clothing . The steel rebounded harmless , and before [he]1498-the prince scragga could repeat the blow [Curtis]97-sir henry had snatched the spear from [his]1498-the prince scragga hand and sent it straight through [him]1498-the prince scragga .

[Scragga]164-scragga dropped dead .

At the sight , and driven mad with fear of the gathering darkness , and of the unholy shadow which , as [they]1497-the spectators believed , was swallowing the moon , [the companies of [girls]3699-girls]1500-the companies of girls broke up in wild confusion , and ran screeching for the gateways . Nor did the panic stop there . [The king]2791-the king [himself]2791-the king , followed by [[his]2791-the king guards]1503-his guards , [some of [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs]1504-some of the chiefs , and [Gagool]122-gagool , who hobbled away after [them]1497-the spectators with marvellous alacrity , fled for [the huts]1072-the huts , so that in another minute [we]1495-we [ourselves]1495-we , [the would - be victim [Foulata]99-foulata , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , and most of [the chiefs who had interviewed [us]1495-we on the previous night]1508-the chiefs who had interviewed us on the previous night , were left alone upon the scene , together with the dead body of [Scragga]164-scragga , [[Twala]165-twala 's son]1509-twala 's son]1507-the would - be victim foulata , infadoos , and most of the chiefs who had interviewed us on the previous night , were left alone upon the scene , together with the dead body of scragga , twala 's son .

" [Chiefs]538-chiefs , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [we]1495-we have given [you]538-chiefs the sign . If [ye]538-chiefs are satisfied , let [us]1495-we fly swiftly to the place of which [ye]538-chiefs spoke . The charm can not now be stopped . It will work for an hour and the half of an hour . Let [us]1495-we cover [ourselves]1495-we in the darkness . "[0-i]

" Come , "[162-infadoos] said [Infadoos]162-infadoos , turning to go , an example which was followed by [the awed captains]1510-the awed captains , [ourselves]1495-we , and [the girl]3725-the girl [Foulata]99-foulata , whom [Good]98-good took by the arm .

Before [we]1495-we reached [the gate of [the kraal]67-the kraal]1512-the gate of the kraal the moon went out utterly , and from every quarter of the firmament the stars rushed forth into the inky sky .

Holding each other by the hand [we]1495-we stumbled on through the darkness .

CHAPTER XII

BEFORE THE BATTLE

Luckily for [us]1495-we , [Infadoos]162-infadoos and [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs knew all the paths of [the great town]1514-the great town perfectly , so that [we]1495-we passed by side - ways unmolested , and notwithstanding the gloom [we]1495-we made fair progress .

For an hour or more [we]1495-we journeyed on , till at length the eclipse began to pass , and that edge of the moon which had disappeared the first became again visible . Suddenly , as [we]1495-we watched , there burst from it a silver streak of light , accompanied by a wondrous ruddy glow , which hung upon the blackness of the sky like a celestial lamp , and a wild and lovely sight it was . In another five minutes the stars began to fade , and there was sufficient light to see [our]1495-we whereabouts . [We]1495-we then discovered that [we]1495-we were clear of [the town of [Loo]3-loo]1515-the town of loo , and approaching [a large flat - topped hill]1516-a large flat - topped hill , measuring some two miles in circumference . [This hill , which is of a formation common in [South Africa]23-south africa]1517-this hill , which is of a formation common in south africa , is not very high ; indeed , [its]1517-this hill , which is of a formation common in south africa greatest elevation is scarcely more than 200 feet , but [it]1517-this hill , which is of a formation common in south africa is shaped like a horseshoe , and [its]1517-this hill , which is of a formation common in south africa sides are rather precipitous and strewn with boulders . On the grass table - land at [its]1517-this hill , which is of a formation common in south africa summit is ample camping - ground , which had been utilised as [a military cantonment of no mean strength . [[Its]1517-this hill , which is of a formation common in south africa ordinary garrison]1519-its ordinary garrison]1518-a military cantonment of no mean strength . its ordinary garrison was [one regiment of [three thousand men]1521-three thousand men]1520-one regiment of three thousand men , but as [we]1495-we toiled up [the steep side of [the mountain]659-the mountain]1522-the steep side of the mountain in the returning moonlight [we]1495-we perceived that there were [several of such regiments encamped there]1524-several of such regiments encamped there .

Reaching [the table - land]1525-the table - land at last , [we]1495-we found [crowds of men]1526-crowds of men roused from [their]1526-crowds of men sleep , shivering with fear and huddled up together in the utmost consternation at the natural phenomenon which [they]1526-crowds of men were witnessing . Passing through these without a word , [we]1495-we gained [a hut in [the centre of the ground]1528-the centre of the ground , where [we]1495-we were astonished to find [two men]1233-two men waiting , laden with [our]1495-we few goods and chattels , which of course [we]1495-we had been obliged to leave behind in [our]1495-we hasty flight]1527-a hut in the centre of the ground , where we were astonished to find two men waiting , laden with our few goods and chattels , which of course we had been obliged to leave behind in our hasty flight .

" [I]162-infadoos sent for [them]1233-two men , "[162-infadoos] explained [Infadoos]162-infadoos ; " and also for these , "[162-infadoos] and [he]162-infadoos lifted up [Good]98-good 's long - lost trousers .

With an exclamation of rapturous delight [Good]98-good sprang at [them]1233-two men , and instantly proceeded to put them on .

" Surely [[my]162-infadoos lord]3088-my lord will not hide [his]98-good beautiful white legs ! "[162-infadoos] exclaimed [Infadoos]162-infadoos regretfully .

But [Good]98-good persisted , and once only did [the Kukuana people]3110-the kukuana people get the chance of seeing [his]98-good beautiful legs again . [Good]98-good is [a very modest man]1531-a very modest man . Henceforward [they]3110-the kukuana people had to satisfy [their]3110-the kukuana people æsthetic longings with [his]98-good one whisker , [his]98-good transparent eye , and [his]98-good movable teeth .

Still gazing with fond remembrance at [Good]98-good 's trousers , [Infadoos]162-infadoos next informed [us]1532-we that [he]162-infadoos had commanded [the regiments]1144-the regiments to muster so soon as the day broke , in order to explain to [them]1144-the regiments fully the origin and circumstances of the rebellion which was decided on by [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs , and to introduce to [them]1144-the regiments [the rightful heir to the throne]1535-the rightful heir to the throne , [Ignosi]169-ignosi .

Accordingly , when the sun was up , [the troops]1536-the troops - in all some [twenty thousand men]1537-twenty thousand men , and [the flower of [the Kukuana army]1539-the kukuana army]1538-the flower of the kukuana army - were mustered on [a large open space , to which [we]1532-we went]1540-a large open space , to which we went . [The men]975-the men were drawn up in three sides of [a dense square]1542-a dense square , and presented a magnificent spectacle . [We]1532-we took [our]1532-we station on the open side of [the square]1543-the square , and were speedily surrounded by [all the principal chiefs]1544-all the principal chiefs and [officers]1545-officers .

These , after silence had been proclaimed , [Infadoos]162-infadoos proceeded to address . [He]162-infadoos narrated to [them]1144-the regiments in vigorous and graceful language - for , like [most Kukuanas of high rank]1546-most kukuanas of high rank , [he]162-infadoos was [a born orator]1547-a born orator - the history of [[Ignosi]169-ignosi 's father]1548-ignosi 's father , and of how [he]1548-ignosi 's father had been basely murdered by [Twala]165-twala [the king]2791-the king , and [[his]165-twala wife]3235-his wife and [child]1551-child driven out to starve .
