Then [he]162-infadoos pointed out that [the people]3142-the people suffered and groaned under [Twala]165-twala 's cruel rule , instancing the proceedings of the previous night , when , under pretence of [their]3142-the people being [evil - doers]3590-evil - doers , [many of [the noblest in [the land]3165-the land]1555-the noblest in the land]1554-many of the noblest in the land had been dragged forth and wickedly done to death . Next [he]162-infadoos went on to say that [the white lords from [the Stars]70-the stars]1557-the white lords from the stars , looking down upon [[their]1557-the white lords from the stars country]1558-their country , had perceived its trouble , and determined , at great personal inconvenience , to alleviate its lot : That [they]1557-the white lords from the stars had accordingly taken [the real king of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]1559-the real king of the kukuanas , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , who was languishing in exile , by the hand , and led [him]1559-the real king of the kukuanas over [the mountains]2771-the mountains : That [they]1557-the white lords from the stars had seen the wickedness of [Twala]165-twala 's doings , and for a sign to the wavering , and to save the life of [the girl Foulata]1561-the girl foulata , actually , by the exercise of [their]1557-the white lords from the stars high magic , had put out the moon and slain [the young fiend [Scragga]164-scragga]1562-the young fiend scragga ; and that [they]1557-the white lords from the stars were prepared to stand by [them]1557-the white lords from the stars , and assist [them]1557-the white lords from the stars to overthrow [Twala]165-twala , and set up [the rightful king]3633-the rightful king , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , in [his]3633-the rightful king place .

[He]169-ignosi finished [his]169-ignosi discourse amidst a murmur of approbation . Then [Ignosi]169-ignosi stepped forward and began to speak . Having reiterated all that Infadoos [[his]169-ignosi uncle]3094-his uncle had said , [he]169-ignosi concluded a powerful speech in these words : -

" O [chiefs]538-chiefs , [captains]3797-captains , [soldiers]3798-soldiers , and [people]1237-people , [ye]3798-soldiers have heard [my]169-ignosi words . Now must [ye]3798-soldiers make choice between [me]169-ignosi and [him]3094-his uncle who sits upon [my]169-ignosi throne , [the uncle who killed [[his]3094-his uncle brother]376-his brother , and hunted [[his]3094-his uncle brother]376-his brother 's child forth to die in the cold and the night]3800-the uncle who killed his brother , and hunted his brother 's child forth to die in the cold and the night . That [I]169-ignosi am indeed [the king these]3803-the king these "[169-ignosi] - pointing to [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs - " can tell [you]3798-soldiers , for [they]3532-the chiefs have seen the snake about [my]169-ignosi middle . If [I]169-ignosi were not [the king]2791-the king , would [these white men]3805-these white men be on [my]169-ignosi side with all [their]3805-these white men magic ? [Tremble]184-tremble , [chiefs]538-chiefs , [captains]3797-captains , [soldiers]3798-soldiers , and [people]1237-people ! Is not the darkness [they]3805-these white men have brought upon [the land]3165-the land to confound [Twala]64-twala and cover [our]3811-our flight , darkness even in the hour of the full moon , yet before [your]3431-the soldiers eyes ? "[169-ignosi]

" It is , "[3431-the soldiers] answered [the soldiers]3431-the soldiers .

" [I]169-ignosi am [the king]2791-the king ; [I]169-ignosi say to [you]3431-the soldiers , [I]169-ignosi am [the king]2791-the king , "[169-ignosi] went on [Ignosi]169-ignosi , drawing up [his]169-ignosi great stature to its full , and lifting [his]169-ignosi broad - bladed battle - axe above [his]169-ignosi head . " If there be [any man among you who says that it is not so]3814-any man among you who says that it is not so , let [him]3814-any man among you who says that it is not so stand forth and [I]169-ignosi will fight [him]3814-any man among you who says that it is not so now , and [his]3814-any man among you who says that it is not so blood shall be a red token that [I]169-ignosi tell [you]3431-the soldiers true . Let [him]3814-any man among you who says that it is not so stand forth , [I]169-ignosi say ; "[169-ignosi] and [he]169-ignosi shook the great axe till it flashed in the sunlight .

As [nobody]782-nobody seemed inclined to respond to this heroic version of " [Dilly]185-dilly , [Dilly]185-dilly , come and be killed , "[169-ignosi] [[our]1568-our late henchman]1569-our late henchman proceeded with [his]169-ignosi address .

" [I]169-ignosi am indeed [the king]2791-the king , and should [ye]3431-the soldiers stand by [my]169-ignosi side in the battle , if [I]169-ignosi win the day [ye]3431-the soldiers shall go with [me]169-ignosi to victory and honour . [I]169-ignosi will give [you]3431-the soldiers oxen and [wives]3706-wives , and [ye]3431-the soldiers shall take place of [all the regiments]3817-all the regiments ; and if [ye]3431-the soldiers fall , [I]169-ignosi will fall with [you]3431-the soldiers .[169-ignosi]

" And behold , [I]169-ignosi give [you]3431-the soldiers this promise , that when [I]169-ignosi sit upon the seat of [[my]169-ignosi fathers]3818-my fathers , bloodshed shall cease in [the land]3165-the land . No longer shall [ye]3431-the soldiers cry for justice to find slaughter , no longer shall [the witch - finder]2799-the witch - finder hunt [you]3431-the soldiers out so that [ye]3431-the soldiers may be slain without a cause . [No man]3209-no man shall die save [he]3209-no man who offends against the laws . The ' eating up ' of [your]3431-the soldiers kraals shall cease ; each one of [you]3431-the soldiers shall sleep secure in [[his]3209-no man own hut]3822-his own hut and fear naught , and justice shall walk blindfold throughout [the land]3165-the land . Have [ye]3431-the soldiers chosen , [chiefs]538-chiefs , [captains]3797-captains , [soldiers]3798-soldiers , and [people]1237-people ? "[169-ignosi]

" [We]3431-the soldiers have chosen , [O king]3343-o king , "[169-ignosi] came back the answer .

" It is well . Turn [your]3431-the soldiers heads and see how [[Twala]165-twala 's messengers]3829-twala 's messengers go forth from [the great town]1514-the great town , [east and west]3831-east and west , and north and south , to gather a mighty army to slay [me]169-ignosi and [you]3431-the soldiers , and [these [my]169-ignosi friends]3832-these my friends and protectors . To - morrow , or perchance the next day , [he]165-twala will come against [us]3431-the soldiers with [all who are faithful to [him]165-twala]3833-all who are faithful to him . Then [I]169-ignosi shall see [the man who is indeed [[my]169-ignosi man]3492-my man , [the man who fears not to die for [his]3834-the man who is indeed my man , the man who fears not to die for his cause cause]3836-the man who fears not to die for his cause]3834-the man who is indeed my man , the man who fears not to die for his cause ; and [I]169-ignosi tell [you]3431-the soldiers that [he]3834-the man who is indeed my man , the man who fears not to die for his cause shall not be forgotten in the time of spoil . [I]169-ignosi have spoken , [O chiefs]3837-o chiefs , [captains]3797-captains , [soldiers]3798-soldiers , and [people]1237-people . Now go to [[your]3431-the soldiers huts]3841-your huts and make [you]3431-the soldiers ready for war . "[169-ignosi]

There was a pause , till presently [one of [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs]1570-one of the chiefs lifted [his]1570-one of the chiefs hand , and out rolled the royal salute , " [Koom]167-koom . "[1570-one of the chiefs] It was a sign that [the soldiers]3431-the soldiers accepted [Ignosi]169-ignosi as [[their]3431-the soldiers king]1573-their king . Then [they]3431-the soldiers marched off in battalions .

Half an hour afterwards [we]1574-we held a council of war , at which [all the commanders of [regiments]1294-regiments]1575-all the commanders of regiments were present . It was evident to [us]1574-we that before very long [we]1574-we should be attacked in overwhelming force . Indeed , from [our]1574-we point of vantage on [the hill]3022-the hill [we]1574-we could see [troops]1132-troops mustering , and [runners]1579-runners going forth from [Loo]3-loo in every direction , doubtless to summon [soldiers]3798-soldiers to [the king]2791-the king 's assistance . [We]1574-we had on [our]1574-we side about [twenty thousand men]1537-twenty thousand men , composed of [seven of the best regiments in [the country]300-the country]1583-seven of the best regiments in the country . [Twala]165-twala , so [Infadoos]162-infadoos and [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs calculated , had at least thirty to [thirty - five thousand on whom [he]165-twala could rely at present assembled in [Loo]3-loo]1586-thirty - five thousand on whom he could rely at present assembled in loo , and [they]3532-the chiefs thought that by midday on the morrow [he]165-twala would be able to gather another five thousand or more to [his]165-twala aid . It was , of course , possible that [some of [[his]165-twala troops]1588-his troops]1587-some of his troops would desert and come over to [us]1574-we , but it was not a contingency which could be reckoned on . Meanwhile , it was clear that active preparations were being made by [Twala]165-twala to subdue [us]1574-we . [Already strong bodies of [armed men]1473-armed men]1589-already strong bodies of armed men were patrolling round and round [the foot of [the hill]3022-the hill]1591-the foot of the hill , and there were other signs also of coming assault .

[Infadoos]162-infadoos and [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs , however , were of opinion that no attack would take place that day , which would be devoted to preparation and to the removal of every available means of the moral effect produced upon the minds of [the soldiery by the supposed magical darkening of the moon]1594-the soldiery by the supposed magical darkening of the moon . The onslaught would be on the morrow , [they]3532-the chiefs said , and [they]3532-the chiefs proved to be right .

Meanwhile , [we]1574-we set to work to strengthen the position in all ways possible . [Almost every man]1595-almost every man was turned out , and in the course of the day , which seemed far too short , much was done . [The paths up [the hill]3022-the hill]1596-the paths up the hill - that was rather [a sanatorium]1598-a sanatorium than [a fortress]1599-a fortress , being used generally as [the camping place of regiments suffering from recent service in unhealthy portions of [the country]300-the country]1600-the camping place of regiments suffering from recent service in unhealthy portions of the country - were carefully blocked with masses of stones , and every other approach was made as impregnable as time would allow . Piles of boulders were collected at various spots to be rolled down upon [an advancing enemy]1602-an advancing enemy , stations were appointed to [the different regiments]1603-the different regiments , and all preparation was made which [our]1574-we joint ingenuity could suggest .

Just before sundown , as [we]1574-we rested after [our]1574-we toil , [we]1574-we perceived [a small company of [men]326-men advancing towards [us]1574-we from the direction of [Loo]3-loo]1604-a small company of men advancing towards us from the direction of loo , one of whom bore a palm leaf in [his]3-loo hand for a sign that [he]3-loo came as [a herald]1606-a herald .

As [he]3-loo drew near , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [one or two chiefs]1607-one or two chiefs and [ourselves]1574-we , went down to [the foot of [the mountain]659-the mountain]1608-the foot of the mountain to meet [him]3-loo . [He]3-loo was [a gallant - looking fellow]1610-a gallant - looking fellow , wearing the regulation leopard - skin cloak .

" Greeting ! "[3-loo] [he]3-loo cried , as [he]3-loo came ; " [the king]2791-the king 's greeting to [those who make unholy war against [the king]2791-the king]3843-those who make unholy war against the king ; the lion 's greeting to the jackals that snarl around [his]3-loo heels . "[3-loo]

" Speak , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" These are [the king]2791-the king 's words . Surrender to [the king]2791-the king 's mercy ere a worse thing befall [you]3847-you . Already the shoulder has been torn from the black bull , and [the king]2791-the king drives [him]3-loo bleeding about [the camp]530-the camp . "[3-loo] 1

" What are [Twala]165-twala 's terms ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked from curiosity .

" [His]165-twala terms are merciful , worthy of [a great king]3850-a great king . These are the words of [Twala]165-twala , the one - eyed , the mighty , [the husband of a thousand wives]3851-the husband of a thousand wives , [lord of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]3852-lord of the kukuanas , [keeper of [the Great Road]3117-the great road [[Solomon]90-solomon 's Road]75-solomon 's road , beloved of [the Strange Ones who sit in silence at [the mountains yonder]3665-the mountains yonder [the Three Witches]3857-the three witches]3855-the strange ones who sit in silence at the mountains yonder the three witches , [Calf of the Black Cow]187-calf of the black cow , Elephant whose tread shakes [the earth]632-the earth , Terror of [the evil - doer]3583-the evil - doer , Ostrich whose feet devour [the desert]2742-the desert , huge One , black One , [wise One]3861-wise one , [king from generation to generation]3862-king from generation to generation]3853-keeper of the great road solomon 's road , beloved of the strange ones who sit in silence at the mountains yonder the three witches , calf of the black cow , elephant whose tread shakes the earth , terror of the evil - doer , ostrich whose feet devour the desert , huge one , black one , wise one , king from generation to generation ! these are the words of [Twala]165-twala : ' [I]1612-my will have mercy and be satisfied with a little blood . [One in every ten]3863-one in every ten shall die , [the rest]3864-the rest shall go free ; but [the white man Incubu]3865-the white man incubu , who slew [Scragga]164-scragga [[my]1612-my son]2864-my son , and [the black man [his]1612-my servant , who pretends to [my]1612-my throne , and [Infadoos]162-infadoos [[my]1612-my brother]2648-my brother , who brews rebellion against [me]1612-my , these shall die by torture as an offering to [the Silent Ones]188-the silent ones . ' Such are the merciful words of [Twala]165-twala]3867-the black man his servant , who pretends to my throne , and infadoos my brother , who brews rebellion against me , these shall die by torture as an offering to the silent ones . ' such are the merciful words of twala . "[1612-my]

After consulting with [the others]595-the others a little , [I]0-i answered [him]1612-my in a loud voice , so that [the soldiers]3431-the soldiers might hear , thus -

" Go back , [thou]3869-thou dog , to [Twala]165-twala , who sent [thee]3869-thou , and say that [we]3870-we , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [veritable king of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]3871-veritable king of the kukuanas , [Incubu]150-incubu , [Bougwan]144-bougwan , and [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , [the wise ones from the Stars , who make dark the moon]3872-the wise ones from the stars , who make dark the moon , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , of [the royal house]3873-the royal house , and [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs , [captains]3797-captains , and [people here]3876-people here gathered , make answer and say , ' That [we]3870-we will not surrender ; that before the sun has gone down twice , [Twala]165-twala 's corpse shall stiffen at [[Twala]165-twala 's gate]3877-twala 's gate , and [Ignosi]169-ignosi , whose father [Twala]165-twala slew , shall reign in [his]165-twala stead . ' Now go , ere [we]3870-we whip [thee]165-twala away , and beware how [thou]165-twala dost lift a hand against such as [we]3870-we are . "[0-i]

[The herald]1614-the herald laughed loudly . " [Ye]165-twala frighten not [men]326-men with such swelling words , "[1614-the herald] [he]1614-the herald cried out . " Show [yourselves]165-twala as bold to - morrow , O [ye]165-twala who darken the moon . Be bold , fight , and be merry , before the crows pick [your]165-twala bones till they are whiter than [your]165-twala faces . Farewell ; perhaps [we]1615-we may meet in the fight ; fly not to the Stars , but wait for [me]1614-the herald , [I]1614-the herald pray , [white men]2713-white men . "[1614-the herald] With this shaft of sarcasm [he]1614-the herald retired , and almost immediately the sun sank .

That night was a busy one , for weary as [we]1615-we were , so far as was possible by the moonlight all preparations for the morrow 's fight were continued , and [messengers]1115-messengers were constantly coming and going from the place where [we]1615-we sat in council . At last , about an hour after midnight , everything that could be done was done , and [the camp]530-the camp , save for the occasional challenge of [a sentry]1166-a sentry , sank into silence . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [I]0-i , accompanied by [Ignosi]169-ignosi and [one of [the chiefs]3532-the chiefs]1570-one of the chiefs , descended [the hill]3022-the hill and made a round of the pickets . As [we]1615-we went , suddenly , from all sorts of unexpected places , spears gleamed out in the moonlight , only to vanish again when [we]1615-we uttered the password . It was clear to [us]1615-we that [none]2774-none were sleeping at [their]2774-none posts . Then [we]1615-we returned , picking [our]1615-we way warily through [thousands of sleeping warriors]1623-thousands of sleeping warriors , [many of whom were taking their last earthly rest]1624-many of whom were taking their last earthly rest .

The moonlight flickering along [their]1623-thousands of sleeping warriors spears , played upon [their]1623-thousands of sleeping warriors features and made [them]1623-thousands of sleeping warriors ghastly ; the chilly night wind tossed [their]1623-thousands of sleeping warriors tall and hearse - like plumes . There [they]1623-thousands of sleeping warriors lay in wild confusion , with arms outstretched and twisted limbs ; [their]1623-thousands of sleeping warriors stern , stalwart forms looking weird and unhuman in the moonlight .

" How many of these do [you]97-sir henry suppose will be alive at this time to - morrow ? "[97-sir henry] asked [Sir Henry]97-sir henry .

[I]0-i shook [my]0-i head and looked again at [the sleeping men]1625-the sleeping men , and to [my]0-i tired and yet excited imagination it seemed as though Death had already touched [them]1625-the sleeping men . [My]0-i mind 's eye singled out [those who were sealed to slaughter]1626-those who were sealed to slaughter , and there rushed in upon [my]0-i heart a great sense of the mystery of human life , and an overwhelming sorrow at its futility and sadness . To - night [these thousands]1627-these thousands slept [their]1627-these thousands healthy sleep , to - morrow [they]1627-these thousands , and [many others with [them]1627-these thousands]1628-many others with them , [ourselves]1629-we perhaps among [them]1627-these thousands , would be stiffening in the cold ; [[their]1627-these thousands wives]1630-their wives would be [widows]1631-widows , [[their]1627-these thousands children]1632-their children fatherless , and [their]1627-these thousands place know [them]1627-these thousands no more for ever . Only the old moon would shine on serenely , the night wind would stir the grasses , and [the wide earth]1633-the wide earth would take its rest , even as it did æons before [we]1629-we were , and will do æons after [we]1629-we have been forgotten .

Yet [man]2819-man dies not whilst [the world]248-the world , at once [[his]2819-man mother]3467-his mother and [[his]2819-man monument]1637-his monument , remains . [His]2819-man name is lost , indeed , but the breath [he]2819-man breathed still stirs the pine - tops on [the mountains]2771-the mountains , the sound of the words [he]2819-man spoke yet echoes on through space ; the thoughts [his]2819-man brain gave birth to [we]1629-we have inherited to - day ; [his]2819-man passions are [our]1629-we cause of life ; the joys and sorrows that [he]2819-man knew are [[our]1629-we familiar friends]1639-our familiar friends - the end from which [he]2819-man fled aghast will surely overtake [us]1629-we also !

Truly [the universe]1640-the universe is full of ghosts , not sheeted churchyard spectres , but the inextinguishable elements of individual life , which having once been , can never die , though [they]1641-they blend and change , and change again for ever .

All sorts of reflections of this nature passed through [my]0-i mind - for as [I]0-i grow older [I]0-i regret to say that a detestable habit of thinking seems to be getting a hold of [me]0-i - while [I]0-i stood and stared at those grim yet fantastic lines of [warriors]3181-warriors , sleeping , as [their]3181-warriors saying goes , " upon [their]3181-warriors spears . "[3181-warriors]

" [Curtis]97-sir henry , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [I]0-i am in a condition of pitiable fear . "[0-i]

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry stroked [his]97-sir henry yellow beard and laughed , as [he]97-sir henry answered -

" [I]97-sir henry have heard [you]97-sir henry make that sort of remark before , [Quatermain]107-quatermain . "[97-sir henry]

" Well , [I]3181-warriors mean it now . Do [you]97-sir henry know , [I]3181-warriors very much doubt if one of [us]3880-we will be alive to - morrow night . [We]3880-we shall be attacked in overwhelming force , and it is quite a chance if [we]3880-we can hold [this place]2838-this place . "[3181-warriors]

" [We]3880-we 'll give a good account of some of [them]3181-warriors , at any rate . Look here , [Quatermain]107-quatermain , this business is nasty , and one with which , properly speaking , [we]3880-we ought not to be mixed up , but [we]3880-we are in for it , so [we]3880-we must make the best of [our]3880-we job . Speaking personally , [I]97-sir henry had rather be killed fighting than any other way , and now that there seems little chance of [our]3880-we finding [[my]97-sir henry poor brother]3882-my poor brother , it makes the idea easier to [me]97-sir henry . But fortune favours the brave , and [we]3880-we may succeed . Anyway , the battle will be awful , and having a reputation to keep up , [we]3880-we shall need to be in the thick of the thing . "[97-sir henry]

[He]1643-his made this last remark in a mournful voice , but there was a gleam in [his]1643-his eye which belied its melancholy . [I]0-i have an idea [Sir Henry Curtis]97-sir henry actually likes fighting .

After this [we]1644-we went to sleep for a couple of hours or so .

Just about dawn [we]1644-we were awakened by [Infadoos]162-infadoos , who came to say that great activity was to be observed in [Loo]3-loo , and that [parties of [[the king]2791-the king 's skirmishers]1647-the king 's skirmishers]1645-parties of the king 's skirmishers were driving in [[our]1644-we outposts]1648-our outposts .

[We]1644-we rose and dressed [ourselves]1644-we for the fray , each putting on [his]1643-his chain armour shirt , for which garments at the present juncture [we]1644-we felt exceedingly thankful . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry went the whole length about the matter , and dressed [himself]97-sir henry like [a native warrior]1649-a native warrior . " When [you]3883-you are in [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland , do as [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas do , "[1643-his] [he]1643-his remarked , as [he]1643-his drew the shining steel over [his]1643-his broad breast , which it fitted like a glove . Nor did [he]1643-his stop there . At [his]1643-his request [Infadoos]162-infadoos had provided [him]1643-his with a complete set of native war uniform . Round [his]1643-his throat [he]1643-his fastened the leopard - skin cloak of [a commanding officer]1650-a commanding officer , on [his]1643-his brows [he]1643-his bound the plume of black ostrich feathers worn only by [generals of high rank]1651-generals of high rank , and about [his]1643-his middle a magnificent moocha of white ox - tails . A pair of sandals , a leglet of goat 's hair , a heavy battle - axe with a rhinoceros - horn handle , a round iron shield covered with white ox - hide , and the regulation number of tollas , or throwing - knives , made up [his]1643-his equipment , to which , however , [he]1643-his added [his]1643-his revolver . The dress was , no doubt , a savage one , but [I]0-i am bound to say that [I]0-i seldom saw a finer sight than [Sir Henry Curtis]97-sir henry presented in this guise . It showed off [his]97-sir henry magnificent physique to the greatest advantage , and when [Ignosi]169-ignosi arrived presently , arrayed in a similar costume , [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i that [I]0-i had never before seen [two such splendid men]1652-two such splendid men .

As for [Good]493-good and [myself]0-i , the armour did not suit [us]1654-we nearly so well . To begin with , [Good]98-good insisted upon keeping on [his]98-good new - found trousers , and [a stout , short gentleman with an eye - glass]1655-a stout , short gentleman with an eye - glass , and one half of [his]98-good face shaved , arrayed in a mail shirt , carefully tucked into a very seedy pair of corduroys , looks more remarkable than imposing . In [my]0-i case , the chain shirt being too big for [me]0-i , [I]0-i put it on over all [my]0-i clothes , which caused it to bulge in a somewhat ungainly fashion . [I]0-i discarded [my]0-i trousers , however , retaining only [my]0-i veldtschoons , having determined to go into battle with bare legs , in order to be the lighter for running , in case it became necessary to retire quickly . The mail coat , a spear , a shield , that [I]0-i did not know how to use , a couple of tollas , a revolver , and a huge plume , which [I]0-i pinned into the top of [my]0-i shooting hat , in order to give a bloodthirsty finish to [my]0-i appearance , completed [my]0-i modest equipment . In addition to all these articles , of course [we]1654-we had [our]1654-we rifles , but as ammunition was scarce , and as they would be useless in case of a charge , [we]1654-we arranged that they should be carried behind [us]1654-we by [bearers]1656-bearers .

When at length [we]1654-we had equipped [ourselves]1654-we , [we]1654-we swallowed some food hastily , and then started out to see how things were going on . At one point in [the table - land of [the mountain]659-the mountain]1657-the table - land of the mountain , there was a little koppie of brown stone , which served the double purpose of head - quarters and of [a conning tower]1659-a conning tower . Here [we]1654-we found [Infadoos]162-infadoos surrounded by [[his]162-infadoos own regiment]1660-his own regiment , [the Greys]189-the greys , which was undoubtedly the finest in [the Kukuana army]1539-the kukuana army , and the same that [we]1654-we had first seen at [the outlying kraal]76-the outlying kraal . [This regiment , now three thousand five hundred strong]1662-this regiment , now three thousand five hundred strong , was being held in reserve , and [the men]975-the men were lying down on the grass in [companies]1296-companies , and watching [[the king]2791-the king 's forces creep out of [Loo]3-loo]1666-the king 's forces creep out of loo in long ant - like columns . There seemed to be no end to the length of these columns - three in all , and each of [them]1667-they numbering , as [we]1654-we judged , at least [eleven or twelve thousand men]1668-eleven or twelve thousand men .

As soon as [they]1667-they were clear of [the town]1164-the town [the regiments]1144-the regiments formed up . Then [one body]1671-one body marched off to the right , one to the left , and [the third]1672-the third came on slowly towards [us]1654-we .

" Ah , "[162-infadoos] said [Infadoos]162-infadoos , " [they]1667-they are going to attack [us]1654-we on three sides at once . "[162-infadoos]

This seemed rather serious news , for [our]1654-we position on [the top of [the mountain]659-the mountain]1673-the top of the mountain , which measured a mile and a half in circumference , being an extended one , it was important to [us]1654-we to concentrate [[our]1654-we comparatively small defending force]1675-our comparatively small defending force as much as possible . But since it was impossible for [us]1654-we to dictate in what way [we]1654-we should be assailed , [we]1654-we had to make the best of it , and accordingly sent orders to [the various regiments]1676-the various regiments to prepare to receive the separate onslaughts .

1 This cruel custom is not confined to [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas , but is by no means uncommon amongst [African tribes]1677-african tribes on the occasion of the outbreak of war or any other important public event . - A.Q.

CHAPTER XIII

THE ATTACK

Slowly , and without the slightest appearance of haste or excitement , the three columns crept on . When within about five hundred yards of [us]1654-we , [the main or centre column]1678-the main or centre column halted at the root of [a tongue of open plain]1679-a tongue of open plain which ran up into [the hill]3022-the hill , to give time to the other divisions to circumvent [our]1654-we position , which was shaped more or less in the form of a horse - shoe , with [its]1681-its two points facing towards [the town of Loo]1515-the town of loo . The object of this manoeuvre was that the threefold assault should be delivered simultaneously .

" Oh , for a gatling ! "[493-good] groaned [Good]493-good , as [he]493-good contemplated the serried phalanxes beneath [us]1654-we . " [I]493-good would clear [that plain]3884-that plain in twenty minutes . "[493-good]

" [We]1654-we have not got one , so it is no use yearning for it ; but suppose [you]0-i try a shot , [Quatermain]107-quatermain , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry . " See how near [you]0-i can go to [that tall fellow who appears to be in command]3885-that tall fellow who appears to be in command . Two to one [you]0-i miss [him]3885-that tall fellow who appears to be in command , and [an even sovereign]3886-an even sovereign , to be honestly paid if ever [we]1654-we get out of this , that [you]0-i do n't drop the bullet within five yards . "[97-sir henry]

This piqued [me]0-i , so , loading [the express]1684-the express with solid ball , [I]0-i waited till [[my]0-i friend]315-my friend walked some ten yards out from [his]315-my friend force , in order to get a better view of [our]1654-we position , accompanied only by [an orderly]1686-an orderly ; then , lying down and resting the express on a rock , [I]0-i covered [him]315-my friend . The rifle , like [all expresses]1687-all expresses , was only sighted to three hundred and fifty yards , so to allow for the drop in trajectory [I]0-i took [him]315-my friend half - way down the neck , which ought , [I]0-i calculated , to find [him]315-my friend in the chest . [He]315-my friend stood quite still and gave [me]0-i every opportunity , but whether it was the excitement or the wind , or the fact of [the man]371-the man being a long shot , [I]0-i do n't know , but this was what happened . Getting dead on , as [I]0-i thought , a fine sight , [I]0-i pressed , and when the puff of smoke had cleared away , to [my]0-i disgust , [I]0-i saw [[my]0-i man]3492-my man standing there unharmed , whilst [[his]315-my friend orderly]1690-his orderly , who was at least three paces to the left , was stretched upon the ground apparently dead . Turning swiftly , [the officer [I]0-i had aimed at]1691-the officer i had aimed at began to run towards [[his]1691-the officer i had aimed at men]1692-his men in evident alarm .

" [Bravo]190-bravo , [Quatermain]107-quatermain ! "[98-good] sang out [Good]98-good ; " [you]0-i 've frightened [him]1694-the general . "[98-good]

This made [me]0-i very angry , for , if possible to avoid it , [I]0-i hate to miss in public . When [a man]2655-a man is master of only one art [he]2655-a man likes to keep up [his]2655-a man reputation in that art . Moved quite out of [myself]0-i at [my]0-i failure , [I]0-i did a rash thing . Rapidly covering [the general]1694-the general as [he]1694-the general ran , [I]0-i let drive with the second barrel . Instantly [the poor man]1695-the poor man threw up [his]1695-the poor man arms , and fell forward on to [his]1695-the poor man face . This time [I]0-i had made no mistake ; and - [I]0-i say it as a proof of how little [we]1696-our think of [others]841-others when [our]1696-our own safety , pride , or reputation is in question - [I]0-i was brute enough to feel delighted at the sight .

[The regiments who had seen the feat]1698-the regiments who had seen the feat cheered wildly at this exhibition of [the white man]243-the white man 's magic , which [they]1698-the regiments who had seen the feat took as an omen of success , while the force [the general]1694-the general had belonged to - which , indeed , as [we]1696-our ascertained afterwards , [he]1694-the general had commanded - fell back in confusion . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [Good]98-good now took up [their]1701-their rifles and began to fire , the latter industriously " browning "[1702-another winchester repeater] the dense mass before [him]1694-the general with [another Winchester repeater]1702-another winchester repeater , and [I]0-i also had another shot or two , with the result , so far as [we]1696-our could judge , that [we]1696-our put [some six or eight men]1703-some six or eight men hors de combat before [they]1703-some six or eight men were out of range .

Just as [we]1696-our stopped firing there came an ominous roar from [our]1696-our far right , then a similar roar rose on [our]1696-our left . [The two other divisions]1704-the two other divisions were engaging [us]1696-our .

At the sound , [the mass of men before [us]1696-our]1705-the mass of men before us opened out a little , and advanced towards [the hill]3022-the hill and up [the spit of bare grass land]1707-the spit of bare grass land at a slow trot , singing a deep - throated song as [they]1705-the mass of men before us ran . [We]1696-our kept up a steady fire from [our]1696-our rifles as [they]1705-the mass of men before us came , [Ignosi]169-ignosi joining in occasionally , and accounted for [several men]1708-several men , but of course [we]1696-our produced no more effect upon that mighty rush of armed humanity than [he]1709-he [who throws pebbles does on the breaking wave]1710-who throws pebbles does on the breaking wave .

On [they]1705-the mass of men before us came , with a shout and the clashing of spears ; now [they]1705-the mass of men before us were driving in the pickets [we]1696-our had placed among the rocks at [the foot of [the hill]3022-the hill]1591-the foot of the hill . After that the advance was a little slower , for though as yet [we]1696-our had offered no serious opposition , [the attacking forces]1713-the attacking forces must climb up hill , and [they]1705-the mass of men before us came slowly to save [their]1705-the mass of men before us breath . [Our]1696-our first line of defence was about half - way down the side of the slope , [our]1696-our second fifty yards further back , while [our]1696-our third occupied [the edge of [the plateau]888-the plateau]887-the edge of the plateau .

On [they]1705-the mass of men before us stormed , shouting [their]1705-the mass of men before us war - cry , " Twala ! Twala ! [Chiele]191-chiele ! [Chiele]191-chiele ! "[1705-the mass of men before us] Twala ! Twala ! Smite ! Smite ! " [Ignosi]169-ignosi ! [Ignosi]169-ignosi ! [Chiele]191-chiele ! [Chiele]191-chiele ! "[1705-the mass of men before us] answered [[our]1696-our people]3106-our people . [They]1705-the mass of men before us were quite close now , and [the tollas]1717-the tollas , or throwing - knives , began to flash backwards and forwards , and now with an awful yell the battle closed in .

To and fro swayed the mass of [struggling warriors]1718-struggling warriors , [men falling fast as leaves in an autumn wind]1719-men falling fast as leaves in an autumn wind ; but before long the superior weight of [the attacking force]1720-the attacking force began to tell , and [our]1696-our first line of defence was slowly pressed back till it merged into the second . Here the struggle was very fierce , but again [[our]1696-our people]3106-our people were driven back and up , till at length , within twenty minutes of the commencement of the fight , [our]1696-our third line came into action .

But by this time [the assailants]1722-the assailants were much exhausted , and besides had lost [many men killed and wounded , and to break through that third impenetrable hedge of spears]1723-many men killed and wounded , and to break through that third impenetrable hedge of spears proved beyond [their]1722-the assailants powers . For a while [the seething lines of savages]1724-the seething lines of savages swung backwards and forwards , in the fierce ebb and flow of battle , and the issue was doubtful . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry watched the desperate struggle with a kindling eye , and then without a word [he]97-sir henry rushed off , followed by [Good]98-good , and flung [himself]97-sir henry into the hottest of the fray . As for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i stopped where [I]0-i was .

[The soldiers]3431-the soldiers caught sight of [his]97-sir henry tall form as [he]97-sir henry plunged into battle , and there rose a cry of -

" Nanzia Incubu ! [Nanzia Unkungunklovo]156-nanzia manzie ! "[3431-the soldiers] Here is [the Elephant]148-elephant ! " [Chiele]191-chiele ! [Chiele]191-chiele ! "[3431-the soldiers]

From that moment the end was no longer in doubt . Inch by inch , fighting with splendid gallantry , [the attacking force]1720-the attacking force was pressed back down [the hillside]1727-the hillside , till at last [it]1720-the attacking force retreated upon its reserves in something like confusion . At that instant , too , [a messenger]1416-a messenger arrived to say that the left attack had been repulsed ; and [I]0-i was just beginning to congratulate [myself]0-i , believing that the affair was over for the present , when , to [our]1729-our horror , [we]1729-our perceived [[our]1729-our men who had been engaged in the right defence being driven towards [us]1729-our across [the plain]725-the plain]1730-our men who had been engaged in the right defence being driven towards us across the plain , followed by swarms of [the enemy]1059-the enemy , who had evidently succeeded at this point .

[Ignosi]169-ignosi , who was standing by [me]0-i , took in the situation at a glance , and issued a rapid order . Instantly [the reserve regiment around [us]1729-our]1733-the reserve regiment around us , [the Greys]189-the greys , extended itself .

Again [Ignosi]169-ignosi gave a word of command , which was taken up and repeated by [the captains]3683-the captains , and in another second , to [my]0-i intense disgust , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i involved in a furious onslaught upon [the advancing foe]1735-the advancing foe . Getting as much as [I]0-i could behind [Ignosi]169-ignosi 's huge frame , [I]0-i made the best of a bad job , and toddled along to be killed as though [I]0-i liked it . In a minute or two - [we]1729-our were plunging through [the flying groups of [[our]1729-our men]1737-our men , who at once began to re - form behind [us]1729-our , and then [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do not know what happened . All [I]0-i can remember is a dreadful rolling noise of the meeting of shields , and the sudden apparition of a huge ruffian , whose eyes seemed literally to be starting out of [his]1738-he head , making straight at [me]0-i with a bloody spear]1736-the flying groups of our men , who at once began to re - form behind us , and then i am sure i do not know what happened . all i can remember is a dreadful rolling noise of the meeting of shields , and the sudden apparition of a huge ruffian , whose eyes seemed literally to be starting out of his head , making straight at me with a bloody spear . But - [I]0-i say it with pride - [I]0-i rose - or rather sank - to the occasion . It was one before which [most people]1739-most people would have collapsed once and for all . Seeing that if [I]0-i stood where [I]0-i was [I]0-i must be killed , as [the horrid apparition]1740-the horrid apparition came [I]0-i flung [myself]0-i down in front of [him]1738-he so cleverly that , being unable to stop [himself]1738-he , [he]1738-he took a header right over [my]0-i prostrate form . Before [he]1738-he could rise again , [I]0-i had risen and settled the matter from behind with [my]0-i revolver .

Shortly after this [somebody]1741-somebody knocked [me]0-i down , and [I]0-i remember no more of that charge .

When [I]0-i came to [I]0-i found [myself]0-i back at [the koppie]1742-the koppie , with [Good]98-good bending over [me]0-i holding some water in a gourd .

" How do [you]0-i feel , [old fellow]3887-old fellow ? "[98-good] [he]98-good asked anxiously .

[I]0-i got up and shook [myself]0-i before replying .

" Pretty well , thank [you]98-good , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Thank [Heaven]158-heaven ! When [I]0-i saw [them]1741-somebody carry [you]98-good in , [I]0-i felt quite sick ; [I]0-i thought [you]98-good were done for . "[0-i]

" Not this time , [[my]1743-i boy]266-my boy . [I]1743-i fancy [I]1743-i only got a rap on the head , which knocked [me]1743-i stupid . How has it ended ? "[1743-i]

" [They]1741-somebody are repulsed at every point for a while . The loss is dreadfully heavy ; [we]3889-we have quite [two thousand killed and wounded]3890-two thousand killed and wounded , and [they]1741-somebody must have lost three . Look , there 's a sight ! "[1743-i] and [he]1743-i pointed to long lines of [men advancing by fours]1744-men advancing by fours .

In the centre of [every group of four]1745-every group of four , and being borne by it , was a kind of hide tray , of which [a Kukuana force]1746-a kukuana force always carries a quantity , with a loop for a handle at each corner . On these trays - and [their]1747-their number seemed endless - lay [wounded men]1748-wounded men , who as [they]1748-wounded men arrived were hastily examined by [the medicine men]1749-the medicine men , of whom ten were attached to [a regiment]1750-a regiment . If the wound was not of a fatal character [the sufferer]1751-the sufferer was taken away and attended to as carefully as circumstances would allow . But if , on the other hand , [the injured man]1752-the injured man 's condition proved hopeless , what followed was very dreadful , though doubtless it may have been the truest mercy . [One of [the doctors]1754-the doctors]1753-one of the doctors , under pretence of carrying out an examination , swiftly opened an artery with a sharp knife , and in a minute or two [the sufferer]1751-the sufferer expired painlessly . There were many cases that day in which this was done . In fact , it was done in the majority of cases when the wound was in the body , for the gash made by the entry of the enormously broad spears used by [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas generally rendered recovery impossible . In most instances [the poor sufferers]1756-the poor sufferers were already unconscious , and in others the fatal " nick "[93-the kukuanas] of the artery was inflicted so swiftly and painlessly that [they]1756-the poor sufferers did not seem to notice it . Still it was a ghastly sight , and one from which [we]1757-we were glad to escape ; indeed , [I]0-i never remember anything of the kind that affected [me]0-i more than seeing [those gallant soldiers thus put out of pain]1758-those gallant soldiers thus put out of pain by [the red - handed medicine men]1759-the red - handed medicine men , except , indeed , on one occasion when , after an attack , [I]0-i saw [a force of [Swazis]192-swazis burying [their]1760-a force of swazis burying their hopelessly wounded alive hopelessly wounded alive]1760-a force of swazis burying their hopelessly wounded alive .

Hurrying from this dreadful scene to [the further side of [the koppie]1742-the koppie]1761-the further side of the koppie , [we]1757-we found [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , who still held a battle - axe in [his]97-sir henry hand , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , and [one or two of [the chiefs in deep consultation]1764-the chiefs in deep consultation]1763-one or two of the chiefs in deep consultation .

" Thank [Heaven]158-heaven , here [you]3891-you are , [Quatermain]107-quatermain ! [I]1764-the chiefs in deep consultation ca n't quite make out what [Ignosi]169-ignosi wants to do . It seems that though [we]1757-we have beaten off the attack , [Twala]165-twala is now receiving [large reinforcements]3892-large reinforcements , and is showing a disposition to invest [us]1757-we , with the view of starving [us]1757-we out . "[1764-the chiefs in deep consultation]

" That 's awkward . "[1764-the chiefs in deep consultation]

" Yes ; especially as [Infadoos]162-infadoos says that the water supply has given out . "[1764-the chiefs in deep consultation]

" [[My]162-infadoos lord]3088-my lord , that is so , "[162-infadoos] said [Infadoos]162-infadoos ; " the spring can not supply the wants of so great a multitude , and it is failing rapidly . Before night [we]1757-we shall all be thirsty . Listen , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn . [Thou]3894-thou art wise , and hast doubtless seen many wars in [the lands]3895-the lands from whence [thou]3894-thou camest - that is if indeed [they]3894-thou make wars in [the Stars]70-the stars . Now tell [us]1757-we , what shall [we]1757-we do ? [Twala]165-twala has brought up [many fresh men]3896-many fresh men to take the place of [those who have fallen]3897-those who have fallen . Yet [Twala]165-twala has learnt [his]165-twala lesson ; [the hawk]3898-the hawk did not think to find the heron ready ; but [our]1757-we beak has pierced [his]165-twala breast ; [he]165-twala fears to strike at [us]1757-we again . [We]1757-we too are wounded , and [he]165-twala will wait for [us]1757-we to die ; [he]165-twala will wind [himself]165-twala round [us]1757-we like a snake round a buck , and fight the fight of ' sit down . ' "[162-infadoos]

" [I]0-i hear [thee]1765-thee , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" So , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , [thou]1765-thee seest [we]1766-we have no water here , and but a little food , and [we]1766-we must choose between these three things - to languish like a starving lion in [his]165-twala den , or to strive to break away towards [the north]1022-the north , or "[1765-thee] - and here [he]1765-thee rose and pointed towards the dense mass of [[our]1766-we foes]1767-our foes - " to launch [ourselves]1766-we straight at [Twala]165-twala 's throat . [Incubu]150-incubu , [the great warrior]3900-the great warrior - for to - day [he]150-incubu fought like a buffalo in a net , and [[Twala]165-twala 's soldiers]3901-twala 's soldiers went down before [his]150-incubu axe like young corn before the hail ; with these eyes [I]1765-thee saw it - [Incubu]150-incubu says ' Charge ' ; but the Elephant is ever prone to charge . Now what says [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , [the wily old fox , who has seen much , and loves to bite [[his]138-macumazahn enemy]3903-his enemy from behind]3902-the wily old fox , who has seen much , and loves to bite his enemy from behind ? The last word is in [Ignosi]169-ignosi [the king]2791-the king , for it is [a king]3408-a king 's right to speak of war ; but let [us]1766-we hear [thy]2791-the king voice , [O [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , who watchest by night , and the voice too of [him]138-macumazahn of the transparent eye]138-macumazahn . "[1765-thee]

" What sayest [thou]2791-the king , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Nay , [[my]1765-thee father]2882-my father , "[1765-thee] answered [[our]1768-our quondam servant , who now , clad as [he]1769-he was in the full panoply of savage war , looked every inch [a warrior king]1770-a warrior king , " do [thou]2791-the king speak , and let [me]1769-he , who am but a child in wisdom beside [thee]2791-the king]3907-our quondam servant , who now , clad as he was in the full panoply of savage war , looked every inch a warrior king , " do thou speak , and let me , who am but a child in wisdom beside thee , hearken to [thy]2791-the king words . "[1769-he]

Thus adjured , after taking hasty counsel with [Good and Sir Henry]1771-good and sir henry , [I]0-i delivered [my]0-i opinion briefly to the effect that , being trapped , [our]1768-our best chance , especially in view of the failure of [our]1768-our water supply , was to initiate an attack upon [[Twala]165-twala 's forces]1772-twala 's forces . Then [I]0-i recommended that the attack should be delivered at once , " before [our]1768-our wounds grew stiff , "[0-i] and also before the sight of [Twala]165-twala 's overpowering force caused the hearts of [[our]1768-our soldiers]1773-our soldiers " to wax small like fat before a fire . "[0-i] Otherwise , [I]0-i pointed out , [some of [the captains]3683-the captains]1774-some of the captains might change [their]1774-some of the captains minds , and , making peace with [Twala]165-twala , desert to [him]165-twala , or even betray [us]1768-our into [his]165-twala hands .

This expression of opinion seemed , on the whole , to be favourably received ; indeed , among [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas [my]0-i utterances met with a respect which has never been accorded to [them]93-the kukuanas before or since . But the real decision as to [our]1768-our plans lay with [Ignosi]169-ignosi , who , since [he]169-ignosi had been recognised as [rightful king]1776-rightful king , could exercise the almost unbounded rights of sovereignty , including , of course , the final decision on matters of generalship , and it was to [him]169-ignosi that all eyes were now turned .

At length , after a pause , during which [he]169-ignosi appeared to be thinking deeply , [he]169-ignosi spoke .

" [Incubu]150-incubu , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , and [Bougwan]144-bougwan , [brave white men]3908-brave white men , and [[my]169-ignosi friends]3487-my friends ; [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [[my]169-ignosi uncle]3102-my uncle , and [chiefs]538-chiefs ; [my]169-ignosi heart is fixed . [I]169-ignosi will strike at [Twala]165-twala this day , and set [my]169-ignosi fortunes on the blow , ay , and [my]169-ignosi life - [my]169-ignosi life and [your]3912-thee lives also . Listen ; thus will [I]169-ignosi strike . [Ye]3912-thee see how [the hill]3022-the hill curves round like the half - moon , and how [the plain]725-the plain runs like a green tongue towards [us]3915-us within the curve ? "[169-ignosi]

" [We]3915-us see , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Good ; it is now mid - day , and [the men]975-the men eat and rest after the toil of battle . When the sun has turned and travelled a little way towards the darkness , let [[thy]3912-thee regiment]3917-thy regiment , [[my]169-ignosi uncle]3102-my uncle , advance with one other down to the green tongue , and it shall be that when [Twala]165-twala sees [it]3917-thy regiment [he]165-twala will hurl [his]165-twala force at it to crush it . But [the spot]600-the spot is narrow , and [the regiments]1144-the regiments can come against [thee]3912-thee one at a time only ; so may [they]1144-the regiments be destroyed one by one , and the eyes of [all [Twala]165-twala 's army]3921-all twala 's army shall be fixed upon a struggle the like of which has not been seen by [living man]3922-living man . And with [thee]3912-thee , [[my]169-ignosi uncle]3102-my uncle , shall go Incubu [[my]169-ignosi friend]315-my friend , that when [Twala]165-twala sees [his]165-twala battle - axe flashing in the first rank of the Greys [his]165-twala heart may grow faint . And [I]169-ignosi will come with [the second regiment , that which follows [thee]3912-thee]3925-the second regiment , that which follows thee , so that if [ye]3912-thee are destroyed , as it might happen , there may yet be [a king left to fight for]3926-a king left to fight for ; and with [me]169-ignosi shall come [Macumazahn the wise]138-macumazahn . "[169-ignosi]

" It is well , [O king]3343-o king , "[162-infadoos] said [Infadoos]162-infadoos , apparently contemplating the certainty of the complete annihilation of [[his]162-infadoos regiment]1777-his regiment with perfect calmness . Truly , [these Kukuanas]1778-these kukuanas are [a wonderful people]1779-a wonderful people . Death has no terrors for [them]1778-these kukuanas when it is incurred in the course of duty .

" And whilst the eyes of [the multitude of [Twala]165-twala 's soldiers]3928-the multitude of twala 's soldiers are thus fixed upon the fight , "[169-ignosi] went on [Ignosi]169-ignosi , " behold , one - third of [the men who are left alive]3929-the men who are left alive to [us]3930-us i.e. about 6,000 shall creep along [the right horn of [the hill]3022-the hill]3931-the right horn of the hill and fall upon the left flank of [[Twala]165-twala 's force]3933-twala 's force , and [one - third]3934-one - third shall creep along the left horn and fall upon [Twala]165-twala 's right flank . And when [I]169-ignosi see that the horns are ready to toss [Twala]165-twala , then will [I]169-ignosi , with [the men who remain to [me]169-ignosi]3935-the men who remain to me , charge [home]2616-home in [Twala]165-twala 's face , and if fortune goes with [us]3930-us the day will be [ours]3930-us , and before Night drives [her]3937-her black oxen from [the mountains]2771-the mountains to [the mountains]2771-the mountains [we]3930-us shall sit in peace at [Loo]3-loo . And now let [us]3930-us eat and make ready ; and , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , do [thou]3940-thou prepare , that the plan be carried out without fail ; and stay , let [[my]169-ignosi white father]3941-my white father [Bougwan]144-bougwan go with the right horn , that [his]3941-my white father shining eye may give courage to [the captains]3683-the captains . "[169-ignosi]

The arrangements for attack thus briefly indicated were set in motion with a rapidity that spoke well for the perfection of the Kukuana military system . Within little more than an hour rations had been served out and devoured , the divisions were formed , the scheme of onslaught was explained to [the leaders]1780-the leaders , and [the whole force , numbering about 18,000 men]1781-the whole force , numbering about 18,000 men , was ready to move , with the exception of [a guard left in charge of [the wounded]1783-the wounded]1782-a guard left in charge of the wounded .

[Presently Good]98-good came up to [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [myself]0-i .

" Good - bye , [[you]3943-you fellows]3640-you fellows , "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry said ; " [I]97-sir henry am off with the right wing according to orders ; and so [I]97-sir henry have come to shake hands , in case [we]1784-we should not meet again , [you]3943-you know , "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry added significantly .

[We]1784-we shook hands in silence , and not without the exhibition of as much emotion as [Anglo - Saxons]1785-anglo - saxons are wo nt to show .

" It is a queer business , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , [his]97-sir henry deep voice shaking a little , " and [I]97-sir henry confess [I]97-sir henry never expect to see to - morrow 's sun . So far as [I]97-sir henry can make out , [the Greys]3945-the greys , with whom [I]97-sir henry am to go , are to fight until [they]3945-the greys are wiped out in order to enable the wings to slip round unawares and outflank [Twala]165-twala . Well , so be it ; at any rate , it will be [a man]2655-a man 's death . Good - bye , [old fellow]3887-old fellow . God bless [you]3887-old fellow ! [I]97-sir henry hope [you]3887-old fellow will pull through and live to collar the diamonds ; but if [you]3887-old fellow do , take [my]97-sir henry advice and do n't have anything more to do with [Pretenders]3948-pretenders ! "[97-sir henry]

In another second [Good]98-good had wrung [us]1784-we both by the hand and gone ; and then [Infadoos]162-infadoos came up and led off [Sir Henry]97-sir henry to [his]97-sir henry place in [the forefront of [the Greys]189-the greys]1786-the forefront of the greys , whilst , with many misgivings , [I]0-i departed with [Ignosi]169-ignosi to [[my]0-i station]1787-my station in [the second attacking regiment]1788-the second attacking regiment .

CHAPTER XIV

THE LAST STAND OF [THE GREYS]189-the greys

In a few more minutes [the regiments destined to carry out the flanking movements]1789-the regiments destined to carry out the flanking movements had tramped off in silence , keeping carefully to the lee of the rising ground in order to conceal [their]1789-the regiments destined to carry out the flanking movements advance from the keen eyes of [[Twala]165-twala 's scouts]1790-twala 's scouts .

Half an hour or more was allowed to elapse between the setting out of the horns or wings of [the army]1791-the army before any stir was made by [the Greys]189-the greys and [[their]189-the greys supporting regiment]1792-their supporting regiment , known as the Buffaloes , which formed its chest , and were destined to bear the brunt of the battle .

[Both of these regiments]1793-both of these regiments were almost perfectly fresh , and of full strength , [the Greys]189-the greys having been in reserve in the morning , and having lost but [a small number of men]1794-a small number of men in sweeping back that part of the attack which had proved successful in breaking the line of defence , on the occasion when [I]0-i charged with [them]1793-both of these regiments and was stunned for [my]0-i pains . As for [the Buffaloes]194-the buffaloes , [they]194-the buffaloes had formed the third line of defence on the left , and since [the attacking force at that point]1795-the attacking force at that point had not succeeded in breaking through the second , [they]194-the buffaloes had scarcely come into action at all .

[Infadoos]162-infadoos , who was [a wary old general]1796-a wary old general , and knew the absolute importance of keeping up the spirits of [[his]162-infadoos men]1692-his men on the eve of such a desperate encounter , employed the pause in addressing [[his]162-infadoos own regiment]1660-his own regiment , [the Greys]189-the greys , in poetical language : explaining to [them]1692-his men the honour that [they]1692-his men were receiving in being put thus in the forefront of the battle , and in having [the great white warrior from the Stars]1799-the great white warrior from the stars to fight with [them]1692-his men in [their]1692-his men ranks ; and promising large rewards of cattle and promotion to [all who survived in the event of]1800-all who survived in the event of [Ignosi]169-ignosi 's arms being successful .

[I]0-i looked down the long lines of waving black plumes and stern faces beneath [them]1692-his men , and sighed to think that within one short hour most , if not all , of [those magnificent veteran warriors]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors , [not a man of whom was under forty years of age]1802-not a man of whom was under forty years of age , would be laid dead or dying in the dust . It could not be otherwise ; [they]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors were being condemned , with that wise recklessness of human life which marks [the great general]1803-the great general , and often saves [his]1803-the great general forces and attains [his]1803-the great general ends , to certain slaughter , in order to give [their]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors cause and [the remainder of [the army]1791-the army]1804-the remainder of the army a chance of success . [They]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors were foredoomed to die , and [they]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors knew the truth . It was to be [their]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors task to engage regiment after regiment of [[Twala]165-twala 's army]1806-twala 's army on [the narrow strip of green beneath]1807-the narrow strip of green beneath [us]1808-us , till [they]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors were exterminated or till the wings found a favourable opportunity for [their]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors onslaught . And yet [they]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors never hesitated , nor could [I]0-i detect a sign of fear upon the face of [a single warrior]1809-a single warrior . There [they]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors were - going to certain death , about to quit the blessed light of day for ever , and yet able to contemplate [their]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors doom without a tremor . Even at that moment [I]0-i could not help contrasting [their]1801-those magnificent veteran warriors state of mind with [my]0-i own , which was far from comfortable , and breathing a sigh of envy and admiration . Never before had [I]0-i seen such an absolute devotion to the idea of duty , and such a complete indifference to its bitter fruits .

" Behold [[your]0-i king]3224-your king ! "[162-infadoos] ended [old Infadoos]162-infadoos , pointing to [Ignosi]169-ignosi ; " go fight and fall for [him]3224-your king , as is the duty of [brave men]512-brave men , and cursed and shameful for ever be the name of [him]3224-your king who shrinks from death for [[his]3224-your king king]3951-his king , or who turns [his]3224-your king back to [the foe]3952-the foe . Behold [[your]0-i king]3224-your king , [chiefs]538-chiefs , [captains]3797-captains , and [soldiers]3798-soldiers ! Now do [your]0-i homage to the sacred Snake , and then follow on , that Incubu and [I]162-infadoos may show [you]0-i a road to [the heart of [Twala]165-twala 's host]3957-the heart of twala 's host . "[162-infadoos]

There was a moment 's pause , then suddenly a murmur arose from the serried phalanxes before [us]1810-we , a sound like the distant whisper of [the sea]451-the sea , caused by the gentle tapping of the handles of six thousand spears against [[their]1812-their holders]1813-their holders ' shields . Slowly it swelled , till its growing volume deepened and widened into a roar of rolling noise , that echoed like thunder against [the mountains]2771-the mountains , and filled the air with heavy waves of sound . Then it decreased , and by faint degrees died away into nothing , and suddenly out crashed the royal salute .

[Ignosi]169-ignosi , [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , might well be [a proud man]1815-a proud man that day , for [no Roman emperor]1816-no roman emperor ever had such a salutation from [gladiators]1817-gladiators " about to die . "[169-ignosi]

[Ignosi]169-ignosi acknowledged this magnificent act of homage by lifting [his]169-ignosi battle - axe , and then [the Greys]3945-the greys filed off in a triple - line formation , each line containing about [one thousand fighting men]1819-one thousand fighting men , exclusive of [officers]1545-officers . When [the last companies]1821-the last companies had advanced some five hundred yards , [Ignosi]169-ignosi put [himself]169-ignosi at the head of the Buffaloes , which regiment was drawn up in a similar three - fold formation , and gave the word to march , and off [we]1810-we went , [I]0-i , needless to say , uttering the most heartfelt prayers that [I]0-i might emerge from that entertainment with a whole skin . Many a queer position have [I]0-i found [myself]0-i in , but never before in one quite so unpleasant as the present , or one in which [my]0-i chance of coming off safe was smaller .

By the time that [we]1810-we reached [the edge of [the plateau]888-the plateau]887-the edge of the plateau [the Greys]189-the greys were already half - way down the slope ending in [the tongue of grass land that ran up into the bend of the mountain]1824-the tongue of grass land that ran up into the bend of the mountain , something as the frog of a horse 's foot runs up into the shoe . The excitement in [[Twala]165-twala 's camp on [the plain beyond]1826-the plain beyond]1825-twala 's camp on the plain beyond was very great , and [regiment after regiment]1827-regiment after regiment was starting forward at a long swinging trot in order to reach [the root of the tongue of land]1828-the root of the tongue of land before [the attacking force]1720-the attacking force could emerge into [the plain of Loo]1830-the plain of loo .

This tongue , which was some four hundred yards in depth , even at [its]1824-the tongue of grass land that ran up into the bend of the mountain root or widest part was not more than six hundred and fifty paces across , while at [its]1824-the tongue of grass land that ran up into the bend of the mountain tip it scarcely measured ninety . The Greys , who , in passing down [the side of [the hill]3022-the hill]1831-the side of the hill and on to [the tip of the tongue]1833-the tip of the tongue , had formed into a column , on reaching [the spot where it broadened out again]1834-the spot where it broadened out again , reassumed [their]189-the greys triple - line formation , and halted dead .

Then [we]1810-we - that is , [the Buffaloes]1835-the buffaloes - moved down the tip of the tongue and took [our]1810-we stand in reserve , about one hundred yards behind the last line of [the Greys]3945-the greys , and on slightly higher ground . Meanwhile [we]1810-we had leisure to observe [[Twala]165-twala 's entire force]1837-twala 's entire force , which evidently had been reinforced since the morning attack , and could not now , notwithstanding [their]189-the greys losses , number less than forty thousand , moving swiftly up towards [us]1810-we . But as [they]189-the greys drew near the root of [the tongue]1838-the tongue [they]189-the greys hesitated , having discovered that only [one regiment]1839-one regiment could advance into [the gorge]1840-the gorge at a time , and that there , some seventy yards from [the mouth of [it]1840-the gorge]1841-the mouth of it , unassailable except in front , on account of the high walls of boulder - strewn ground on each side , stood [the famous regiment of Greys]1842-the famous regiment of greys , the pride and glory of [the Kukuana army]1539-the kukuana army , ready to hold the way against [their]189-the greys power as the three Romans once held the bridge against [thousands]1844-thousands .

[They]189-the greys hesitated , and finally stopped [their]189-the greys advance ; there was no eagerness to cross spears with [these three grim ranks of warriors who stood so firm and ready]1845-these three grim ranks of warriors who stood so firm and ready . Presently , however , [a tall general , wearing the customary head - dress of nodding ostrich plumes]1846-a tall general , wearing the customary head - dress of nodding ostrich plumes , appeared , attended by [a group of [chiefs]538-chiefs and [orderlies]1849-orderlies]1847-a group of chiefs and orderlies , being , [I]0-i thought , [none other than [Twala]165-twala [himself]165-twala]1850-none other than twala himself . [He]165-twala gave an order , and [the first regiment , raising a shout]1851-the first regiment , raising a shout , charged up towards [the Greys , who remained perfectly still and silent till the attacking troops were within forty yards , and a volley of tollas]1852-the greys , who remained perfectly still and silent till the attacking troops were within forty yards , and a volley of tollas , or throwing - knives , came rattling among [their]189-the greys ranks .

Then suddenly with a bound and a roar , [they]189-the greys sprang forward with uplifted spears , and [the regiment]1853-the regiment met in deadly strife . Next second the roll of the meeting shields came to [our]1854-we ears like the sound of thunder , and [the plain]725-the plain seemed to be alive with flashes of light reflected from the shimmering spears . To and fro swung [the surging mass of struggling , stabbing humanity]1856-the surging mass of struggling , stabbing humanity , but not for long . Suddenly the attacking lines began to grow thinner , and then with a slow , long heave [the Greys]189-the greys passed over [them]1845-these three grim ranks of warriors who stood so firm and ready , just as a great wave heaves up its bulk and passes over [a sunken ridge]1857-a sunken ridge . It was done ; [that regiment]1858-that regiment was completely destroyed , but [the Greys]189-the greys had but two lines left now ; [a third of [their]189-the greys number]1859-a third of their number were dead .

Closing up shoulder to shoulder , once more [they]189-the greys halted in silence and awaited attack ; and [I]0-i was rejoiced to catch sight of [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's yellow beard as [he]97-sir henry moved to and fro arranging the ranks . So [he]97-sir henry was yet alive !

Meanwhile [we]1854-we moved on to the ground of the encounter , which was cumbered by about [four thousand prostrate human beings]1860-four thousand prostrate human beings , dead , dying , and wounded , and literally stained red with blood . [Ignosi]169-ignosi issued an order , which was rapidly passed down the ranks , to the effect that [none of [the enemy]1059-the enemy 's wounded]1861-none of the enemy 's wounded were to be killed , and so far as [we]1854-we could see this command was scrupulously carried out . It would have been a shocking sight , if [we]1854-we had found time to think of such things .

But now [a second regiment , distinguished by white plumes , kilts , and shields]1863-a second regiment , distinguished by white plumes , kilts , and shields , was moving to the attack of [the two thousand remaining Greys , who stood waiting in the same ominous silence as before]1864-the two thousand remaining greys , who stood waiting in the same ominous silence as before , till [the foe was within forty yards or so]1865-the foe was within forty yards or so , when [they]189-the greys hurled [themselves]189-the greys with irresistible force upon [them]189-the greys . Again there came the awful roll of the meeting shields , and as [we]1854-we watched the tragedy repeated itself .

But this time the issue was left longer in doubt ; indeed , it seemed for awhile almost impossible that [the Greys]189-the greys should again prevail . [The attacking regiment , which was formed of [young men]1867-young men]1866-the attacking regiment , which was formed of young men , fought with the utmost fury , and at first seemed by sheer weight to be driving [the veterans]1868-the veterans back . The slaughter was truly awful , hundreds falling every minute ; and from among the shouts of [the warriors]1329-the warriors and the groans of the dying , set to the music of clashing spears , came a continuous hissing undertone of " S'gee , s'gee , "[1870-each victor] the note of triumph of [each victor]1870-each victor as [he]1870-each victor passed [his]1870-each victor assegai through and through the body of [[his]1870-each victor fallen foe]1871-his fallen foe .

But perfect discipline and steady and unchanging valour can do wonders , and [one veteran soldier]1872-one veteran soldier is worth [two young ones]1873-two young ones , as soon became apparent in the present case . For just when [we]1854-we thought that it was all over with [the Greys]3945-the greys , and were preparing to take [their]3945-the greys place so soon as [they]3945-the greys made room by being destroyed , [I]0-i heard [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's deep voice ringing out through the din , and caught a glimpse of [his]97-sir henry circling battle - axe as [he]97-sir henry waved it high above [his]97-sir henry plumes . Then came a change ; [the Greys]189-the greys ceased to give ; [they]189-the greys stood still as a rock , against which the furious waves of [spearmen]1875-spearmen broke again and again , only to recoil . Presently [they]189-the greys began to move once more - forward this time ; as [they]189-the greys had no firearms there was no smoke , so [we]1854-we could see it all . Another minute and the onslaught grew fainter .

" Ah , these are [men]326-men , indeed ; [they]326-men will conquer again , "[169-ignosi] called out [Ignosi]169-ignosi , who was grinding [his]169-ignosi teeth with excitement at [my]0-i side . " See , it is done ! "[169-ignosi]

Suddenly , like puffs of smoke from the mouth of a cannon , [the attacking regiment]1876-the attacking regiment broke away in flying groups , [their]1876-the attacking regiment white head - dresses streaming behind [them]1876-the attacking regiment in the wind , and left [[their]1876-the attacking regiment opponents victors]1877-their opponents victors , indeed , but , alas ! no more [a regiment]1750-a regiment . Of the gallant triple line , which forty minutes before had gone into action three thousand strong , there remained at most some [six hundred blood - spattered men]1879-six hundred blood - spattered men ; [the rest were under foot]1880-the rest were under foot . And yet [they]189-the greys cheered and waved [their]189-the greys spears in triumph , and then , instead of falling back upon [us]1854-we as [we]1854-we expected , [they]189-the greys ran forward , for a hundred yards or so , after [the flying groups of [foemen]1882-foemen]1881-the flying groups of foemen , took possession of [a rising knoll of ground]1883-a rising knoll of ground , and , resuming [their]189-the greys triple formation , formed a threefold ring around its base . And there , thanks be to [Heaven]158-heaven , standing on the top of the mound for a minute , [I]0-i saw [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , apparently unharmed , and with [him]97-sir henry [[our]1854-we old friend [Infadoos]162-infadoos]1884-our old friend infadoos . Then [Twala]165-twala 's regiments rolled down upon [the doomed band]1885-the doomed band , and once more the battle closed in .

As [those who read this history]1886-those who read this history will probably long ago have gathered , [I]0-i am , to be honest , a bit of [a coward]1887-a coward , and certainly in no way given to fighting , though somehow it has often been [my]0-i lot to get into unpleasant positions , and to be obliged to shed [man]2819-man 's blood . But [I]0-i have always hated it , and kept [my]0-i own blood as undiminished in quantity as possible , sometimes by a judicious use of [my]0-i heels . At this moment , however , for the first time in [my]0-i life , [I]0-i felt [my]0-i bosom burn with martial ardour . Warlike fragments from the " Ingoldsby Legends , "[0-i] together with numbers of sanguinary verses in the Old Testament , sprang up in [my]0-i brain like mushrooms in the dark ; [my]0-i blood , which hitherto had been half - frozen with horror , went beating through [my]0-i veins , and there came upon [me]0-i a savage desire to kill and spare not . [I]0-i glanced round at [the serried ranks of warriors behind [us]1890-us]1889-the serried ranks of warriors behind us , and somehow , all in an instant , [I]0-i began to wonder if [my]0-i face looked like [theirs]1889-the serried ranks of warriors behind us . There [they]1889-the serried ranks of warriors behind us stood , the hands twitching , the lips apart , the fierce features instinct with the hungry lust of battle , and in the eyes a look like the glare of a bloodhound when after long pursuit [he]1891-he sights [[his]1891-he quarry]1892-his quarry .

Only [Ignosi]169-ignosi 's heart , to judge from [his]169-ignosi comparative self - possession , seemed , to all appearances , to beat as calmly as ever beneath [his]169-ignosi leopard - skin cloak , though even [he]169-ignosi still ground [his]169-ignosi teeth . [I]0-i could bear it no longer .

" Are [we]1893-we to stand here till [we]1893-we put out roots , [Umbopa]169-ignosi - [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [I]0-i mean - while [Twala]165-twala swallows [[our]1893-we brothers]3959-our brothers yonder ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked .

" Nay , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , "[169-ignosi] was the answer ; ' see , now is the ripe moment : let [us]1893-we pluck it . "[169-ignosi]

As [he]169-ignosi spoke [a fresh regiment]1894-a fresh regiment rushed past the ring upon [the little mound]1895-the little mound , and wheeling round , attacked [it]1894-a fresh regiment from the hither side .

Then , lifting [his]169-ignosi battle - axe , [Ignosi]169-ignosi gave the signal to advance , and , screaming the wild Kukuana war - cry , [the Buffaloes]194-the buffaloes charged [home]2616-home with a rush like the rush of [the sea]451-the sea .

What followed immediately on this it is out of [my]0-i power to tell . All [I]0-i can remember is an irregular yet ordered advance , that seemed to shake the ground ; a sudden change of front and forming up on the part of [the regiment against which the charge]1898-the regiment against which the charge was directed ; then an awful shock , a dull roar of voices , and a continuous flashing of spears , seen through a red mist of blood .

When [my]0-i mind cleared [I]0-i found [myself]0-i standing inside the remnant of the Greys near [the top of [the mound]1900-the mound]1899-the top of the mound , and just behind no less [a person than [Sir Henry]97-sir henry [himself]97-sir henry]1901-a person than sir henry himself . How [I]0-i got [there]2626-there [I]0-i had at the moment no idea , but [Sir Henry]97-sir henry afterwards told [me]0-i that [I]0-i was borne up by the first furious charge of the Buffaloes almost to [his]97-sir henry feet , and then left , as [they]1903-they in turn were pressed back . Thereon [he]97-sir henry dashed out of the circle and dragged [me]0-i into [shelter]1904-shelter .

As for the fight that followed , who can describe it ? Again and again the multitudes surged against [our]1905-our momentarily lessening circle , and again and again [we]1905-our beat [them]1903-they back .

" [The stubborn spearmen]3960-the stubborn spearmen still made good [The dark impenetrable wood]3961-the dark impenetrable wood , Each stepping where [[his]3960-the stubborn spearmen comrade]3962-his comrade stood The instant that [he]3960-the stubborn spearmen fell , "[1906-someone or other beautifully]

as [someone or other beautifully]1906-someone or other beautifully says .

It was a splendid thing to see [those brave battalions]1907-those brave battalions come on time after time over the barriers of [their]1907-those brave battalions dead , sometimes lifting corpses before [them]1907-those brave battalions to receive [our]1905-our spear - thrusts , only to leave [their]1907-those brave battalions own corpses to swell the rising piles . It was a gallant sight to see [that old warrior]1908-that old warrior , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , as cool as though [he]1908-that old warrior were on parade , shouting out orders , taunts , and even jests , to keep up the spirit of [[his]1908-that old warrior few remaining men]1909-his few remaining men , and then , as each charge rolled on , stepping forward to wherever the fighting was thickest , to bear [his]1908-that old warrior share in its repulse . And yet more gallant was the vision of [Sir Henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust , so that [his]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust long yellow hair streamed out in the breeze behind [him]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust .
