There [he]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust stood , [the great Dane]1911-the great dane , for [he]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust was nothing else , [his]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust hands , [his]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust axe , and [his]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust armour all red with blood , and [none]2774-none could live before [his]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust stroke . Time after time [I]0-i saw it sweeping down , as [some great warrior]1913-some great warrior ventured to give [him]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust battle , and as [he]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust struck [he]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust shouted " O - hoy ! O - hoy ! "[1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust] like [[his]1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust Berserkir forefathers]1914-his berserkir forefathers , and the blow went crashing through shield and spear , through head - dress , hair , and skull , till at last none would of [their]1915-their own will come near the great white " umtagati , "[1910-sir henry , whose ostrich plumes had been shorn off by a spear thrust] the wizard , who killed and failed not .

But suddenly there rose a cry of " [Twala]165-twala , [y]165-twala ' [Twala]165-twala , "[1916-the gigantic one - eyed king himself] and out of the press sprang forward none other than [the gigantic one - eyed king [himself]1916-the gigantic one - eyed king himself]1916-the gigantic one - eyed king himself , also armed with battle - axe and shield , and clad in chain armour .

" Where art [thou]3963-thou , Incubu , [[thou]3963-thou white man , who slewest Scragga [[my]1916-the gigantic one - eyed king himself son]2864-my son - see if [thou]3963-thou canst slay [me]1916-the gigantic one - eyed king himself ! "[1916-the gigantic one - eyed king himself] [he]1916-the gigantic one - eyed king himself shouted , and at the same time hurled a tolla straight at [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , who fortunately saw it coming , and caught it on [his]97-sir henry shield , which it transfixed , remaining wedged in the iron plate behind the hide]3964-thou white man , who slewest scragga my son - see if thou canst slay me ! " he shouted , and at the same time hurled a tolla straight at sir henry , who fortunately saw it coming , and caught it on his shield , which it transfixed , remaining wedged in the iron plate behind the hide .

Then , with a cry , [Twala]165-twala sprang forward straight at [him]97-sir henry , and with [his]165-twala battle - axe struck [him]97-sir henry such a blow upon the shield that the mere force and shock of it brought [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , [strong man]1917-strong man as [he]97-sir henry is , down upon [his]97-sir henry knees .

But at this time the matter went no further , for that instant there rose from the regiments pressing round [us]1918-us something like a shout of dismay , and on looking up [I]0-i saw the cause .

To the right and to the left [the plain]725-the plain was alive with the plumes of [charging warriors]1920-charging warriors . [The outflanking squadrons]1921-the outflanking squadrons had come to [our]1918-us relief . The time could not have been better chosen . [[All Twala]165-twala 's army]3921-all twala 's army , as [Ignosi]169-ignosi predicted would be the case , had fixed [their]3921-all twala 's army attention on the bloody struggle which was raging round the remnant of [the Greys]189-the greys and that of the Buffaloes , who were now carrying on a battle of [their]3921-all twala 's army own at a little distance , which two regiments had formed the chest of [[our]1918-us army]1923-our army . It was not until [our]1918-us horns were about to close upon [them]3921-all twala 's army that [they]3921-all twala 's army had dreamed of [their]3921-all twala 's army approach , for [they]3921-all twala 's army believed [these forces]1924-these forces to be hidden in reserve upon [the crest of [the moon - shaped hill]1926-the moon - shaped hill]1925-the crest of the moon - shaped hill . And now , before [they]3921-all twala 's army could even assume a proper formation for defence , [the outflanking Impis]1927-the outflanking impis had leapt , like greyhounds , on [their]3921-all twala 's army flanks .

In five minutes the fate of the battle was decided . Taken on both flanks , and dismayed at the awful slaughter inflicted upon [them]3921-all twala 's army by [the Greys]189-the greys and [Buffaloes]194-the buffaloes , [[Twala]165-twala 's regiments]1928-twala 's regiments broke into flight , and soon [the whole plain between [us]1918-us and [Loo]3-loo]1929-the whole plain between us and loo was scattered with [groups of running soldiers]1930-groups of running soldiers making good [their]1930-groups of running soldiers retreat . As for [the hosts that had so recently surrounded [us]1918-us and [the Buffaloes]1835-the buffaloes]1931-the hosts that had so recently surrounded us and the buffaloes , [they]1931-the hosts that had so recently surrounded us and the buffaloes melted away as though by magic , and presently [we]1918-us were left standing there like a rock from which [the sea]451-the sea has retreated . But what a sight it was ! Around [us]1918-us [the dead and dying]1934-the dead and dying lay in heaped - up masses , and of [the gallant Greys]1935-the gallant greys there remained but [ninety - five men]1936-ninety - five men upon [their]1936-ninety - five men feet . More than three thousand four hundred had fallen in this one regiment , most of [them]1936-ninety - five men never to rise again .

" [Men]326-men , "[162-infadoos] said [Infadoos]162-infadoos calmly , as between the intervals of binding a wound on [his]162-infadoos arm [he]162-infadoos surveyed what remained to [him]162-infadoos of [[his]162-infadoos corps]1937-his corps , " [ye]326-men have kept up the reputation of [[your]326-men regiment]3967-your regiment , and this day 's fighting will be well spoken of by [[your]326-men children 's children]3968-your children 's children . "[162-infadoos] Then [he]162-infadoos turned round and shook [Sir Henry Curtis]97-sir henry by the hand . " [Thou]3969-thou art [a great captain]3970-a great captain , [Incubu]3971-incubu , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos said simply ; " [I]162-infadoos have lived a long life among [warriors]3181-warriors , and have known [many a brave one]3973-many a brave one , yet have [I]162-infadoos never seen [a man like unto [thee]3969-thou]3974-a man like unto thee . "[162-infadoos]

At this moment [the Buffaloes]1835-the buffaloes began to march past [our]1939-we position on [the road]2952-the road to [Loo]3-loo , and as [they]1835-the buffaloes went a message was brought to [us]1939-we from [Ignosi]169-ignosi requesting [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , and [myself]0-i to join [them]1835-the buffaloes . Accordingly , orders having been issued to [the remaining ninety men of [the Greys]189-the greys]1941-the remaining ninety men of the greys to employ [themselves]1941-the remaining ninety men of the greys in collecting [the wounded]1783-the wounded , [we]1939-we joined [Ignosi]169-ignosi , who informed [us]1939-we that [he]169-ignosi was pressing on to [Loo]3-loo to complete the victory by capturing [Twala]165-twala , if that should be possible . Before [we]1939-we had gone far , suddenly [we]1939-we discovered the figure of [Good]98-good sitting on [an ant - heap]1943-an ant - heap about one hundred paces from [us]1939-we . Close beside [him]98-good was the body of [a Kukuana]195-a kukuana .

" [He]98-good must be wounded , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry anxiously . As [he]97-sir henry made the remark , an untoward thing happened . The dead body of [the Kukuana soldier]1944-the kukuana soldier , or rather what had appeared to be [his]98-good dead body , suddenly sprang up , knocked [Good]98-good head over heels off the ant - heap , and began to spear [him]98-good . [We]1939-we rushed forward in terror , and as [we]1939-we drew near [we]1939-we saw [the brawny warrior]1945-the brawny warrior making dig after dig at the prostrate Good , who at each prod jerked all [his]98-good limbs into the air . Seeing [us]1939-we coming , [the Kukuana]195-a kukuana gave one final and most vicious dig , and with a shout of " Take that , [wizard]3975-wizard ! "[195-a kukuana] bolted away . [Good]98-good did not move , and [we]1939-we concluded that [[our]1939-we poor comrade]1946-our poor comrade was done for . Sadly [we]1939-we came towards [him]98-good , and were astonished to find [him]98-good pale and faint indeed , but with a serene smile upon [his]98-good face , and [his]98-good eyeglass still fixed in [his]98-good eye .

" Capital armour this , "[98-good] [he]98-good murmured , on catching sight of [our]1939-we faces bending over [him]98-good . " How sold [that beggar]3076-that beggar must have been , "[98-good] and then [he]98-good fainted . On examination [we]1939-we discovered that [he]98-good had been seriously wounded in the leg by a tolla in the course of the pursuit , but that the chain armour had prevented [[his]98-good last assailant]1947-his last assailant 's spear from doing anything more than bruise [him]98-good badly . It was a merciful escape . As nothing could be done for [him]98-good at the moment , [he]98-good was placed on one of the wicker shields used for [the wounded]1783-the wounded , and carried along with [us]1939-we .

On arriving before [the nearest gate of [Loo]3-loo]1949-the nearest gate of loo [we]1939-we found [one of [[our]1939-we regiments]1951-our regiments]1950-one of our regiments watching [it]1949-the nearest gate of loo in obedience to orders received from [Ignosi]169-ignosi . The other regiments were in the same way guarding [the different exits to [the town]1164-the town]1952-the different exits to the town . [The officer in command of this regiment]1954-the officer in command of this regiment saluted [Ignosi]169-ignosi as [king]554-king , and informed [him]169-ignosi that [[Twala]165-twala 's army]1806-twala 's army had taken refuge in [the town]1164-the town , whither [Twala]165-twala [himself]165-twala had also escaped , but [he]169-ignosi thought that [they]1806-twala 's army were thoroughly demoralised , and would surrender . Thereupon [Ignosi]169-ignosi , after taking counsel with [us]1939-we , sent forward heralds to each gate ordering [the defenders]1958-the defenders to open , and promising on [his]169-ignosi royal word life and forgiveness to [every soldier who laid down [his]169-ignosi arms]1959-every soldier who laid down his arms , but saying that if [they]1806-twala 's army did not do so before nightfall [he]169-ignosi would certainly burn [the town]1164-the town and all within [its]1164-the town gates . This message was not without its effect . Half an hour later , amid the shouts and cheers of [the Buffaloes]1835-the buffaloes , [the bridge]1962-the bridge was dropped across the fosse , and the gates upon the further side were flung open .

Taking due precautions against treachery , [we]1939-we marched on into [the town]1164-the town . All along [the roadways]1964-the roadways stood [thousands of [dejected warriors]1966-dejected warriors , [their]1965-thousands of dejected warriors , their heads drooping , and their shields and spears at their feet , who , headed by their officers , saluted ignosi as king as he passed heads drooping , and [their]1965-thousands of dejected warriors , their heads drooping , and their shields and spears at their feet , who , headed by their officers , saluted ignosi as king as he passed shields and spears at [their]1965-thousands of dejected warriors , their heads drooping , and their shields and spears at their feet , who , headed by their officers , saluted ignosi as king as he passed feet , who , headed by [[their]1965-thousands of dejected warriors , their heads drooping , and their shields and spears at their feet , who , headed by their officers , saluted ignosi as king as he passed officers]1967-their officers , saluted [Ignosi]169-ignosi as [king]554-king as [he]169-ignosi passed]1965-thousands of dejected warriors , their heads drooping , and their shields and spears at their feet , who , headed by their officers , saluted ignosi as king as he passed . On [we]1939-we marched , straight to [[Twala]165-twala 's kraal]1969-twala 's kraal . When [we]1939-we reached [the great space]1263-the great space , where a day or two previously [we]1939-we had seen the review and the witch hunt , [we]1939-we found [it]1263-the great space deserted . No , not quite deserted , for there , on the further side , in front of [[his]165-twala hut]3234-his hut , sat [Twala]165-twala [himself]165-twala , with [but one attendant - Gagool]1972-but one attendant - gagool .

It was a melancholy sight to see [him]165-twala seated , [his]165-twala battle - axe and shield by [his]165-twala side , [his]165-twala chin upon [his]165-twala mailed breast , with but one old crone for [companion]1973-companion , and notwithstanding [his]165-twala crimes and misdeeds , a pang of compassion shot through [me]0-i as [I]0-i looked upon [Twala]165-twala thus " fallen from [[his]165-twala high estate]3977-his high estate . "[165-twala] [Not a soldier of [all [his]165-twala armies]1975-all his armies]1974-not a soldier of all his armies , not [a courtier out of the hundreds who had cringed round [him]165-twala]1976-a courtier out of the hundreds who had cringed round him , not even [a solitary wife]1977-a solitary wife , remained to share [his]165-twala fate or halve the bitterness of [his]165-twala fall . [Poor savage]1978-poor savage ! [he]165-twala was learning the lesson which Fate teaches to [most of [us]1980-we who live long enough , that the eyes of [mankind]1981-mankind]1979-most of us who live long enough , that the eyes of mankind are blind to the discredited , and that [he]165-twala who is defenceless and fallen finds [few friends]1982-few friends and little mercy . Nor , indeed , in this case did [he]165-twala deserve any .

Filing through the kraal gate , [we]1980-we marched across [the open space]1191-the open space to where [the ex - king]1984-the ex - king sat . When within about fifty yards of [him]165-twala the regiment was halted , and accompanied only by [a small guard]1985-a small guard [we]1980-we advanced towards [him]165-twala , [Gagool]122-gagool reviling [us]1980-we bitterly as [we]1980-we came . As [we]1980-we drew near , [Twala]165-twala , for the first time , lifted [his]165-twala plumed head , and fixed [his]165-twala one eye , which seemed to flash with suppressed fury almost as brightly as the great diamond bound round [his]165-twala forehead , upon [[his]165-twala successful rival]1986-his successful rival - [Ignosi]169-ignosi .

" Hail , [O king]3343-o king ! "[165-twala] [he]165-twala said , with bitter mockery ; " [thou]3979-thou who hast eaten of [my]165-twala bread , and now by the aid of [the white man]243-the white man 's magic hast seduced [[my]165-twala regiments]3981-my regiments and defeated [[mine]165-twala army]3982-mine army , hail ! What fate hast [thou]3979-thou in store for [me]165-twala , [O king]3343-o king ? "[165-twala]

" The fate [thou]3979-thou gavest to [[my]165-twala father]2882-my father , whose throne [thou]3979-thou hast sat on these many years ! "[165-twala] was the stern answer .

" It is good . [I]165-twala will show [thee]3979-thou how to die , that [thou]3979-thou mayest remember it against thine own time . See , the sun sinks in blood , "[165-twala] and [he]165-twala pointed with [his]165-twala battle - axe towards the setting orb ; " it is well that [my]165-twala sun should go down in its company . And now , [O king]3343-o king ! [I]165-twala am ready to die , but [I]165-twala crave the boon of [the Kukuana royal House]3986-the kukuana royal house 1 to die fighting . [Thou]3979-thou canst not refuse it , or even [those cowards who fled to - day]3987-those cowards who fled to - day will hold [thee]3979-thou shamed . "[165-twala]

" It is granted . Choose - with whom wilt [thou]3979-thou fight ? [Myself]165-twala [I]165-twala can not fight with [thee]3979-thou , for [the king]2791-the king fights not except in war . "[165-twala]

[Twala]165-twala 's sombre eye ran up and down [our]1987-we ranks , and [I]0-i felt , as for a moment it rested on [myself]0-i , that the position had developed a new horror . What if [he]165-twala chose to begin by fighting [me]0-i ? What chance should [I]0-i have against [a desperate savage six feet five high]1988-a desperate savage six feet five high , and broad in proportion ? [I]0-i might as well commit suicide at once . Hastily [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind to decline the combat , even if [I]0-i were hooted out of [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland as a consequence . It is , [I]0-i think , better to be hooted than to be quartered with a battle - axe .

[Presently Twala]165-twala spoke .

" Incubu , what sayest [thou]3979-thou , shall [we]1987-we end what [we]1987-we began to - day , or shall [I]165-twala call [thee]3979-thou coward , white - even to the liver ? "[165-twala]

" Nay , "[169-ignosi] interposed [Ignosi]169-ignosi hastily ; " [thou]3979-thou shalt not fight with [Incubu]150-incubu . "[169-ignosi]

" Not if [he]150-incubu is afraid , "[165-twala] said [Twala]165-twala .

[Unfortunately Sir Henry]97-sir henry understood this remark , and the blood flamed up into [his]97-sir henry cheeks .

" [I]97-sir henry will fight [him]150-incubu , "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry said ; " [he]150-incubu shall see if [I]97-sir henry am afraid . "[97-sir henry]

" For [Heaven]158-heaven 's sake , "[0-i] [I]0-i entreated , " do n't risk [your]97-sir henry life against that of [a desperate man]3989-a desperate man . [Anybody who saw [you]97-sir henry to - day]3990-anybody who saw you to - day will know that [you]97-sir henry are brave enough . "[0-i]

" [I]97-sir henry will fight [him]150-incubu , "[97-sir henry] was the sullen answer . " [No living man]3991-no living man shall call [me]97-sir henry [a coward]1887-a coward . [I]97-sir henry am ready now ! "[97-sir henry] and [he]97-sir henry stepped forward and lifted [his]97-sir henry axe .

[I]0-i wrung [my]0-i hands over this absurd piece of Quixotism ; but if [he]97-sir henry was determined on this deed , of course [I]0-i could not stop [him]97-sir henry .

" Fight not , [[my]169-ignosi white brother]3993-my white brother , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi , laying [his]169-ignosi hand affectionately on [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's arm ; " [thou]3994-thou hast fought enough , and if aught befell [thee]3994-thou at [his]150-incubu hands it would cut [my]169-ignosi heart in twain . "[169-ignosi]

" [I]97-sir henry will fight , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , "[97-sir henry] was [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's answer .

" It is well , [Incubu]150-incubu ; [thou]3994-thou art [a brave man]2900-a brave man . It will be a good fray . Behold , [Twala]165-twala , [the Elephant]3996-the elephant is ready for [thee]3994-thou . "[169-ignosi]

[The ex - king]1984-the ex - king laughed savagely , and stepping forward faced [Curtis]97-sir henry . For a moment [they]1990-they stood thus , and the light of the sinking sun caught [their]1990-they stalwart frames and clothed [them]1990-they both in fire . [They]1990-they were [a well - matched pair]1991-a well - matched pair .

Then [they]1990-they began to circle round [each other]373-each other , [their]1990-they battle - axes raised .

Suddenly [Sir Henry]97-sir henry sprang forward and struck a fearful blow at [Twala]165-twala , who stepped to one side . So heavy was the stroke that [the striker]1993-the striker half overbalanced [himself]1993-the striker , a circumstance of which [[his]97-sir henry antagonist]1994-his antagonist took a prompt advantage . Circling [his]97-sir henry massive battle - axe round [his]97-sir henry head , [he]97-sir henry brought it down with tremendous force . [My]0-i heart jumped into [my]0-i mouth ; [I]0-i thought that the affair was already finished . But no ; with a quick upward movement of the left arm [Sir Henry]97-sir henry interposed [his]97-sir henry shield between [himself]97-sir henry and the axe , with the result that its outer edge was shorn away , the axe falling on [his]97-sir henry left shoulder , but not heavily enough to do any serious damage . In another moment [Sir Henry]97-sir henry got in a second blow , which was also received by [Twala]165-twala upon [his]97-sir henry shield .

Then followed blow upon blow , that were , in turn , either received upon the shields or avoided . The excitement grew intense ; the regiment which was watching the encounter forgot [its]1995-its discipline , and , drawing near , shouted and groaned at every stroke . Just at this time , too , [Good]98-good , who had been laid upon the ground by [me]0-i , recovered from [his]98-good faint , and , sitting up , perceived what was going on . In an instant [he]98-good was up , and catching hold of [my]0-i arm , hopped about from place to place on one leg , dragging [me]0-i after [him]98-good , and yelling encouragements to [Sir Henry]97-sir henry -

" Go it , [old fellow]3887-old fellow ! "[98-good] [he]98-good hallooed . " That was a good one ! Give it [him]165-twala amidships , "[98-good] and so on .

Presently [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , having caught a fresh stroke upon [his]97-sir henry shield , hit out with all [his]97-sir henry force . The blow cut through [Twala]165-twala 's shield and through the tough chain armour behind it , gashing [him]165-twala in the shoulder . With a yell of pain and fury [Twala]165-twala returned the blow with interest , and , such was [his]165-twala strength , shore right through the rhinoceros ' horn handle of [his]165-twala antagonists battle - axe , strengthened as it was with bands of steel , wounding [Curtis]97-sir henry in the face .

A cry of dismay rose from [the Buffaloes]194-the buffaloes as [[our]1996-our hero]1997-our hero 's broad axe - head fell to the ground ; and [Twala]165-twala , again raising [his]165-twala weapon , flew at [him]98-good with a shout . [I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes . When [I]0-i opened them again it was to see [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's shield lying on the ground , and [Sir Henry]97-sir henry [himself]97-sir henry with [his]97-sir henry great arms twined round [Twala]165-twala 's middle . To and fro [they]1998-they swung , hugging [each other]373-each other like bears , straining with all [their]1998-they mighty muscles for dear life , and dearer honour . With a supreme effort [Twala]165-twala swung [the Englishman]2000-the englishman clean off [his]2000-the englishman feet , and down [they]1998-they came together , rolling over and over on [the lime paving]2001-the lime paving , [Twala]165-twala striking out at [Curtis]97-sir henry ' head with the battle - axe , and [Sir Henry]97-sir henry trying to drive the tolla [he]97-sir henry had drawn from [his]97-sir henry belt through [Twala]165-twala 's armour .

It was a mighty struggle , and an awful thing to see .

" Get [his]2000-the englishman axe ! "[98-good] yelled [Good]98-good ; and perhaps [[our]2002-our champion]2003-our champion heard [him]98-good .

At any rate , dropping the tolla , [he]98-good snatched at the axe , which was fastened to [Twala]165-twala 's wrist by a strip of buffalo hide , and still rolling over and over , [they]1998-they fought for it like wild cats , drawing [their]1998-they breath in heavy gasps . Suddenly the hide string burst , and then , with a great effort , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry freed [himself]97-sir henry , the weapon remaining in [his]97-sir henry hand . Another second and [he]97-sir henry was upon [his]97-sir henry feet , the red blood streaming from the wound in [his]97-sir henry face , and so was [Twala]165-twala . Drawing the heavy tolla from [his]97-sir henry belt , [he]97-sir henry reeled straight at [Curtis]97-sir henry and struck [him]97-sir henry in the breast . The stab came home true and strong , but whoever it was who made that chain armour , [he]97-sir henry understood [his]97-sir henry art , for it withstood the steel . Again [Twala]165-twala struck out with a savage yell , and again the sharp knife rebounded , and [Sir Henry]97-sir henry went staggering back . Once more [Twala]165-twala came on , and as [he]165-twala came [[our]2004-our great [Englishman]196-englishman]2005-our great englishman gathered [himself]165-twala together , and swinging the big axe round [his]165-twala head with both hands , hit at [him]165-twala with all [his]165-twala force .

There was a shriek of excitement from a thousand throats , and , behold ! [Twala]165-twala 's head seemed to spring from [his]165-twala shoulders : then it fell and came rolling and bounding along the ground towards [Ignosi]169-ignosi , stopping just at [his]169-ignosi feet . For a second the corpse stood upright ; then with a dull crash it came to [the earth]632-the earth , and the gold torque from its neck rolled away across [the pavement]2007-the pavement . As it did so [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , overpowered by faintness and loss of blood , fell heavily across the body of [the dead king]2008-the dead king .

In a second [he]97-sir henry was lifted up , and eager hands were pouring water on [his]97-sir henry face . Another minute , and the grey eyes opened wide .

[He]97-sir henry was not dead .

Then [I]0-i , just as the sun sank , stepping to where [Twala]165-twala 's head lay in the dust , unloosed the diamond from the dead brows , and handed it to [Ignosi]169-ignosi .

" Take it , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " [lawful king of [the Kukuanas - king]3999-the kukuanas - king]3998-lawful king of the kukuanas - king by birth and victory . "[0-i]

[Ignosi]169-ignosi bound the diadem upon [his]169-ignosi brows . Then advancing , [he]169-ignosi placed [his]169-ignosi foot upon the broad chest of [[his]169-ignosi headless foe]2009-his headless foe and broke out into a chant , or rather a pæan of triumph , so beautiful , and yet so utterly savage , that [I]0-i despair of being able to give an adequate version of [his]169-ignosi words . Once [I]0-i heard [a scholar with a fine voice]2010-a scholar with a fine voice read aloud from [the Greek poet [Homer]197-homer]2011-the greek poet homer , and [I]0-i remember that the sound of the rolling lines seemed to make [my]0-i blood stand still . [Ignosi]169-ignosi 's chant , uttered as it was in a language as beautiful and sonorous as the old Greek , produced exactly the same effect on [me]0-i , although [I]0-i was exhausted with toil and many emotions .

" Now , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi began , " now [our]4000-our rebellion is swallowed up in victory , and [our]4000-our evil - doing is justified by strength .[169-ignosi]

" In the morning [the oppressors]4001-the oppressors arose and stretched [themselves]4001-the oppressors ; [they]4001-the oppressors bound on [their]4001-the oppressors harness and made [them]4001-the oppressors ready to war .[169-ignosi]

" [They]4001-the oppressors rose up and tossed [their]4001-the oppressors spears : [the soldiers]3431-the soldiers called to [the captains]3683-the captains , ' Come , lead [us]4000-our ' - and [the captains]3683-the captains cried to [the king]2791-the king , ' Direct thou the battle . '[169-ignosi]

" [They]4001-the oppressors laughed in [their]4001-the oppressors pride , [twenty thousand men]1537-twenty thousand men , and yet [a twenty thousand]4007-a twenty thousand .[169-ignosi]

" [Their]4001-the oppressors plumes covered [the valleys]4008-the valleys as the plumes of a bird cover [her]4009-her nest ; [they]4001-the oppressors shook [their]4001-the oppressors shields and shouted , yea , [they]4001-the oppressors shook [their]4001-the oppressors shields in the sunlight ; [they]4001-the oppressors lusted for battle and were glad .[169-ignosi]

" [They]4001-the oppressors came up against [me]169-ignosi ; [[their]4001-the oppressors strong ones]4010-their strong ones ran swiftly to slay [me]169-ignosi ; [they]4001-the oppressors cried , ' Ha ! ha ! [he]2791-the king is as one already dead . '[169-ignosi]

" Then breathed [I]169-ignosi on [them]4001-the oppressors , and [my]169-ignosi breath was as the breath of a wind , and lo ! [they]4001-the oppressors were not .[169-ignosi]

" [My]169-ignosi lightnings pierced [them]4001-the oppressors ; [I]169-ignosi licked up [their]4001-the oppressors strength with the lightning of [my]169-ignosi spears ; [I]169-ignosi shook [them]4001-the oppressors to the ground with the thunder of [my]169-ignosi shoutings .[169-ignosi]

" [They]4001-the oppressors broke - [they]4001-the oppressors scattered - [they]4001-the oppressors were gone as the mists of the morning .[169-ignosi]

" [They]4001-the oppressors are food for the kites and the foxes , and the place of battle is fat with [their]4001-the oppressors blood .[169-ignosi]

" Where are [the mighty ones who rose up in the morning]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning ?[169-ignosi]

" Where are the proud ones who tossed [their]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning spears and cried , ' [He]2791-the king is as [a man already dead]4012-a man already dead ' ?[169-ignosi]

" [They]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning bow [their]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning heads , but not in sleep ; [they]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning are stretched out , but not in sleep .[169-ignosi]

" [They]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning are forgotten ; [they]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning have gone into the blackness ; [they]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning dwell in the dead moons ; yea , [others]841-others shall lead away [[their]841-others wives]1630-their wives , and [[their]841-others children]1632-their children shall remember [them]4011-the mighty ones who rose up in the morning no more .[169-ignosi]

" And [I]169-ignosi - ! [the king]2791-the king - like an eagle [I]169-ignosi have found [[my]169-ignosi eyrie]4017-my eyrie .[169-ignosi]

" Behold ! far have [I]169-ignosi flown in the night season , yet have [I]169-ignosi returned to [[my]169-ignosi young]4018-my young at the daybreak .[169-ignosi]

" Shelter [ye]4018-my young under the shadow of [my]169-ignosi wings , [O people]3322-o people , and [I]169-ignosi will comfort [you]4018-my young , and [ye]4018-my young shall not be dismayed .[169-ignosi]

" Now is the good time , the time of spoil .[169-ignosi]

" [Mine]169-ignosi are the cattle on [the mountains]2771-the mountains , mine are the virgins in [the kraals]4021-the kraals .[169-ignosi]

" The winter is overpast with storms , the summer is come with flowers .[169-ignosi]

" Now [Evil]198-evil shall cover up [her]198-evil face , now [Mercy]199-mercy and Gladness shall dwell in [the land]3165-the land .[169-ignosi]

" Rejoice , rejoice , [[my]169-ignosi people]3730-my people ![169-ignosi]

" Let all the stars rejoice in that this tyranny is trodden down , in that [I]169-ignosi am [the king]2791-the king . "[169-ignosi]

[Ignosi]169-ignosi ceased [his]169-ignosi song , and out of the gathering gloom came back the deep reply -

" [Thou]169-ignosi art [the king]2791-the king ! "[169-ignosi]

Thus was [my]0-i prophecy to [the herald]1614-the herald fulfilled , and within the forty - eight hours [Twala]165-twala 's headless corpse was stiffening at [Twala]165-twala 's gate .

1 It is a law amongst [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas that [no man of the direct royal blood]2013-no man of the direct royal blood can be put to death , unless by [his]2013-no man of the direct royal blood own consent , which is , however , never refused . [He]2013-no man of the direct royal blood is allowed to choose a succession of [antagonists]2014-antagonists , to be approved by [the king]2791-the king , with whom [he]2013-no man of the direct royal blood fights , till one of [them]2014-antagonists kills [him]2013-no man of the direct royal blood . - A.Q.

CHAPTER XV

GOOD FALLS SICK

After the fight was ended , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [Good]98-good were carried into [[Twala]165-twala 's hut]2016-twala 's hut , where [I]0-i joined [them]2017-them . [They]2017-them were both utterly exhausted by exertion and loss of blood , and , indeed , [my]0-i own condition was little better . [I]0-i am very wiry , and can stand more fatigue than [most men]2018-most men , probably on account of [my]0-i light weight and long training ; but that night [I]0-i was quite done up , and , as is always the case with [me]0-i when exhausted , that old wound which the lion gave [me]0-i began to pain . Also [my]0-i head was aching violently from the blow [I]0-i had received in the morning , when [I]0-i was knocked senseless . Altogether , a more miserable trio than [we]2019-we were that evening it would have been difficult to discover ; and [our]2019-we only comfort lay in the reflection that [we]2019-we were exceedingly fortunate to be there to feel miserable , instead of being stretched dead upon [the plain]725-the plain , as [so many thousands of brave men were that night , who had risen well and strong in the morning]2021-so many thousands of brave men were that night , who had risen well and strong in the morning .

Somehow , with the assistance of the beautiful Foulata , who , since [we]2019-we had been the means of saving [her]2022-her life , had constituted [herself]2022-her [[our]2019-we handmaiden]2023-our handmaiden , and especially [Good]98-good 's , [we]2019-we managed to get off the chain shirts , which had certainly saved the lives of two of [us]2019-we that day . As [I]0-i expected , [we]2019-we found that the flesh underneath was terribly contused , for though the steel links had kept the weapons from entering , they had not prevented them from bruising . Both [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [Good]98-good were [a mass of contusions]2024-a mass of contusions , and [I]0-i was by no means free . As a remedy [Foulata]99-foulata brought [us]2019-we some pounded green leaves , with an aromatic odour , which , when applied as a plaster , gave [us]2019-we considerable relief .

But though the bruises were painful , [they]2025-they did not give [us]2019-we such anxiety as [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's and [Good]98-good 's wounds . [Good]98-good had a hole right through the fleshy part of [his]98-good " beautiful white leg , "[98-good] from which [he]98-good had lost a great deal of blood ; and [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , with other hurts , had a deep cut over the jaw , inflicted by [Twala]165-twala 's battle - axe . [Luckily Good]98-good is [a very decent surgeon]2026-a very decent surgeon , and so soon as [his]98-good small box of medicines was forthcoming , having thoroughly cleansed the wounds , [he]98-good managed to stitch up first [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's and then [his]98-good own pretty satisfactorily , considering the imperfect light given by the primitive Kukuana lamp in [the hut]1095-the hut . Afterwards [he]98-good plentifully smeared the injured places with some antiseptic ointment , of which there was a pot in the little box , and [we]2019-we covered them with the remains of a pocket - handkerchief which [we]2019-we possessed .

Meanwhile [Foulata]99-foulata had prepared [us]2019-we some strong broth , for [we]2019-we were too weary to eat . This [we]2019-we swallowed , and then threw [ourselves]2019-we down on the piles of magnificent karrosses , or fur rugs , which were scattered about [[the dead king]2008-the dead king 's great hut]2029-the dead king 's great hut . By a very strange instance of the irony of fate , it was on [Twala]165-twala 's own couch , and wrapped in [Twala]165-twala 's own particular karross , that [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , [the man who had slain [him]97-sir henry]2030-the man who had slain him , slept that night .

[I]0-i say slept ; but after that day 's work , sleep was indeed difficult . To begin with , in very truth the air was full

" Of farewells to [the dying And mournings for the dead]4026-the dying and mournings for the dead . "[2031-women whose husbands]

From every direction came the sound of the wailing of [women whose [husbands]2032-husbands]2031-women whose husbands , [sons]2033-sons , and [brothers]2034-brothers had perished in the battle . No wonder that [they]2031-women whose husbands wailed , for [over twelve thousand men , or nearly a fifth of [the Kukuana army]1539-the kukuana army]2035-over twelve thousand men , or nearly a fifth of the kukuana army , had been destroyed in that awful struggle . It was heart - rending to lie and listen to [their]2031-women whose husbands cries for [those who never would return]2037-those who never would return ; and it made [me]0-i understand the full horror of the work done that day to further [man]2819-man 's ambition . Towards midnight , however , the ceaseless crying of [the women]1414-the women grew less frequent , till at length the silence was only broken at intervals of a few minutes by a long piercing howl that came from [a hut in [our]2041-our immediate rear]2040-a hut in our immediate rear , which , as [I]0-i afterwards discovered , proceeded from [Gagool]122-gagool " keening "[122-gagool] over [the dead king Twala]2042-the dead king twala .

After that [I]0-i got a little fitful sleep , only to wake from time to time with a start , thinking that [I]0-i was once more [an actor in the terrible events of the last twenty - four hours]2043-an actor in the terrible events of the last twenty - four hours . Now [I]0-i seemed to see [that warrior whom [my]0-i hand had sent to [his]2044-that warrior whom my hand had sent to his last account charging at me on the mountain - top last account charging at [me]0-i on [the mountain - top]2045-the mountain - top]2044-that warrior whom my hand had sent to his last account charging at me on the mountain - top ; now [I]0-i was once more in that glorious ring of Greys , which made its immortal stand against all [Twala]165-twala 's regiments upon the little mound ; and now again [I]0-i saw [Twala]165-twala 's plumed and gory head roll past [my]0-i feet with gnashing teeth and glaring eye .

At last , somehow or other , the night passed away ; but when dawn broke [I]0-i found that [[my]0-i companions]2046-my companions had slept no better than [myself]0-i . [Good]493-good , indeed , was in a high fever , and very soon afterwards began to grow light - headed , and also , to [my]0-i alarm , to spit blood , the result , no doubt , of some internal injury , inflicted during the desperate efforts made by [the Kukuana warrior on the previous day]2048-the kukuana warrior on the previous day to force [his]2048-the kukuana warrior on the previous day big spear through the chain armour . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , however , seemed pretty fresh , notwithstanding [his]97-sir henry wound on the face , which made eating difficult and laughter an impossibility , though [he]97-sir henry was so sore and stiff that [he]97-sir henry could scarcely stir .

About eight o'clock [we]2049-us had a visit from [Infadoos]162-infadoos , who appeared but little the worse - tough old warrior that [he]162-infadoos was - for [his]162-infadoos exertions in the battle , although [he]162-infadoos informed [us]2049-us that [he]162-infadoos had been up all night . [He]162-infadoos was delighted to see [us]2049-us , but much grieved at [Good]98-good 's condition , and shook [our]2049-us hands cordially . [I]0-i noticed , however , that [he]162-infadoos addressed [Sir Henry]97-sir henry with a kind of reverence , as though [he]162-infadoos were something more than [man]2819-man ; and , indeed , as [we]2049-us afterwards found out , [the great Englishman]2051-the great englishman was looked on throughout [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland as [a supernatural being]2052-a supernatural being . [No man]3209-no man , [the soldiers]3431-the soldiers said , could have fought as [he]162-infadoos fought or , at the end of a day of such toil and bloodshed , could have slain [Twala]165-twala , who , in addition to being [the king]2791-the king , was supposed to be [the strongest warrior in [the country]300-the country]2056-the strongest warrior in the country , in single combat , shearing through [his]165-twala bull - neck at a stroke . Indeed , that stroke became proverbial in [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland , and any extraordinary blow or feat of strength was henceforth known as " Incubu 's blow . "[162-infadoos]

[Infadoos]162-infadoos told [us]2049-us also that [all [Twala]165-twala 's regiments]2058-all twala 's regiments had submitted to [Ignosi]169-ignosi , and that like submissions were beginning to arrive from [chiefs in [the outlying country]2060-the outlying country]2059-chiefs in the outlying country . [Twala]165-twala 's death at the hands of [Sir Henry]97-sir henry had put an end to all further chance of disturbance ; for [Scragga]164-scragga had been [[his]97-sir henry only legitimate son]2061-his only legitimate son , so there was [no rival claimant to the throne left alive]2062-no rival claimant to the throne left alive .

[I]0-i remarked that [Ignosi]169-ignosi had swum to power through blood . [The old chief]1401-the old chief shrugged [his]1401-the old chief shoulders . " Yes , "[1401-the old chief] [he]1401-the old chief answered ; " but [the Kukuana people]3110-the kukuana people can only be kept cool by letting [their]3110-the kukuana people blood flow sometimes . [Many]3418-many are killed , indeed , but [the women]1414-the women are left , and [others]841-others must soon grow up to take the places of [the fallen]4031-the fallen . After this [the land]3165-the land would be quiet for a while . "[1401-the old chief]

Afterwards , in the course of the morning , [we]2064-we had a short visit from [Ignosi]169-ignosi , on whose brows the royal diadem was now bound . As [I]0-i contemplated [him]169-ignosi advancing with kingly dignity , [an obsequious guard following [his]169-ignosi steps]2065-an obsequious guard following his steps , [I]0-i could not help recalling to [my]0-i mind [the tall Zulu who had presented [himself]169-ignosi to [us]2064-we at [Durban]10-durban some few months back , asking to be taken into [our]2064-we service , and reflecting on the strange revolutions of the wheel of fortune]2066-the tall zulu who had presented himself to us at durban some few months back , asking to be taken into our service , and reflecting on the strange revolutions of the wheel of fortune .

" Hail , [O king]3343-o king ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , rising .

" Yes , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn . [King]554-king at last , by the might of [your]138-macumazahn three right hands , "[169-ignosi] was the ready answer .

All was , [he]169-ignosi said , going well ; and [he]169-ignosi hoped to arrange a great feast in two weeks ' time in order to show [himself]169-ignosi to [the people]3142-the people .

[I]0-i asked [him]169-ignosi what [he]169-ignosi had settled to do with [Gagool]122-gagool .

" [She]122-gagool is [the evil genius of [the land]3165-the land]4035-the evil genius of the land , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi answered , " and [I]169-ignosi shall kill [her]122-gagool , and [all the witch doctors with [her]122-gagool]4037-all the witch doctors with her ! [She]122-gagool has lived so long that [none]2774-none can remember when [she]122-gagool was not very old , and [she]122-gagool it is who has always trained [the witch - hunters]4039-the witch - hunters , and made [the land]3165-the land wicked in the sight of [the heavens above]4041-the heavens above . "[169-ignosi]

" Yet [she]122-gagool knows much , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied ; " it is easier to destroy knowledge , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , than to gather it . "[0-i]

" That is so , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi said thoughtfully . " [She]122-gagool , and [she]122-gagool only , knows the secret of the ' Three Witches , ' yonder , whither [the great road]3117-the great road runs , where [the kings]4043-the kings are buried , and [the Silent Ones]4044-the silent ones sit . "[169-ignosi]

" Yes , and the diamonds are . Forget not [thy]169-ignosi promise , [Ignosi]169-ignosi ; [thou]169-ignosi must lead [us]4045-us to [the mines]4046-the mines , even if [thou]169-ignosi hast to spare [Gagool]122-gagool alive to show the way . "[0-i]

" [I]169-ignosi will not forget , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , and [I]169-ignosi will think on what [thou]169-ignosi sayest . "[169-ignosi]

After [Ignosi]169-ignosi 's visit [I]0-i went to see [Good]98-good , and found [him]98-good quite delirious . The fever set up by [his]98-good wound seemed to have taken a firm hold of [his]98-good system , and to be complicated with an internal injury . For four or five days [his]98-good condition was most critical ; indeed , [I]0-i believe firmly that had it not been for [Foulata]99-foulata 's indefatigable nursing [he]98-good must have died .

[Women]3373-women are [women]3373-women , all [the world]248-the world over , whatever [their]3373-women colour . Yet somehow it seemed curious to watch [this dusky beauty]2071-this dusky beauty bending night and day over [the fevered man]2072-the fevered man 's couch , and performing all the merciful errands of [a sick - room]2073-a sick - room swiftly , gently , and with as fine an instinct as that of [a trained hospital nurse]2074-a trained hospital nurse . For the first night or two [I]0-i tried to help [her]99-foulata , and so did [Sir Henry]97-sir henry as soon as [his]98-good stiffness allowed [him]98-good to move , but [Foulata]99-foulata bore [our]2075-our interference with impatience , and finally insisted upon [our]2075-our leaving [him]98-good to [her]99-foulata , saying that [our]2075-our movements made [him]98-good restless , which [I]0-i think was true . Day and night [she]99-foulata watched [him]98-good and tended [him]98-good , giving [him]98-good [his]98-good only medicine , a native cooling drink made of milk , in which was infused juice from the bulb of a species of tulip , and keeping the flies from settling on [him]98-good . [I]0-i can see the whole picture now as it appeared night after night by the light of [our]2075-our primitive lamp ; [Good]98-good tossing to and fro , [his]98-good features emaciated , [his]98-good eyes shining large and luminous , and jabbering nonsense by [the yard]2076-the yard ; and seated on the ground by [his]98-good side , [her]99-foulata back resting against the wall of [the hut]1095-the hut , [the soft - eyed , shapely Kukuana beauty]2078-the soft - eyed , shapely kukuana beauty , [her]99-foulata face , weary as it was with [her]99-foulata long vigil , animated by a look of infinite compassion - or was it something more than compassion ?

For two days [we]2075-our thought that [he]98-good must die , and crept about with heavy hearts .

Only [Foulata]99-foulata would not believe it .

" [He]98-good will live , "[99-foulata] [she]99-foulata said .

For three hundred yards or more around [[Twala]165-twala 's chief hut]2079-twala 's chief hut , where [the sufferer]1751-the sufferer lay , there was silence ; for by [the king]2791-the king 's order [all who lived in [the habitations behind]2083-the habitations behind [it]2079-twala 's chief hut , except [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [myself]0-i]2082-all who lived in the habitations behind it , except sir henry and myself , had been removed , lest any noise should come to [the sick man]2084-the sick man 's ears . One night , it was the fifth of [Good]98-good 's illness , as was [my]0-i habit , [I]0-i went across to see how [he]98-good was doing before turning in for a few hours .

[I]0-i entered [the hut]1095-the hut carefully . The lamp placed upon the floor showed the figure of [Good]98-good tossing no more , but lying quite still .

So it had come at last ! In the bitterness of [my]0-i heart [I]0-i gave something like a sob .

" Hush - h - h ! "[98-good] came from the patch of dark shadow behind [Good]98-good 's head .

Then , creeping closer , [I]0-i saw that [he]98-good was not dead , but sleeping soundly , with [Foulata]99-foulata 's taper fingers clasped tightly in [his]98-good poor white hand . The crisis had passed , and [he]98-good would live . [He]98-good slept like that for eighteen hours ; and [I]0-i scarcely like to say it , for fear [I]0-i should not be believed , but during the entire period did [this devoted girl]2086-this devoted girl sit by [him]98-good , fearing that if [she]2086-this devoted girl moved and drew away [her]2086-this devoted girl hand it would wake [him]98-good . What [she]99-foulata must have suffered from cramp and weariness , to say nothing of want of food , [nobody]782-nobody will ever know ; but it is the fact that , when at last [he]98-good woke , [she]99-foulata had to be carried away - [her]99-foulata limbs were so stiff that [she]99-foulata could not move them .

After the turn had once been taken , [Good]98-good 's recovery was rapid and complete . It was not till [he]98-good was nearly well that [Sir Henry]97-sir henry told [him]98-good of all [he]98-good owed to [Foulata]99-foulata ; and when [he]98-good came to the story of how [she]99-foulata sat by [his]98-good side for eighteen hours , fearing lest by moving [she]99-foulata should wake [him]98-good , [the honest sailor]2088-the honest sailor 's eyes filled with tears . [He]98-good turned and went straight to [the hut where [Foulata]99-foulata]2089-the hut where foulata was preparing the mid - day meal , for [we]2090-we were back in [[our]2090-we old quarters]2091-our old quarters now , taking [me]0-i with [him]98-good to interpret in case [he]98-good could not make [his]98-good meaning clear to [her]99-foulata , though [I]0-i am bound to say that [she]99-foulata understood [him]98-good marvellously as a rule , considering how extremely limited was [his]98-good foreign vocabulary .

" Tell [her]99-foulata , "[98-good] said [Good]98-good , " that [I]98-good owe [her]99-foulata [my]98-good life , and that [I]98-good will never forget [her]99-foulata kindness to [my]98-good dying day . "[98-good]

[I]0-i interpreted , and under [her]99-foulata dark skin [she]99-foulata actually seemed to blush .

Turning to [him]98-good with one of those swift and graceful motions that in [her]99-foulata always reminded [me]0-i of the flight of a wild bird , [Foulata]99-foulata answered softly , glancing at [him]98-good with [her]99-foulata large brown eyes -

" Nay , [[my]99-foulata lord]3088-my lord ; [[my]99-foulata lord]3088-my lord forgets ! Did [he]98-good not save [my]99-foulata life , and am [I]99-foulata not [[my]99-foulata lord 's handmaiden]4049-my lord 's handmaiden ? "[99-foulata]

It will be observed that [the young lady]2092-the young lady appeared entirely to have forgotten the share which [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [myself]0-i had taken in [her]2092-the young lady preservation from [Twala]165-twala 's clutches . But that is the way of [women]3373-women ! [I]0-i remember [[my]0-i dear wife]2094-my dear wife was just the same . Well , [I]0-i retired from that little interview sad at heart . [I]0-i did not like [Miss Foulata]99-foulata 's soft glances , for [I]0-i knew the fatal amorous propensities of [sailors]2095-sailors in general , and of [Good]98-good in particular .

There are two things in [the world]248-the world , as [I]0-i have found out , which can not be prevented : [you]2097-you can not keep [a Zulu]468-a zulu from fighting , or [a sailor]712-a sailor from falling in love upon the slightest provocation !

It was a few days after this last occurrence that [Ignosi]169-ignosi held [his]169-ignosi great " indaba , "[2101-the " indunas , " or head men , of kukuanaland] or council , and was formally recognised as [king]554-king by [the " indunas , "[2101-the " indunas , " or head men , of kukuanaland] or head men , of [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland]2101-the " indunas , " or head men , of kukuanaland . The spectacle was a most imposing one , including as it did a grand review of [troops]1132-troops . On this day [the remaining fragments of [the Greys]3945-the greys]2103-the remaining fragments of the greys were formally paraded , and in the face of [the army]1791-the army thanked for [their]1791-the army splendid conduct in the battle . To [each man]1055-each man [the king]2791-the king made a large present of cattle , promoting [them]1055-each man one and all to the rank of officers in [the new corps of Greys]2108-the new corps of greys which was in process of formation . An order was also promulgated throughout [the length and breadth of [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland]2109-the length and breadth of kukuanaland that , whilst [we]2110-we honoured [the country]300-the country by [our]2110-we presence , [we]2110-we three were to be greeted with the royal salute , and to be treated with the same ceremony and respect that was by custom accorded to [the king]2791-the king . Also the power of life and death was publicly conferred upon [us]2110-we . [Ignosi]169-ignosi , too , in the presence of [[his]169-ignosi people]676-his people , reaffirmed the promises which [he]169-ignosi had made , to the effect that [no man]3209-no man 's blood should be shed without trial , and that witch - hunting should cease in [the land]3165-the land .

When the ceremony was over [we]2110-we waited upon [Ignosi]169-ignosi , and informed [him]169-ignosi that [we]2110-we were now anxious to investigate the mystery of the mines to which [[Solomon]90-solomon 's Road]1404-solomon 's road ran , asking [him]169-ignosi if [he]169-ignosi had discovered anything about [them]2117-them .

" [[My]169-ignosi friends]3487-my friends , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi answered , " [I]169-ignosi have discovered this . It is there that [the three great figures]4051-the three great figures sit , who here are called [the ' Silent Ones]4052-the ' silent ones , ' and to whom [Twala]165-twala would have offered [the girl Foulata]1561-the girl foulata as a sacrifice . It is there , too , in [a great cave deep in [the mountain]659-the mountain]4054-a great cave deep in the mountain , that [the kings of [the land]3165-the land]4056-the kings of the land are buried ; there [ye]3487-my friends shall find [Twala]165-twala 's body , sitting with [those who went before [him]165-twala]4058-those who went before him . There , also , is a deep pit , which , at some time , [long - dead men]4059-long - dead men dug out , mayhap for the stones [ye]3487-my friends speak of , such as [I]169-ignosi have heard men in [Natal]12-natal tell of at [Kimberley]77-kimberley . [There]2626-there , too , in [the Place of Death]4061-the place of death is [a secret chamber]4062-a secret chamber , known to none but [the king]2791-the king and [Gagool]122-gagool . But [Twala]165-twala , who knew it , is dead , and [I]169-ignosi know it not , nor know [I]169-ignosi what is in it . Yet there is a legend in [the land]3165-the land that once , many generations gone , [a white man]662-a white man crossed [the mountains]2771-the mountains , and was led by [a woman]272-a woman to [the secret chamber]4068-the secret chamber and shown the wealth hidden in it . But before [he]662-a white man could take it [she]272-a woman betrayed [him]662-a white man , and [he]662-a white man was driven by [the king of that day]4069-the king of that day back to [the mountains]2771-the mountains , and since then [no man]3209-no man has entered [the place]3034-the place . "[169-ignosi]

" The story is surely true , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , for on [the mountains]2771-the mountains [we]4074-we found [the white man]243-the white man , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Yes , [we]4074-we found [him]243-the white man . And now [I]169-ignosi have promised [you]169-ignosi that if [ye]169-ignosi can come to [that chamber]4076-that chamber , and the stones are there - "[169-ignosi]

" The gem upon [thy]169-ignosi forehead proves that they are there , "[0-i] [I]0-i put in , pointing to the great diamond [I]0-i had taken from [Twala]165-twala 's dead brows .

" Mayhap ; if they are there , "[165-twala] [he]165-twala said , " [ye]169-ignosi shall have as many as [ye]169-ignosi can take hence - if indeed [ye]169-ignosi would leave [me]165-twala , [[my]165-twala brothers]3621-my brothers . "[165-twala]

" First [we]4074-we must find [the chamber]4078-the chamber , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i

" There is but one who can show it to [thee]169-ignosi - [Gagool]122-gagool . "[165-twala]

" And if [she]122-gagool will not ? "[165-twala]

" Then [she]122-gagool must die , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi sternly . " [I]169-ignosi have saved [her]122-gagool alive but for this . Stay , [she]122-gagool shall choose , "[169-ignosi] and calling to [a messenger]1416-a messenger [he]169-ignosi ordered [Gagool]122-gagool to be brought before [him]169-ignosi .

In a few minutes [she]122-gagool came , hurried along by [two guards]2119-two guards , whom [she]122-gagool was cursing as [she]122-gagool walked .

" Leave [her]122-gagool , "[2791-the king] said [the king]2791-the king to [the guards]1445-the guards .

So soon as [their]1445-the guards support was withdrawn , the withered old bundle - for [she]122-gagool looked more like a bundle than anything else , out of which [her]122-gagool two bright and wicked eyes gleamed like those of a snake - sank in a heap on to the floor .

" What will [ye]169-ignosi with [me]122-gagool , [Ignosi]169-ignosi ? "[122-gagool] [she]122-gagool piped . " [Ye]169-ignosi dare not touch [me]122-gagool . If [ye]169-ignosi touch [me]122-gagool [I]122-gagool will slay [you]169-ignosi as [ye]169-ignosi sit . Beware of [my]122-gagool magic . "[122-gagool]

" [Thy]4079-thy magic could not save [Twala]165-twala , old [she]122-gagool - wolf , and it can not hurt [me]122-gagool , "[122-gagool] was the answer . " Listen ; [I]122-gagool will this of [thee]122-gagool , that [thou]122-gagool reveal to [us]4080-us the chamber where are the shining stones . "[122-gagool]

" Ha ! ha ! "[122-gagool] [she]122-gagool piped , " none know its secret but [I]122-gagool , and [I]122-gagool will never tell [thee]169-ignosi . [The white devils]4081-the white devils shall go hence empty - handed . "[122-gagool]

" [Thou]122-gagool shalt tell [me]122-gagool . [I]122-gagool will make [thee]122-gagool tell [me]122-gagool . "[122-gagool]

" How , [O king]3343-o king ? [Thou]4079-thy art great , but can [thy]4079-thy power wring the truth from [a woman]272-a woman ? "[122-gagool]

" It is difficult , yet will [I]122-gagool do so . "[122-gagool]

" How , [O king]3343-o king ? "[122-gagool]

" Nay , thus ; if [thou]122-gagool tellest not [thou]122-gagool shalt slowly die . "[122-gagool]

" Die ! "[122-gagool] [she]122-gagool shrieked in terror and fury ; " [ye]169-ignosi dare not touch [me]122-gagool - [man]2819-man , [ye]169-ignosi know not who [I]122-gagool am . How old think [ye]169-ignosi am [I]122-gagool ? [I]122-gagool knew [[your]169-ignosi fathers]3384-your fathers , and [[[your]169-ignosi fathers]3384-your fathers ' fathers ' fathers]4088-your fathers ' fathers ' fathers . When [the country]300-the country was young [I]122-gagool was here ; when [the country]300-the country grows old [I]122-gagool shall still be [here]2924-here . [I]122-gagool can not die unless [I]122-gagool be killed by chance , for none dare slay [me]122-gagool . "[122-gagool]

" Yet will [I]122-gagool slay [thee]122-gagool . See , [Gagool]122-gagool , mother of evil , [thou]122-gagool art so old that [thou]122-gagool canst no longer love [thy]122-gagool life . What can life be to [such a hag as thou , who hast no shape , nor form , nor hair , nor teeth - hast naught , save wickedness and evil eyes]4092-such a hag as thou , who hast no shape , nor form , nor hair , nor teeth - hast naught , save wickedness and evil eyes ? It will be mercy to make an end of [thee]122-gagool , [Gagool]122-gagool . "[122-gagool]

" [[Thou]122-gagool fool]4093-thou fool , "[2122-the old fiend] shrieked [the old fiend]2122-the old fiend , " [[thou]122-gagool accursed fool]4094-thou accursed fool , deemest [thou]122-gagool that life is sweet only to [the young]4095-the young ? It is not so , and naught [thou]122-gagool knowest of the heart of [man]2819-man to think it . To [the young]4095-the young , indeed , death is sometimes welcome , for [the young]4095-the young can feel . [They]4095-the young love and suffer , and it wrings [them]4095-the young to see [their]4095-the young beloved pass to [the land of shadows]4099-the land of shadows . But [the old]4100-the old feel not , [they]4100-the old love not , and , ha ! ha ! [they]4100-the old laugh to see another go out into the dark ; ha ! ha ! [they]4100-the old laugh to see the evil that is done under the stars . All [they]4100-the old love is life , the warm , warm sun , and the sweet , sweet air . [They]4100-the old are afraid of the cold , afraid of the cold and the dark , ha ! ha ! ha ! "[2122-the old fiend] and [the old hag]1373-the old hag writhed in ghastly merriment on the ground .

" Cease thine evil talk and answer [me]169-ignosi , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi angrily . " Wilt [thou]122-gagool show the place where the stones are , or wilt [thou]122-gagool not ? If [thou]122-gagool wilt not [thou]122-gagool diest , even now , "[169-ignosi] and [he]169-ignosi seized a spear and held it over [her]1373-the old hag .

" [I]169-ignosi will not show it ; [thou]122-gagool darest not kill [me]169-ignosi , darest not ! [He]4101-he who slays [me]169-ignosi will be accursed for ever . "[169-ignosi]

Slowly [Ignosi]169-ignosi brought down the spear till it pricked the prostrate heap of rags .

With a wild yell [Gagool]122-gagool sprang to [her]122-gagool feet , then fell again and rolled upon the floor .

" Nay , [I]122-gagool will show [thee]1373-the old hag . Only let [me]122-gagool live , let [me]122-gagool sit in the sun and have a bit of meat to suck , and [I]122-gagool will show [thee]1373-the old hag . "[122-gagool]

" It is well . [I]122-gagool thought that [I]122-gagool should find a way to reason with [thee]1373-the old hag . To - morrow shalt [thou]122-gagool go with [Infadoos]162-infadoos and [[my]122-gagool white brothers]4102-my white brothers to [the place]3034-the place , and beware how [thou]122-gagool failest , for if [thou]122-gagool showest it not , then [thou]122-gagool shalt slowly die . [I]122-gagool have spoken . "[122-gagool]

" [I]2124-i will not fail , [Ignosi]169-ignosi . [I]2124-i always keep [my]2124-i word - ha ! ha ! ha ! Once before [a woman]272-a woman showed [the chamber]4078-the chamber to [a white man]662-a white man , and behold ! evil befell [him]662-a white man , "[2124-i] and here [her]2124-i wicked eyes glinted . " [Her]272-a woman name was [Gagool]122-gagool also . Perchance [I]2124-i was [that woman]4107-that woman . "[2124-i]

" [Thou]122-gagool liest , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " that was ten generations gone . "[0-i]

" Mayhap , mayhap ; when [one]337-one lives long [one]337-one forgets . Perhaps it was [[my]2124-i mother]3491-my mother 's mother who told [me]2124-i ; surely [her]272-a woman name was [Gagool]122-gagool also . But mark , [ye]4111-ye will find in the place where the bright things are a bag of hide full of stones . [The man]371-the man filled that bag , but [he]371-the man never took it away . Evil befell [him]662-a white man , [I]2124-i say , evil befell [him]662-a white man ! Perhaps it was [[[my]2124-i mother]3491-my mother 's mother who told [me]2124-i]4114-my mother 's mother who told me . It will be a merry journey - [we]2126-we can see the bodies of [those who died in the battle]4115-those who died in the battle as [we]2126-we go . [Their]4115-those who died in the battle eyes will be gone by now , and [their]4115-those who died in the battle ribs will be hollow . Ha ! ha ! ha ! "[2124-i]

CHAPTER XVI

[THE PLACE OF DEATH]4061-the place of death

It was already dark on the third day after the scene described in the previous chapter when [we]2126-we camped in [some huts at the foot of the " Three Witches]4116-some huts at the foot of the " three witches , "[99-foulata] as [the triangle of mountains]2127-the triangle of mountains is called to which [Solomon]90-solomon 's Great Road runs . [[Our]2126-we party]3145-our party consisted of [[our]2126-we three selves]2129-our three selves and [Foulata]99-foulata , who waited on [us]2126-we - especially on Good - Infadoos , [Gagool]122-gagool , who was borne along in a litter , inside which [she]122-gagool could be heard muttering and cursing all day long , and [a party of [guards]3770-guards and [attendants]2132-attendants]2130-a party of guards and attendants . [The mountains]2771-the mountains , or rather [the three peaks of [the mountain]659-the mountain]2134-the three peaks of the mountain , for the mass was evidently the result of a solitary upheaval , were , as [I]0-i have said , in the form of a triangle , of which the base was towards [us]2126-we , one peak being on [our]2126-we right , one on [our]2126-we left , and one straight in front of [us]2126-we . Never shall [I]0-i forget the sight afforded by those three towering peaks in the early sunlight of the following morning . High , high above [us]2126-we , up into the blue air , soared their twisted snow - wreaths . Beneath the snow - line [the peaks]1453-the peaks were purple with heaths , and so were the wild moors that ran up the slopes towards [them]1453-the peaks . Straight before [us]2126-we the white ribbon of [Solomon 's Great Road]68-solomon 's great road stretched away uphill to the foot of the centre peak , about five miles from [us]2126-we , and there stopped . [It]2137-it was [its]2137-it terminus .

[I]0-i had better leave the feelings of intense excitement with which [we]2126-we set out on [our]2126-we march that morning to the imagination of [those who read this history]1886-those who read this history . At last [we]2126-we were drawing near to the wonderful mines that had been the cause of the miserable death of [the old Portuguese Dom]201-the old portuguese dom three centuries ago , of [[my]0-i poor friend]2835-my poor friend , [[his]201-the old portuguese dom ill - starred descendant]2140-his ill - starred descendant , and also , as [we]2126-we feared , of [George Curtis]110-george curtis , [[Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's brother]2141-sir henry 's brother . Were [we]2126-we destined , after all that [we]2126-we had gone through , to fare any better ? Evil befell [them]2142-them , as [that old fiend]1370-that old fiend [Gagool]122-gagool said ; would it also befall [us]2126-we ? Somehow , as [we]2126-we were marching up [that last stretch of [beautiful road]2145-beautiful road]2144-that last stretch of beautiful road , [I]0-i could not help feeling a little superstitious about the matter , and so [I]0-i think did Good and [Sir Henry]97-sir henry .

For an hour and a half or more [we]2126-we tramped on up the heather - fringed way , going so fast in [our]2126-we excitement that [the bearers of [Gagool]122-gagool 's hammock]2146-the bearers of gagool 's hammock could scarcely keep pace with [us]2126-we , and [its]2146-the bearers of gagool 's hammock occupant piped out to [us]2126-we to stop .

" Walk more slowly , [white men]2713-white men , "[122-gagool] [she]122-gagool said , projecting [her]122-gagool hideous shrivelled countenance between the grass curtains , and fixing [her]122-gagool gleaming eyes upon [us]2126-we ; " why will [ye]2713-white men run to meet the evil that shall befall [you]2713-white men , [[ye]2713-white men seekers after treasure]4118-ye seekers after treasure ? "[122-gagool] and [she]122-gagool laughed that horrible laugh which always sent a cold shiver down [my]0-i back , and for a while quite took the enthusiasm out of [us]2126-we .

However , on [we]2126-we went , till [we]2126-we saw before [us]2126-we , and between [ourselves]2126-we and the peak , a vast circular hole with sloping sides , three hundred feet or more in depth , and quite half a mile round .

" Ca n't [you]2149-you guess what this is ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said to [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [Good]493-good , who were staring in astonishment at [the awful pit before [us]2126-we]2148-the awful pit before us .

[They]2149-you shook [their]2149-you heads .

" Then it is clear that [you]2149-you have never seen the diamond diggings at [Kimberley]77-kimberley . [You]2149-you may depend on it that this is [[Solomon]90-solomon 's Diamond Mine]4119-solomon 's diamond mine . Look there , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , pointing to the strata of stiff blue clay which were yet to be seen among the grass and bushes that clothed the sides of the pit , " the formation is the same . [I]0-i 'll be bound that if [we]2126-we went down [there]2626-there [we]2126-we should find ' pipes ' of soapy brecciated rock . Look , too , "[0-i] and [I]0-i pointed to a series of worn flat slabs of stone that were placed on a gentle slope below the level of a watercourse which in some past age had been cut out of the solid rock ; " if those are not tables once used to wash the ' stuff , ' [I]0-i 'm [a Dutchman]4121-a dutchman . "[0-i]

At the edge of this vast hole , which was none other than [the pit marked on [the old Dom]389-the old dom 's map]2150-the pit marked on the old dom 's map , [the Great Road]3117-the great road branched into two and circumvented [it]3117-the great road . In many places , by the way , [this surrounding road]2153-this surrounding road was built entirely out of blocks of stone , apparently with the object of supporting the edges of [the pit]3391-the pit and preventing falls of reef . Along [this path]2155-this path [we]2156-we pressed , driven by curiosity to see what were the three towering objects which [we]2156-we could discern from [the hither side of [the great gulf]2158-the great gulf]2157-the hither side of the great gulf . As [we]2156-we drew near [we]2156-we perceived that [they]2159-them were [Colossi of some sort or another]2160-colossi of some sort or another , and rightly conjectured that before [us]2156-we sat [the three " Silent Ones "[2160-colossi of some sort or another] that are held in such awe]2161-the three " silent ones " that are held in such awe by [the Kukuana people]3110-the kukuana people . But it was not until [we]2156-we were quite close to [them]2159-them that [we]2156-we recognised the full majesty of these " Silent Ones . "[2160-colossi of some sort or another]

There , upon huge pedestals of dark rock , sculptured with rude emblems of the Phallic worship , separated from each other by a distance of forty paces , and looking down [the road]2952-the road which crossed [some sixty miles of plain to [Loo]3-loo]2164-some sixty miles of plain to loo , were three colossal seated forms - two male and [one female]2165-one female - each measuring about thirty feet from the crown of its head to the pedestal .

The female form , which was nude , was of great though severe beauty , but unfortunately the features had been injured by centuries of exposure to the weather . Rising from either side of [her]2165-one female head were the points of a crescent . [The two male Colossi]2166-the two male colossi , on the contrary , were draped , and presented a terrifying cast of features , especially the one to [our]2156-we right , which had the face of [a devil]2167-a devil . That to [our]2156-we left was serene in countenance , but the calm upon it seemed dreadful . It was the calm of that inhuman cruelty , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry remarked , which [the ancients]2168-the ancients attributed to [beings potent for good , who could yet watch the sufferings of humanity , if not without rejoicing , at least without sorrow]2169-beings potent for good , who could yet watch the sufferings of humanity , if not without rejoicing , at least without sorrow . These three statues form a most awe - inspiring trinity , as [they]2159-them sit there in [their]2159-them solitude , and gaze out across [the plain]725-the plain for ever .

Contemplating these " Silent Ones , "[93-the kukuanas] as [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas call [them]2159-them , an intense curiosity again seized [us]2156-we to know whose were the hands which had shaped [them]2159-them , who it was that had dug [the pit]3391-the pit and made [the road]2952-the road . Whilst [I]0-i was gazing and wondering , suddenly it occurred to [me]0-i - being familiar with the Old Testament - that [Solomon]90-solomon went astray after [strange gods]2173-strange gods , the names of three of whom [I]0-i remembered - " [Ashtoreth]202-ashtoreth , [the goddess of [the Zidonians]203-the zidonians]4122-the goddess of the zidonians , [Chemosh]204-chemosh , [the god of [the Moabites]205-the moabites]4123-the god of the moabites , and [Milcom]206-milcom , [the god of [the children of [Ammon]207-ammon]4125-the children of ammon]4124-the god of the children of ammon "[0-i] - and [I]0-i suggested to [[my]0-i companions]2046-my companions that the figures before [us]2175-thou might represent [these false and exploded divinities]2176-these false and exploded divinities .

" [Hum]208-hum , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , who is [a scholar]2177-a scholar , having taken a high degree in classics at college , " there may be something in that ; [Ashtoreth of the Hebrews]202-ashtoreth was [the Astarte of the Phoenicians , who were [the great traders of [Solomon]90-solomon 's time]4127-the great traders of solomon 's time]4126-the astarte of the phoenicians , who were the great traders of solomon 's time . [Astarte]209-astarte , who afterwards became [the Aphrodite of [the Greeks]210-the greeks]4128-the aphrodite of the greeks , was represented with horns like the half - moon , and there on the brow of [the female figure]4129-the female figure are distinct horns . Perhaps these Colossi were designed by [some Phoenician official who managed [the mines]4046-the mines]4130-some phoenician official who managed the mines . Who can say ? "[97-sir henry] 1

Before [we]2175-thou had finished examining these extraordinary relics of remote antiquity , [Infadoos]162-infadoos came up , and having saluted [the " Silent Ones]188-the silent ones "[162-infadoos] by lifting [his]162-infadoos spear , asked [us]2175-thou if [we]2175-thou intended entering the " Place of Death "[162-infadoos] at once , or if [we]2175-thou would wait till after [we]2175-thou had taken food at mid - day . If [we]2175-thou were ready to go at once , [Gagool]122-gagool had announced [her]122-gagool willingness to guide [us]2175-thou . As it was not later than eleven o'clock - driven to it by a burning curiosity - [we]2175-thou announced [our]2175-thou intention of proceeding instantly , and [I]0-i suggested that , in case [we]2175-thou should be detained in [the cave]3037-the cave , [we]2175-thou should take some food with [us]2175-thou . [Accordingly Gagool]122-gagool 's litter was brought up , and [that lady]2179-that lady [herself]2179-that lady assisted out of it . Meanwhile [Foulata]99-foulata , at [my]0-i request , stored some " biltong , "[99-foulata] or dried game - flesh , together with a couple of gourds of water , in a reed basket with a hinged cover . Straight in front of [us]2175-thou , at a distance of some fifty paces from the backs of [the Colossi]95-colossi , rose a sheer wall of rock , eighty feet or more in height , that gradually sloped upwards till it formed the base of the lofty snow - wreathed peak , which soared into the air three thousand feet above [us]2175-thou . As soon as [she]122-gagool was clear of [her]122-gagool hammock , [Gagool]122-gagool cast one evil grin upon [us]2175-thou , and then , leaning on a stick , hobbled off towards the face of this wall . [We]2175-thou followed [her]122-gagool till [we]2175-thou came to a narrow portal solidly arched that looked like the opening of [a gallery of a mine]2180-a gallery of a mine .

Here [Gagool]122-gagool was waiting for [us]2175-thou , still with that evil grin upon [her]122-gagool horrid face .

" Now , [white men from [the Stars]70-the stars]3404-white men from the stars , "[122-gagool] [she]122-gagool piped ; " [great warriors]4133-great warriors , [Incubu]150-incubu , [Bougwan]144-bougwan , and [Macumazahn the wise]138-macumazahn , are [ye]2175-thou ready ? Behold , [I]122-gagool am here to do the bidding of [[my]122-gagool lord]3088-my lord [the king]2791-the king , and to show [you]2175-thou the store of bright stones . Ha ! ha ! ha ! "[122-gagool]

" [We]2175-thou are ready , "[0-i] [I]0-i said .

" Good , good ! Make strong [your]2175-thou hearts to bear what [ye]2175-thou shall see . Comest [thou]2175-thou too , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , [thou]2175-thou who didst betray [[thy]2175-thou master]4136-thy master ? "[122-gagool]

[Infadoos]162-infadoos frowned as [he]162-infadoos answered -

" Nay , [I]162-infadoos come not ; it is not for [me]162-infadoos to enter [there]2626-there . But [thou]2175-thou , [Gagool]122-gagool , curb [thy]2175-thou tongue , and beware how [thou]2175-thou dealest with [[my]162-infadoos lords]3091-my lords . At [thy]2175-thou hands will [I]162-infadoos require [them]3091-my lords , and if a hair of [them]3091-my lords be hurt , [Gagool]122-gagool , be'st [thou]2175-thou fifty times [a witch]4139-a witch , [thou]2175-thou shalt die . Hearest [thou]2175-thou ? "[162-infadoos]

" [I]2181-i hear [Infadoos]162-infadoos ; [I]2181-i know [thee]162-infadoos , [thou]2175-thou didst ever love big words ; when [thou]2175-thou wast [a babe]3496-a babe [I]2181-i remember [thou]2175-thou didst threaten [[thine]2175-thou own mother]4141-thine own mother . That was but the other day . But , fear not , fear not , [I]2181-i live only to do the bidding of [the king]2791-the king . [I]2181-i have done the bidding of [many kings]4143-many kings , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , till in the end [they]4143-many kings did mine . Ha ! ha ! [I]2181-i go to look upon [their]4143-many kings faces once more , and [Twala]165-twala 's also ! Come on , come on , here is the lamp , "[2181-i] and [she]2181-i drew a large gourd full of oil , and fitted with a rush wick , from under [her]2181-i fur cloak .

" Art [thou]2175-thou coming , [Foulata]99-foulata ? "[98-good] asked [Good]98-good in [his]98-good villainous Kitchen Kukuana , in which [he]98-good had been improving [himself]98-good under [that young lady]2182-that young lady 's tuition .

" [I]3725-the girl fear , [[my]3725-the girl lord]3088-my lord , "[3725-the girl] [the girl]3725-the girl answered timidly .

" Then give [me]3725-the girl the basket . "[3725-the girl]

" Nay , [[my]3725-the girl lord]3088-my lord , whither [thou]2175-thou goest [there]2626-there [I]3725-the girl go also . "[3725-the girl]

" The deuce [you]2182-that young lady will ! "[0-i] thought [I]0-i to [myself]0-i ; " that may be rather awkward if [we]2185-we ever get out of this . "[0-i]

Without further ado [Gagool]122-gagool plunged into [the passage]2184-the passage , which was wide enough to admit of two walking abreast , and quite dark . [We]2185-we followed the sound of [her]2182-that young lady voice as [she]2182-that young lady piped to [us]2185-we to come on , in some fear and trembling , which was not allayed by the flutter of a sudden rush of wings .

" Hullo ! what 's that ? "[1741-somebody] halloed Good ; ' [somebody]1741-somebody hit [me]0-i in the face . "[1741-somebody]
