" [Bats]212-bats , "[0-i] said [I]0-i ; " on [you]212-bats go . "[0-i]

When , so far as [we]2185-we could judge , [we]2185-we had gone some fifty paces , [we]2185-we perceived that [the passage]2184-the passage was growing faintly light . Another minute , and [we]2185-we were in perhaps the most wonderful place that the eyes of [living man]3922-living man have beheld .

Let [the reader]502-the reader picture to [himself]502-the reader the hall of [the vastest cathedral [he]502-the reader ever stood in]2190-the vastest cathedral he ever stood in , windowless indeed , but dimly lighted from above , presumably by shafts connected with the outer air and driven in the roof , which arched away a hundred feet above [our]2185-we heads , and [he]502-the reader will get some idea of the size of [the enormous cave in which [we]2185-we found [ourselves]2185-we]2191-the enormous cave in which we found ourselves , with the difference that [this cathedral designed by nature]2192-this cathedral designed by nature was loftier and wider than any built by [man]2819-man . But [its]2192-this cathedral designed by nature stupendous size was the least of the wonders of [the place]3034-the place , for running in rows adown [its]2192-this cathedral designed by nature length were gigantic pillars of what looked like ice , but were , in reality , huge stalactites . It is impossible for [me]0-i to convey any idea of the overpowering beauty and grandeur of these pillars of white spar , some of which were not less than twenty feet in diameter at the base , and sprang up in lofty and yet delicate beauty sheer to the distant roof . Others again were in process of formation . On the rock floor there was in these cases what looked , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry said , exactly like a broken column in [an old Grecian temple]2195-an old grecian temple , whilst high above , depending from the roof , the point of a huge icicle could be dimly seen .

Even as [we]2185-we gazed [we]2185-we could hear the process going on , for presently with a tiny splash a drop of water would fall from the far - off icicle on to the column below . On some columns the drops only fell once in two or three minutes , and in these cases it would be an interesting calculation to discover how long , at that rate of dripping , it would take to form a pillar , say eighty feet by ten in diameter . That the process , in at least one instance , was incalculably slow , the following example will suffice to show . Cut on one of [these pillars]2196-these pillars [we]2185-we discovered the crude likeness of a mummy , by the head of which sat what appeared to be the figure of [an Egyptian god]2197-an egyptian god , doubtless the handiwork of [some old - world labourer in [the mine]2199-the mine]2198-some old - world labourer in the mine . This work of art was executed at the natural height at which [an idle fellow]2200-an idle fellow , be [he]2200-an idle fellow [Phoenician workman]2201-phoenician workman or [British cad]2202-british cad , is in the habit of trying to immortalise [himself]2200-an idle fellow at the expense of nature 's masterpieces , namely , about five feet from the ground . Yet at the time that [we]2185-we saw it , which must have been nearly three thousand years after the date of the execution of the carving , the column was only eight feet high , and was still in process of formation , which gives a rate of growth of a foot to a thousand years , or an inch and a fraction to a century . This [we]2185-we knew because , as [we]2185-we were standing by [it]2192-this cathedral designed by nature , [we]2185-we heard a drop of water fall .

Sometimes the stalagmites took strange forms , presumably where the dropping of the water had not always been on the same spot . Thus , one huge mass , which must have weighed a hundred tons or so , was in the shape of a pulpit , beautifully fretted over outside with a design that looked like lace . Others resembled strange beasts , and on the sides of [the cave]3037-the cave were fanlike ivory tracings , such as the frost leaves upon a pane .

Out of the vast main aisle there opened here and there smaller caves , exactly , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry said , as chapels open out of [great cathedrals]2204-great cathedrals . [Some]1479-some were large , but one or two - and this is a wonderful instance of how nature carries out [her]2206-her handiwork by the same unvarying laws , utterly irrespective of size - were tiny . [One little nook]2207-one little nook , for instance , was no larger than [an unusually big doll 's house]2208-an unusually big doll 's house , and yet it might have been a model for [the whole place]2209-the whole place , for the water dropped , tiny icicles hung , and spar columns were forming in just the same way .

[We]2185-we had not , however , enough time to examine [this beautiful cavern]2210-this beautiful cavern so thoroughly as [we]2185-we should have liked to do , since unfortunately , [Gagool]122-gagool seemed to be indifferent as to stalactites , and only anxious to get [her]122-gagool business over . This annoyed [me]0-i the more , as [I]0-i was particularly anxious to discover , if possible , by what system the light was admitted into [the cave]3037-the cave , and whether it was by the hand of [man]2819-man or by that of nature that this was done ; also if [the place]3034-the place had been used in any way in ancient times , as seemed probable . However , [we]2185-we consoled [ourselves]2185-we with the idea that [we]2185-we would investigate [it]3034-the place thoroughly on [our]2185-we way back , and followed on at the heels of [[our]2185-we uncanny guide]2214-our uncanny guide .

On [she]122-gagool led [us]2185-we , straight to the top of [the vast and silent cave]2215-the vast and silent cave , where [we]2185-we found another doorway , not arched as the first was , but square at the top , something like the doorways of [Egyptian temples]2216-egyptian temples .

" Are [ye]2185-we prepared to enter [the Place of Death]4061-the place of death , [white men]2713-white men ? "[122-gagool] asked [Gagool]122-gagool , evidently with a view to making [us]2185-we feel uncomfortable .

" Lead on , [Macduff]213-macduff , "[98-good] said [Good]98-good solemnly , trying to look as though [he]98-good was not at all alarmed , as indeed [we]2185-we all did except [Foulata]99-foulata , who caught [Good]98-good by the arm for protection .

" This is getting rather ghastly , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , peeping into [the dark passageway]2217-the dark passageway . " Come on , [[Quatermain]107-quatermain - seniores priores]4149-quatermain - seniores priores . [We]2185-we must n't keep [the old lady]4150-the old lady waiting ! "[97-sir henry] and [he]97-sir henry politely made way for [me]0-i to lead [the van]2218-the van , for which inwardly [I]0-i did not bless [him]97-sir henry .

[Tap]214-tap , tap , went [old Gagool]122-gagool 's stick down [the passage]2184-the passage , as [she]122-gagool trotted along , chuckling hideously ; and still overcome by some unaccountable presentiment of evil , [I]0-i hung back .

" Come , get on , [old fellow]3887-old fellow , "[493-good] said [Good]493-good , " or [we]4152-we shall lose [[our]4152-we fair guide]4153-our fair guide . "[493-good]

Thus adjured , [I]0-i started down [the passage]2184-the passage , and after about twenty paces found [myself]0-i in [a gloomy apartment]2222-a gloomy apartment some forty feet long , by thirty broad , and thirty high , which in some past age evidently had been hollowed , by hand - labour , out of [the mountain]659-the mountain . [This apartment]2224-this apartment was not nearly so well lighted as [the vast stalactite ante - cave]2225-the vast stalactite ante - cave , and at the first glance all [I]0-i could discern was a massive stone table running down [its]2226-its length , with a colossal white figure at its head , and life - sized white figures all round it . Next [I]0-i discovered a brown thing , seated on the table in the centre , and in another moment [my]0-i eyes grew accustomed to the light , and [I]0-i saw what all these things were , and was tailing out of the place as hard as [my]0-i legs could carry [me]0-i .

[I]0-i am not [a nervous man]2227-a nervous man in a general way , and very little troubled with superstitions , of which [I]0-i have lived to see the folly ; but [I]0-i am free to own that this sight quite upset [me]0-i , and had it not been that [Sir Henry]97-sir henry caught [me]0-i by the collar and held [me]0-i , [I]0-i do honestly believe that in another five minutes [I]0-i should have been outside [the stalactite cave]250-the stalactite cave , and that a promise of all the diamonds in [Kimberley]77-kimberley would not have induced [me]0-i to enter [it]250-the stalactite cave again . But [he]97-sir henry held [me]0-i tight , so [I]0-i stopped because [I]0-i could not help [myself]0-i . Next second , however , [his]97-sir henry eyes became accustomed to the light , and [he]97-sir henry let go of [me]0-i , and began to mop the perspiration off [his]97-sir henry forehead . As for Good , [he]97-sir henry swore feebly , while [Foulata]99-foulata threw [her]99-foulata arms round [his]97-sir henry neck and shrieked .

Only [Gagool]122-gagool chuckled loud and long .

It was a ghastly sight . There at the end of the long stone table , holding in [his]97-sir henry skeleton fingers a great white spear , sat [Death]152-death [himself]152-death , shaped in the form of a colossal human skeleton , fifteen feet or more in height . High above [his]97-sir henry head [he]97-sir henry held the spear , as though in the act to strike ; one bony hand rested on the stone table before [him]97-sir henry , in the position [a man]2655-a man assumes on rising from [his]2655-a man seat , whilst [his]97-sir henry frame was bent forward so that the vertebræ of the neck and the grinning , gleaming skull projected towards [us]2230-we , and fixed its hollow eye - places upon [us]2230-we , the jaws a little open , as though it were about to speak .

" Great heavens ! "[0-i] said [I]0-i faintly , at last , " what can it be ? "[0-i]

" And what are those things ? "[98-good] asked [Good]98-good , pointing to [the white company round the table]2231-the white company round the table .

" And what on earth is that thing ? "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , pointing to [the brown creature seated on the table]2232-the brown creature seated on the table .

" Hee ! hee ! hee ! "[122-gagool] laughed [Gagool]122-gagool . " To [those who enter [the Hall of [the Dead]4156-the dead]4155-the hall of the dead]4154-those who enter the hall of the dead , evil comes . Hee ! hee ! hee ! ha ! ha ! "[122-gagool]

" Come , [Incubu]3971-incubu , brave in battle , come and see [him]97-sir henry [thou]3971-incubu slewest ; "[2233-the old creature] and [the old creature]2233-the old creature caught [Curtis]97-sir henry ' coat in [her]2233-the old creature skinny fingers , and led [him]97-sir henry away towards the table . [We]2230-we followed .

Presently [she]2233-the old creature stopped and pointed at [the brown object seated on the table]2234-the brown object seated on the table . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry looked , and started back with an exclamation ; and no wonder , for there , quite naked , the head which [Curtis]97-sir henry ' battle - axe had shorn from the body resting on its knees , was the gaunt corpse of [Twala]165-twala , [the last king of [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas]2235-the last king of the kukuanas . Yes , there , the head perched upon the knees , it sat in all its ugliness , the vertebræ projecting a full inch above the level of the shrunken flesh of the neck , for all [the world]248-the world like a black double of [Hamilton Tighe]215-hamilton tighe . 2 Over the surface of the corpse there was gathered a thin glassy film , that made its appearance yet more appalling , for which [we]2230-we were , at the moment , quite unable to account , till presently [we]2230-we observed that from the roof of [the chamber]4078-the chamber the water fell steadily , drip ! drop ! drip ! on to the neck of the corpse , whence it ran down over the entire surface , and finally escaped into the rock through a tiny hole in the table . Then [I]0-i guessed what the film was - [Twala]165-twala 's body was being transformed into a stalactite .

A look at the white forms seated on the stone bench which ran round that ghastly board confirmed this view . [They]2238-they were [human bodies]2239-human bodies indeed , or rather [they]2238-they had been human ; now [they]2238-they were stalactites . This was the way in which [the Kukuana people]3110-the kukuana people had from time immemorial preserved [[their]3110-the kukuana people royal dead]2241-their royal dead . [They]3110-the kukuana people petrified [them]2241-their royal dead . What the exact system might be , if there was any , beyond the placing of [them]2241-their royal dead for a long period of years under the drip , [I]0-i never discovered , but there [they]2241-their royal dead sat , iced over and preserved for ever by the siliceous fluid .

Anything more awe - inspiring than the spectacle of this long line of departed royalties there were [twenty - seven of [them]2241-their royal dead]2242-twenty - seven of them , the last being [[Ignosi]169-ignosi 's father]1548-ignosi 's father , wrapped , each of [them]2241-their royal dead , in a shroud of ice - like spar , through which the features could be dimly discovered , and seated round that inhospitable board , with [Death]152-death [himself]152-death for [a host]2244-a host , it is impossible to imagine . That the practice of thus preserving [[their]2241-their royal dead kings]2245-their kings must have been an ancient one is evident from the number , which , allowing for an average reign of fifteen years , supposing that [every king who reigned was placed [here]2924-here - an improbable thing , as some are sure to have perished in battle far from [home]2616-home]2246-every king who reigned was placed here - an improbable thing , as some are sure to have perished in battle far from home - would fix the date of its commencement at four and a quarter centuries back .

But the colossal Death , who sits at the head of the board , is far older than that , and , unless [I]0-i am much mistaken , owes [his]152-death origin to [the same artist who designed the three Colossi]2249-the same artist who designed the three colossi . [He]152-death is hewn out of a single stalactite , and , looked at as a work of art , is most admirably conceived and executed . Good , who understands such things , declared that , so far as [he]152-death could see , the anatomical design of the skeleton is perfect down to the smallest bones .

[My]0-i own idea is , that this terrific object was a freak of fancy on the part of [some old - world sculptor]2250-some old - world sculptor , and that its presence had suggested to [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas the idea of placing [their]93-the kukuanas royal dead under its awful presidency . Or perhaps it was set there to frighten away [any marauders who might have designs upon the treasure chamber beyond]2251-any marauders who might have designs upon the treasure chamber beyond . [I]0-i can not say . All [I]0-i can do is to describe it as it is , and [the reader]502-the reader must form [his]502-the reader own conclusion .

Such , at any rate , was the White Death and such were [the White Dead]216-the white dead !

1 Compare [Milton]217-milton , " Paradise Lost , "[217-milton] Book i. : -

" With these in troop Came [Ashtoreth]202-ashtoreth , whom [the Phoenicians]218-the phoenicians called [Astarté]219-astarté , [Queen of Heaven , with crescent horns]4158-queen of heaven , with crescent horns ; [To whose bright image nightly by the moon Sidonian virgins]4159-to whose bright image nightly by the moon sidonian virgins paid [their]4159-to whose bright image nightly by the moon sidonian virgins vows and songs . "[217-milton]

CHAPTER XVII

[SOLOMON]90-solomon 'S [TREASURE CHAMBER]79-treasure chamber

While [we]2253-our were engaged in recovering from [our]2253-our fright , and in examining the grisly wonders of [the Place of Death]4061-the place of death , [Gagool]122-gagool had been differently occupied . Somehow or other - for [she]122-gagool was marvellously active when [she]122-gagool chose - [she]122-gagool had scrambled on to the great table , and made [her]122-gagool way to where [[our]2253-our departed friend]2255-our departed friend [Twala]165-twala was placed , under the drip , to see , suggested Good , how [he]165-twala was " pickling , "[122-gagool] or for some dark purpose of [her]122-gagool own . Then , after bending down to kiss [his]165-twala icy lips as though in affectionate greeting , [she]122-gagool hobbled back , stopping now and again to address the remark , the tenor of which [I]0-i could not catch , to one or other of the shrouded forms , just as [you]2256-you or [I]0-i might welcome [an old acquaintance]2257-an old acquaintance . Having gone through this mysterious and horrible ceremony , [she]122-gagool squatted [herself]122-gagool down on the table immediately under the White Death , and began , so far as [I]0-i could make out , to offer up prayers . The spectacle of [this wicked creature pouring out supplications]2258-this wicked creature pouring out supplications , evil ones no doubt , to [the arch enemy of [mankind]1981-mankind]2259-the arch enemy of mankind , was so uncanny that it caused [us]2253-our to hasten [our]2253-our inspection .

" Now , [Gagool]122-gagool , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , in a low voice - somehow [one]337-one did not dare to speak above a whisper in that place - " lead [us]2253-our to [the chamber]4078-the chamber . "[0-i]

[The old witch]3488-the old witch promptly scrambled down from the table .

" [[My]122-gagool lords]3091-my lords are not afraid ? "[122-gagool] [she]122-gagool said , leering up into [my]0-i face .

" Lead on . "[122-gagool]

" Good , [[my]122-gagool lords]3091-my lords ; "[122-gagool] and [she]122-gagool hobbled round to the back of the great Death . " Here is [the chamber]4078-the chamber ; let [[my]122-gagool lords]3091-my lords light the lamp , and enter , "[122-gagool] and [she]122-gagool placed the gourd full of oil upon the floor , and leaned [herself]122-gagool against the side of [the cave]3037-the cave . [I]0-i took out a match , of which [we]2264-us had still a few in a box , and lit a rush wick , and then looked for the doorway , but there was nothing before [us]2264-us except the solid rock . [Gagool]122-gagool grinned . " The way is there , [[my]122-gagool lords]3091-my lords . Ha ! ha ! ha ! "[122-gagool]

" Do not jest with [us]2264-us , "[0-i] [I]0-i said sternly .

" [I]122-gagool jest not , [[my]122-gagool lords]3091-my lords . See ! "[122-gagool] and [she]122-gagool pointed at the rock .

As [she]122-gagool did so , on holding up the lamp [we]2264-us perceived that a mass of stone was rising slowly from the floor and vanishing into the rock above , where doubtless there is a cavity prepared to receive it . The mass was of the width of a good - sized door , about ten feet high and not less than five feet thick . It must have weighed at least twenty or thirty tons , and was clearly moved upon some simple balance principle of counter - weights , probably the same as that by which the opening and shutting of an ordinary modern window is arranged . How the principle was set in motion , of course [none of [us]2264-us]2265-none of us saw ; [Gagool]122-gagool was careful to avoid this ; but [I]0-i have little doubt that there was some very simple lever , which was moved ever so little by pressure at a secret spot , thereby throwing additional weight on to the hidden counter - balances , and causing the monolith to be lifted from the ground .

Very slowly and gently the great stone raised itself , till at last it had vanished altogether , and a dark hole presented itself to [us]2264-us in the place which the door had filled .

[Our]2264-us excitement was so intense , as [we]2264-us saw the way to [[Solomon]90-solomon 's treasure chamber]2798-solomon 's treasure chamber thrown open at last , that [I]0-i for one began to tremble and shake . Would it prove a hoax after all , [I]0-i wondered , or was old [Da Silvestra]220-da silvestra right ? Were there vast hoards of wealth hidden in [that dark place]2267-that dark place , hoards which would make [us]2264-us [the richest men in [the whole world]2269-the whole world]2268-the richest men in the whole world ? [We]2264-us should know in a minute or two .

" Enter , [white men from [the Stars]70-the stars]3404-white men from the stars , "[122-gagool] said [Gagool]122-gagool , advancing into the doorway ; " but first hear [[your]0-i servant]4170-your servant , [Gagool the old]122-gagool . The bright stones that [ye]0-i will see were dug out of the pit over which the Silent Ones are set , and stored here , [I]122-gagool know not by whom , for that was done longer ago than even [I]122-gagool remember . But once has [this place]2838-this place been entered since the time that [those who hid the stones]4172-those who hid the stones departed in haste , leaving [them]4172-those who hid the stones behind . The report of the treasure went down indeed among [the people who lived in [the country]300-the country from age to age]4173-the people who lived in the country from age to age , but [none]2774-none knew where [the chamber]4078-the chamber was , nor the secret of the door . But it happened that [a white man]662-a white man reached [this country]2870-this country from over [the mountains]2771-the mountains - perchance [he]662-a white man too came ' from the Stars ' - and was well received by [the king of that day]4069-the king of that day . [He]662-a white man it is who sits yonder , "[122-gagool] and [she]122-gagool pointed to [the fifth king at the table of the Dead]2270-the fifth king at the table of the dead . " And it came to pass that [he]662-a white man and [a woman of [the country]300-the country who was with [him]662-a white man]4181-a woman of the country who was with him journeyed to [this place]2838-this place , and that by chance [the woman]3446-the woman learnt the secret of the door - a thousand years might [ye]4185-ye search , but [ye]4185-ye should never find that secret . Then [the white man]243-the white man entered with [the woman]3446-the woman , and found the stones , and filled with stones the skin of a small goat , which [the woman]3446-the woman had with [her]3446-the woman to hold food . And as [he]662-a white man was going from [the chamber]4078-the chamber [he]662-a white man took up one more stone , a large one , and held it in [his]662-a white man hand . "[122-gagool]

Here [she]122-gagool paused .

" Well , "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , breathless with interest as [we]2271-thou all were , " what happened to [Da Silvestra]220-da silvestra ? "[0-i]

[The old hag]1373-the old hag started at the mention of the name .

" How knowest [thou]2271-thou [the dead man]872-the dead man 's name ? "[1373-the old hag] [she]1373-the old hag asked sharply ; and then , without waiting for an answer , went on -

" None can tell what happened ; but it came about that [the white man]243-the white man was frightened , for [he]662-a white man flung down the goat - skin , with the stones , and fled out with only the one stone in [his]662-a white man hand , and that [the king]2791-the king took , and it is the stone which [thou]2271-thou , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , didst take from [Twala]165-twala 's brow . "[122-gagool]

" Have [none]2774-none entered [here]2924-here since ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked , peering again down [the dark passage]2273-the dark passage .

" None , [[my]2275-she lords]3091-my lords . Only the secret of the door has been kept , and [every king]4196-every king has opened it , though [he]4196-every king has not entered . There is a saying , that [those who enter there]4197-those who enter there will die within a moon , even as [the white man]243-the white man died in [the cave upon [the mountain]659-the mountain]4199-the cave upon the mountain , where [ye]3091-my lords found [him]243-the white man , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , and therefore [the kings]4043-the kings do not enter . Ha ! ha ! [mine]4202-mine are true words . "[2275-she]

[Our]2274-our eyes met as [she]2275-she said it , and [I]0-i turned sick and cold . How did [the old hag]1373-the old hag know all these things ?

" Enter , [[my]2275-she lords]3091-my lords . If [I]2275-she speak truth , the goat - skin with the stones will lie upon the floor ; and if there is truth as to whether it is death to enter [here]2924-here , that [ye]3091-my lords will learn afterwards . Ha ! ha ! ha ! "[2275-she] and [she]2275-she hobbled through the doorway , bearing the light with [her]2275-she ; but [I]0-i confess that once more [I]0-i hesitated about following .

" Oh , confound it all ! "[493-good] said [Good]493-good ; " here goes . [I]493-good am not going to be frightened by [that old devil]4205-that old devil ; "[493-good] and followed by [Foulata]99-foulata , who , however , evidently did not at all like the business , for [she]99-foulata was shivering with fear , [he]2278-he plunged into [the passage]2184-the passage after [Gagool]122-gagool - an example which [we]2280-we quickly followed .

A few yards down [the passage]2184-the passage , in the narrow way hewn out of [the living rock]2282-the living rock , [Gagool]122-gagool had paused , and was waiting for [us]2280-we .

" See , [[my]2275-she lords]3091-my lords , "[2275-she] [she]2275-she said , holding the light before [her]2275-she , " [those who stored the treasure here]4207-those who stored the treasure here fled in haste , and bethought [them]4207-those who stored the treasure here to guard against [any who should find the secret of the door]4208-any who should find the secret of the door , but had not the time , "[2275-she] and [she]2275-she pointed to large square blocks of stone , which , to the height of two courses about two feet three , had been placed across [the passage]2184-the passage with a view to walling [it]2184-the passage up . Along the side of [the passage]2184-the passage were similar blocks ready for use , and , most curious of all , a heap of mortar and a couple of trowels , which tools , so far as [we]2280-we had time to examine them , appeared to be of a similar shape and make to those used by [workmen]2285-workmen to this day .

Here [Foulata , who had been in a state of great fear and agitation throughout]2286-foulata , who had been in a state of great fear and agitation throughout , said that [she]2286-foulata , who had been in a state of great fear and agitation throughout felt faint and could go no farther , but would wait there . Accordingly [we]2280-we set [her]2286-foulata , who had been in a state of great fear and agitation throughout down on the unfinished wall , placing the basket of provisions by [her]2286-foulata , who had been in a state of great fear and agitation throughout side , and left [her]2286-foulata , who had been in a state of great fear and agitation throughout to recover .

Following [the passage]2184-the passage for about fifteen paces farther , [we]2280-we came suddenly to an elaborately painted wooden door . It was standing wide open . [Whoever was last there]2288-whoever was last there had either not found the time to shut it , or had forgotten to do so .

Across the threshold of this door lay a skin bag , formed of a goat - skin , that appeared to be full of pebbles .

" Hee ! hee ! [white men]2713-white men , "[122-gagool] sniggered [Gagool]122-gagool , as the light from the lamp fell upon it . " What did [I]122-gagool tell [you]98-good , that [the white man who came here]4210-the white man who came here fled in haste , and dropped [the woman]3446-the woman 's bag - behold it ! Look within also and [ye]98-good will find a water - gourd amongst the stones . "[122-gagool]

[Good]98-good stooped down and lifted it . It was heavy and jingled .

" By [Jove]221-jove ! [I]98-good believe it 's full of diamonds , "[98-good] [he]98-good said , in an awed whisper ; and , indeed , the idea of a small goat - skin full of diamonds is enough to awe [anybody]2621-anybody .

" Go on , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry impatiently . " Here , [old lady]4212-old lady , give [me]98-good the lamp , "[98-good] and taking it from [Gagool]122-gagool 's hand , [he]98-good stepped through the doorway and held it high above [his]98-good head .

[We]2280-we pressed in after [him]98-good , forgetful for the moment of the bag of diamonds , and found [ourselves]2280-we in [[King Solomon]222-solomon 's treasure chamber]2290-king solomon 's treasure chamber .

At first , all that the somewhat faint light given by the lamp revealed was [a room hewn out of the living rock , and apparently not more than ten feet square]2291-a room hewn out of the living rock , and apparently not more than ten feet square . Next there came into sight , stored one on the other to the arch of the roof , a splendid collection of elephant - tusks . How many of them there were [we]2280-we did not know , for of course [we]2280-we could not see to what depth [they]2292-they went back , but there could not have been less than the ends of four or five hundred tusks of the first quality visible to [our]2280-we eyes . There , alone , was enough ivory to make [a man wealthy for life]2293-a man wealthy for life . Perhaps , [I]0-i thought , it was from [this very store]2294-this very store that [Solomon]222-solomon drew the raw material for [his]222-solomon " great throne of ivory , "[97-sir henry] of which " there was not the like made in [any kingdom]4213-any kingdom . "[222-solomon]

On the opposite side of [the chamber]4078-the chamber were about a score of wooden boxes , something like [Martini - Henry]223-martini - henry ammunition boxes , only rather larger , and painted red .

" There are the diamonds , "[0-i] cried [I]0-i ; " bring the light . "[0-i]

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry did so , holding it close to the top box , of which the lid , rendered rotten by time even in that dry place , appeared to have been smashed in , probably by [Da Silvestra]220-da silvestra [himself]220-da silvestra . Pushing [my]0-i hand through the hole in the lid [I]0-i drew it out full , not of diamonds , but of gold pieces , of a shape that none of [us]2280-we had seen before , and with what looked like Hebrew characters stamped upon them .

" Ah ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said , replacing the coin , " [we]2280-we sha n't go back empty - handed , anyhow . There must be a couple of thousand pieces in each box , and there are eighteen boxes . [I]0-i suppose this was the money to pay [the workmen]4214-the workmen and [merchants]4215-merchants . "[0-i]

" Well , "[98-good] put in [Good]98-good , " [I]98-good think that is the lot ; [I]98-good do n't see any diamonds , unless [the old Portuguese]4216-the old portuguese put them all into [his]4216-the old portuguese bag . "[98-good]

" Let [[my]122-gagool lords]3091-my lords look yonder where it is darkest , if [they]3091-my lords would find the stones , "[122-gagool] said [Gagool]122-gagool , interpreting [our]2280-we looks . " There [[my]122-gagool lords]3091-my lords will find [a nook]4219-a nook , and three stone chests in [the nook]4220-the nook , two sealed and one open . "[122-gagool]

Before translating this to [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , who carried the light , [I]0-i could not resist asking how [she]122-gagool knew these things , if [no one]2759-no one had entered [the place]3034-the place since [the white man]243-the white man , generations ago .

" Ah , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , [the watcher by night]4221-the watcher by night , "[122-gagool] was the mocking answer , " [[ye]138-macumazahn who dwell in the stars]4222-ye who dwell in the stars , do [ye]138-macumazahn not know that [some live long , and that some have eyes which can see through rock]4223-some live long , and that some have eyes which can see through rock ? Ha ! ha ! ha ! "[122-gagool]

" Look in that corner , [Curtis]97-sir henry , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , indicating [the spot [Gagool]122-gagool had pointed out]2299-the spot gagool had pointed out .

" [Hullo]224-hullo , [[you]2300-we fellows]3640-you fellows , "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry cried , " here 's [a recess]4225-a recess . Great heavens ! see here . "[97-sir henry]

[We]2300-we hurried up to where [he]97-sir henry was standing in [a nook]4219-a nook , shaped something like a small bow window . Against the wall of [this recess]2302-this recess were placed three stone chests , each about two feet square . Two were fitted with stone lids , the lid of the third rested against the side of the chest , which was open .

" See ! "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry repeated hoarsely , holding the lamp over the open chest . [We]2300-we looked , and for a moment could make nothing out , on account of a silvery sheen which dazzled [us]2300-we . When [our]2300-we eyes grew used to it [we]2300-we saw that the chest was three - parts full of uncut diamonds , most of them of considerable size . Stooping , [I]0-i picked some up . Yes , there was no doubt of it , there was the unmistakable soapy feel about them .

[I]0-i fairly gasped as [I]0-i dropped them .

" [We]2300-we are [the richest men in [the whole world]2269-the whole world]2268-the richest men in the whole world , "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " [Monte Christo]225-monte christo was a fool to [us]2300-we . "[0-i]

" [We]2300-we shall flood [the market]4228-the market with diamonds , "[493-good] said [Good]493-good .

" Got to get them there first , "[97-sir henry] suggested [Sir Henry]97-sir henry .

[We]2300-we stood still with pale faces and stared at [each other]373-each other , the lantern in the middle and the glimmering gems below , as though [we]2300-we were [conspirators about to commit a crime]2305-conspirators about to commit a crime , instead of being , as [we]2300-we thought , [the most fortunate men on [earth]2307-earth]2306-the most fortunate men on earth .

" Hee ! hee ! hee ! "[122-gagool] cackled [old Gagool]122-gagool behind [us]2300-we , as [she]122-gagool flitted about like a vampire bat . " There are the bright stones [ye]2300-we love , [white men]2713-white men , as many as [ye]2300-we will ; take them , run them through [your]2300-we fingers , eat of them , hee ! hee ! drink of them , ha ! ha ! "[122-gagool]

At that moment there was something so ridiculous to [my]0-i mind at the idea of eating and drinking diamonds , that [I]0-i began to laugh outrageously , an example which [the others]595-the others followed , without knowing why . There [we]2300-we stood and shrieked with laughter over the gems that were ours , which had been found for [us]2300-we thousands of years ago by the patient delvers in [the great hole yonder]2309-the great hole yonder , and stored for [us]2300-we by [[Solomon]222-solomon 's long - dead overseer]2310-solomon 's long - dead overseer , whose name , perchance , was written in the characters stamped on the faded wax that yet adhered to the lids of the chest . [Solomon]222-solomon never got them , nor [David]226-david , or [Da Silvestra]220-da silvestra , nor [anybody else]2311-anybody else . [We]2300-we had got them : there before [us]2300-we were millions of pounds ' worth of diamonds , and thousands of pounds ' worth of gold and ivory only waiting to be taken away .

Suddenly the fit passed off , and [we]2300-we stopped laughing .

" Open the other chests , [white men]2713-white men , "[122-gagool] croaked [Gagool]122-gagool , " there are surely more therein . Take [your]2713-white men fill , [white lords]3283-white lords ! Ha ! ha ! take [your]2713-white men fill . "[122-gagool]

Thus adjured , [we]2300-we set to work to pull up the stone lids on the other two , first - not without a feeling of sacrilege - breaking the seals that fastened them .

Hoorah ! they were full too , full to the brim ; at least , the second one was ; no wretched burglarious [Da Silvestra]220-da silvestra had been filling goat - skins out of that . As for the third chest , it was only about a fourth full , but the stones were all picked ones ; none less than twenty carats , and some of them as large as pigeon - eggs . A good many of these bigger ones , however , [we]2300-we could see by holding them up to the light , were a little yellow , " off coloured , "[2312-they] as [they]2312-they call it at [Kimberley]77-kimberley .

What [we]2300-we did not see , however , was the look of fearful malevolence that [old Gagool]122-gagool favoured [us]2300-we with as [she]122-gagool crept , crept like a snake , out of [the treasure chamber]2313-the treasure chamber and down [the passage]2184-the passage towards the door of solid rock .

Hark ! Cry upon cry comes ringing up [the vaulted path]2315-the vaulted path . It is [Foulata]99-foulata 's voice !

" Oh , [Bougwan]144-bougwan ! help ! help ! the stone falls ! "[99-foulata]

" Leave go , [girl]3742-girl ! Then - "[99-foulata]

" Help ! help ! [she]99-foulata has stabbed [me]99-foulata ! "[99-foulata]

By now [we]2300-we are running down [the passage]2184-the passage , and this is what the light from the lamp shows [us]2300-we . The door of the rock is closing down slowly ; it is not three feet from the floor . Near [it]2317-it struggle [Foulata]99-foulata and [Gagool]122-gagool . The red blood of [the former]374-the former runs to [her]122-gagool knee , but still [the brave girl]2319-the brave girl holds [the old witch]3488-the old witch , who fights like a wild cat . Ah ! [she]122-gagool is free ! [Foulata]99-foulata falls , and [Gagool]122-gagool throws [herself]122-gagool on the ground , to twist like a snake through the crack of the closing stone . [She]122-gagool is under - ah ! god ! too late ! too late ! The stone nips [her]122-gagool , and [she]122-gagool yells in agony . Down , down it comes , all the thirty tons of it , slowly pressing [her]122-gagool old body against the rock below . Shriek upon shriek , such as [we]2300-we have never heard , then a long sickening crunch , and the door was shut just as , rushing down [the passage]2184-the passage , [we]2300-we hurled [ourselves]2300-we against it .

It was all done in four seconds .

Then [we]2300-we turned to [Foulata]99-foulata . [The poor girl]1441-the poor girl was stabbed in the body , and [I]0-i saw that [she]1441-the poor girl could not live long .

" Ah ! [Bougwan]144-bougwan , [I]2323-the beautiful creature die ! "[2323-the beautiful creature] gasped [the beautiful creature]2323-the beautiful creature . " [She]99-foulata crept out - [Gagool]122-gagool ; [I]2323-the beautiful creature did not see [her]99-foulata , [I]2323-the beautiful creature was faint - and the door began to fall ; then [she]99-foulata came back , and was looking up [the path]4233-the path - [I]2323-the beautiful creature saw [her]99-foulata come in through the slowly falling door , and caught [her]99-foulata and held [her]99-foulata , and [she]99-foulata stabbed [me]2323-the beautiful creature , and [I]2323-the beautiful creature die , [Bougwan]144-bougwan ! "[2323-the beautiful creature]

" [Poor girl]4234-poor girl ! [poor girl]4234-poor girl ! "[98-good] [Good]98-good cried in [his]98-good distress ; and then , as [he]98-good could do nothing else , [he]98-good fell to kissing [her]2324-i .

" [Bougwan]144-bougwan , "[2324-i] [she]2324-i said , after a pause , " is [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn [there]2626-there ? It grows so dark , [I]2324-i can not see . "[2324-i]

" Here [I]2323-the beautiful creature am , [Foulata]99-foulata . "[2323-the beautiful creature]

" [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , be [my]2324-i tongue for a moment , [I]2324-i pray [thee]138-macumazahn , for [Bougwan]144-bougwan can not understand [me]2324-i , and before [I]2324-i go into the darkness [I]2324-i would speak to [him]144-bougwan a word . "[2324-i]

" Say on , [Foulata]99-foulata , [I]2323-the beautiful creature will render it . "[2323-the beautiful creature]

" Say to [[my]2324-i lord]3088-my lord , [Bougwan]144-bougwan , that - [I]2324-i love [him]144-bougwan , and that [I]2324-i am glad to die because [I]2324-i know that [he]144-bougwan can not cumber [his]144-bougwan life with such as [I]2324-i am , for the sun may not mate with the darkness , nor the white with the black .[2324-i]

" Say that , since [I]2323-the beautiful creature saw [him]144-bougwan , at times [I]2323-the beautiful creature have felt as though there were a bird in [my]2323-the beautiful creature bosom , which would one day fly hence and sing elsewhere . Even now , though [I]2323-the beautiful creature can not lift [my]2323-the beautiful creature hand , and [my]2323-the beautiful creature brain grows cold , [I]2323-the beautiful creature do not feel as though [my]2323-the beautiful creature heart were dying ; it is so full of love that it could live ten thousand years , and yet be young . Say that if [I]2323-the beautiful creature live again , mayhap [I]2323-the beautiful creature shall see [him]144-bougwan in [the Stars]70-the stars , and that - [I]2323-the beautiful creature will search them all , though perchance there [I]2323-the beautiful creature should still be black and [he]144-bougwan would - still be white . Say - nay , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , say no more , save that [I]2323-the beautiful creature love - Oh , hold [me]2323-the beautiful creature closer , [Bougwan]144-bougwan , [I]2323-the beautiful creature can not feel thine arms - oh ! oh ! "[2323-the beautiful creature]

" [She]4238-she is dead - [she]4238-she is dead ! "[493-good] muttered [Good]493-good , rising in grief , the tears running down [his]493-good honest face .

" [You]97-sir henry need not let that trouble [you]97-sir henry , [old fellow]3887-old fellow , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry .

" Eh ! "[98-good] exclaimed [Good]98-good ; " what do [you]97-sir henry mean ? "[98-good]

" [I]97-sir henry mean that [you]97-sir henry will soon be in a position to join [her]4238-she . [Man]2819-man , do n't [you]97-sir henry see that [we]2326-we are buried alive ? "[97-sir henry]

Until [Sir Henry]97-sir henry uttered these words [I]0-i do not think that the full horror of what had happened had come home to [us]2326-we , preoccupied as [we]2326-we were with the sight of poor [Foulata]99-foulata 's end . But now [we]2326-we understood . The ponderous mass of rock had closed , probably for ever , for the only brain which knew its secret was crushed to powder beneath its weight . This was a door that [none]2774-none could hope to force with anything short of dynamite in large quantities . And [we]2326-we were on the wrong side !

For a few minutes [we]2326-we stood horrified , there over the corpse of [Foulata]99-foulata . All the manhood seemed to have gone out of [us]2326-we . The first shock of this idea of the slow and miserable end that awaited [us]2326-we was overpowering . [We]2326-we saw it all now ; that fiend [Gagool]122-gagool had planned this snare for [us]2326-we from the first .

It would have been just the jest that [her]122-gagool evil mind would have rejoiced in , the idea of [the three white men , whom , for some reason of [her]122-gagool own , [she]122-gagool had always hated , slowly perishing of thirst and hunger in the company of the treasure [they]2328-the three white men , whom , for some reason of her own , she had always hated , slowly perishing of thirst and hunger in the company of the treasure they had coveted had coveted]2328-the three white men , whom , for some reason of her own , she had always hated , slowly perishing of thirst and hunger in the company of the treasure they had coveted . Now [I]0-i saw the point of that sneer of [hers]122-gagool about eating and drinking the diamonds . Probably [somebody]1741-somebody had tried to serve [the poor old [Dom]201-the old portuguese dom]2330-the poor old dom in the same way , when [he]2330-the poor old dom abandoned the skin full of jewels .

" This will never do , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry hoarsely ; " the lamp will soon go out . Let [us]2326-we see if [we]2326-we ca n't find the spring that works the rock . "[97-sir henry]

[We]2326-we sprang forward with desperate energy , and , standing in a bloody ooze , began to feel up and down the door and the sides of [the passage]2184-the passage . But no knob or spring could [we]2326-we discover .

" Depend on it , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " it does not work from the inside ; if it did [Gagool]122-gagool would not have risked trying to crawl underneath the stone . It was the knowledge of this that made [her]122-gagool try to escape at all hazards , curse [her]122-gagool . "[0-i]

" At all events , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , with a hard little laugh , " retribution was swift ; [hers]122-gagool was almost as awful an end as [ours]2326-we is likely to be . [We]2326-we can do nothing with the door ; let [us]2326-we go back to [the treasure room]4241-the treasure room . "[97-sir henry]

[We]2326-we turned and went , and as [we]2326-we passed [it]2332-it [I]0-i perceived by the unfinished wall across [the passage]2184-the passage the basket of food which [poor Foulata]99-foulata had carried . [I]0-i took it up , and brought it with [me]0-i to [the accursed treasure chamber that was to be [our]2326-we grave]2334-the accursed treasure chamber that was to be our grave . Then [we]2326-we returned and reverently bore in [Foulata]99-foulata 's corpse , laying it on the floor by the boxes of coin .

Next [we]2326-we seated [ourselves]2326-we , leaning [our]2326-we backs against the three stone chests which contained the priceless treasure .

" Let [us]2326-we divide the food , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , ' so as to make it last as long as possible . " Accordingly [we]2326-we did so . [It]4242-it would , [we]2326-we reckoned , make four infinitesimally small meals for each of [us]2326-we , enough , say , to support life for a couple of days . Besides the "[97-sir henry] biltong , " or dried game - flesh , there were two gourds of water , each of which held not more than a quart .[97-sir henry]

" Now , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry grimly , " let [us]2326-we eat and drink , for to - morrow [we]2326-we die . "[97-sir henry]

[We]2326-we each ate a small portion of the " biltong , "[97-sir henry] and drank a sip of water . Needless to say , [we]2326-we had but little appetite , though [we]2326-we were sadly in need of food , and felt better after swallowing it . Then [we]2326-we got up and made a systematic examination of the walls of [[our]2326-we prison - house]2335-our prison - house , in the faint hope of finding some means of exit , sounding them and the floor carefully .

There was none . It was not probable that there would be any to [a treasure chamber]2336-a treasure chamber .

The lamp began to burn dim . The fat was nearly exhausted .

" Quatermain , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , " what is the time - [your]0-i watch goes ? "[97-sir henry]

[I]0-i drew it out , and looked at it . It was six o'clock ; [we]2326-we had entered [the cave]3037-the cave at eleven .

" [Infadoos]162-infadoos will miss [us]2326-we , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested . " If [we]2326-we do not return to - night [he]162-infadoos will search for [us]2326-we in the morning , [Curtis]97-sir henry . "[0-i]

" [He]162-infadoos may search in vain . [He]162-infadoos does not know the secret of the door , nor even where it is . [No living person]4243-no living person knew it yesterday , except [Gagool]122-gagool . To - day [no one]2759-no one knows it . Even if [he]162-infadoos found the door [he]162-infadoos could not break it down . [All the Kukuana army]4245-all the kukuana army could not break through five feet of living rock . [[My]0-i friends]3487-my friends , [I]0-i see nothing for it but to bow [ourselves]2326-we to the will of [the Almighty]4247-the almighty . The search for treasure has brought [many]3418-many to a bad end ; [we]2326-we shall go to swell [their]3418-many number . "[0-i]

The lamp grew dimmer yet .

Presently it flared up and showed the whole scene in strong relief , the great mass of white tusks , the boxes of gold , the corpse of [the poor Foulata]99-foulata stretched before [them]2338-them , the goat - skin full of treasure , the dim glimmer of the diamonds , and the wild , wan faces of [us]2339-we [three white men seated there awaiting death by starvation]2340-three white men seated there awaiting death by starvation .

Then the flame sank and expired .

CHAPTER XVIII

[WE]2339-we ABANDON HOPE

[I]0-i can give no adequate description of the horrors of the night which followed . Mercifully [they]2341-they were to some extent mitigated by sleep , for even in such a position as [ours]2339-we wearied nature will sometimes assert itself . But [I]0-i , at any rate , found it impossible to sleep much . Putting aside the terrifying thought of [our]2339-we impending doom - for [the bravest man on [earth]2307-earth]2342-the bravest man on earth might well quail from such a fate as awaited [us]2339-we , and [I]0-i never made any pretensions to be brave - the silence itself was too great to allow of it . [Reader]227-reader , [you]227-reader may have lain awake at night and thought the quiet oppressive , but [I]0-i say with confidence that [you]227-reader can have no idea what a vivid , tangible thing is perfect stillness . On the surface of [the earth]632-the earth there is always some sound or motion , and though it may in itself be imperceptible , yet it deadens the sharp edge of absolute silence . But here there was none . [We]2339-we were buried in the bowels of [a huge snow - clad peak]2345-a huge snow - clad peak . Thousands of feet above [us]2339-we the fresh air rushed over the white snow , but no sound of it reached [us]2339-we . [We]2339-we were separated by [a long tunnel]2346-a long tunnel and five feet of rock even from [the awful chamber of [the Dead]216-the white dead]2347-the awful chamber of the dead ; and the dead make no noise . Did [we]2339-we not know it who lay by poor [Foulata]99-foulata 's side ? The crashing of all the artillery of earth and heaven could not have come to [our]2339-we ears in [[our]2339-we living tomb]2348-our living tomb . [We]2339-we were cut off from every echo of [the world]248-the world - [we]2339-we were as [men already in the grave]2350-men already in the grave .

Then the irony of the situation forced itself upon [me]0-i . There around [us]2339-we lay treasures enough to pay off a moderate national debt , or to build [a fleet of ironclads]2351-a fleet of ironclads , and yet [we]2339-we would have bartered them all gladly for the faintest chance of escape . Soon , doubtless , [we]2339-we should be rejoiced to exchange [them]2352-them for a bit of food or a cup of water , and , after that , even for the privilege of a speedy close to [our]2339-we sufferings . Truly wealth , which [men]326-men spend [their]326-men lives in acquiring , is a valueless thing at the last .

And so the night wore on .

" Good , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's voice at last , and it sounded awful in the intense stillness , " how many matches have [you]98-good in the box ? "[97-sir henry]

" Eight , [Curtis]97-sir henry . "[97-sir henry]

" Strike one and let [us]2339-we see the time . "[97-sir henry]

[He]97-sir henry did so , and in contrast to the dense darkness the flame nearly blinded [us]2339-we . It was five o'clock by [my]0-i watch . The beautiful dawn was now blushing on the snow - wreaths far over [our]2339-we heads , and the breeze would be stirring the night mists in the hollows .

" [We]2339-we had better eat something and keep up [our]2339-we strength , "[0-i] [I]0-i suggested .

" What is the good of eating ? "[98-good] answered [Good]98-good ; " the sooner [we]2339-we die and get it over the better . "[98-good]

" While there is life there is hope , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry .

Accordingly [we]2339-we ate and sipped some water , and another period of time elapsed . Then [Sir Henry]97-sir henry suggested that it might be well to get as near the door as possible and halloa , on the faint chance of [somebody catching a sound outside]2354-somebody catching a sound outside . [Accordingly Good]98-good , who , from long practice at [sea]305-sea , has a fine piercing note , groped [his]98-good way down [the passage]2184-the passage and set to work . [I]0-i must say that [he]98-good made a most diabolical noise . [I]0-i never heard such yells ; but it might have been a mosquito buzzing for all the effect [they]2357-they produced .

After a while [he]98-good gave it up and came back very thirsty , and had to drink . Then [we]2339-we stopped yelling , as it encroached on the supply of water .

So [we]2339-we sat down once more against the chests of useless diamonds in that dreadful inaction which was one of the hardest circumstances of [our]2339-we fate ; and [I]0-i am bound to say that , for [my]0-i part , [I]0-i gave way in despair . Laying [my]0-i head against [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's broad shoulder [I]0-i burst into tears ; and [I]0-i think that [I]0-i heard [Good]98-good gulping away on the other side , and swearing hoarsely at [himself]98-good for doing so .

Ah , how good and brave [that great man]2358-that great man was ! Had [we]2339-we been [two frightened children]2359-two frightened children , and [he]2358-that great man [[our]2339-we nurse]2360-our nurse , [he]2358-that great man could not have treated [us]2339-we more tenderly . Forgetting [his]2358-that great man own share of miseries , [he]2358-that great man did all [he]2358-that great man could to soothe [our]2339-we broken nerves , telling stories of [men who had been in somewhat similar circumstances , and miraculously escaped]2361-men who had been in somewhat similar circumstances , and miraculously escaped ; and when these failed to cheer [us]2339-we , pointing out how , after all , it was only anticipating an end which must come to [us]2339-we all , that it would soon be over , and that death from exhaustion was a merciful one which is not true . Then , in a diffident sort of way , as once before [I]0-i had heard [him]2358-that great man do , [he]2358-that great man suggested that [we]2339-we should throw [ourselves]2339-we on the mercy of a higher Power , which for [my]0-i part [I]0-i did with great vigour .

[His]2358-that great man is a beautiful character , very quiet , but very strong .

And so somehow the day went as the night had gone , if , indeed , one can use these terms where all was densest night , and when [I]0-i lit a match to see the time it was seven o'clock .

Once more [we]2339-we ate and drank , and as [we]2339-we did so an idea occurred to [me]0-i .

" How is it , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " that the air in [this place]2838-this place keeps fresh ? It is thick and heavy , but it is perfectly fresh . "[0-i]

" Great heavens ! "[98-good] said [Good]98-good , starting up , " [I]98-good never thought of that . It ca n't come through the stone door , for it 's air - tight , if ever a door was . It must come from somewhere . It there were no current of air in [the place [we]2339-we should have been stifled or poisoned when [we]2339-we first came in]4250-the place we should have been stifled or poisoned when we first came in . Let [us]2339-we have a look . "[98-good]

It was wonderful what a change this mere spark of hope wrought in [us]2339-we . In a moment [we]2339-we were all three groping about on [our]2339-we hands and knees , feeling for the slightest indication of a draught . Presently [my]0-i ardour received a check . [I]0-i put [my]0-i hand on something cold . It was dead [Foulata]99-foulata 's face .

For an hour or more [we]2339-we went on feeling about , till at last [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [I]0-i gave it up in despair , having been considerably hurt by constantly knocking [our]2339-we heads against tusks , chests , and the sides of [the chamber]4078-the chamber . But [Good]98-good still persevered , saying , with an approach to cheerfulness , that it was better than doing nothing .

" [I]98-good say , [[you]2339-we fellows]3640-you fellows , "[98-good] [he]98-good said presently , in a constrained sort of voice , " come here . "[98-good]

Needless to say [we]2339-we scrambled towards [him]98-good quickly enough .

" [Quatermain]107-quatermain , put [your]107-quatermain hand here where [mine]98-good is . Now , do [you]107-quatermain feel anything ? "[98-good]

" [I]98-good think [I]98-good feel air coming up . "[98-good]

" Now listen . "[98-good] [He]98-good rose and stamped upon [the place]3034-the place , and a flame of hope shot up in [our]2339-we hearts . It rang hollow .

With trembling hands [I]0-i lit a match . [I]0-i had only three left , and [we]2339-we saw that [we]2339-we were in the angle of the far corner of [the chamber]4078-the chamber , a fact that accounted for [our]2339-we not having noticed the hollow sound of [the place]3034-the place during [our]2339-we former exhaustive examination . As the match burnt [we]2339-we scrutinised the spot . There was a join in the solid rock floor , and , great heavens ! there , let in level with the rock , was a stone ring . [We]2339-we said no word , [we]2339-we were too excited , and [our]2339-we hearts beat too wildly with hope to allow [us]2339-we to speak . [Good]493-good had a knife , at the back of which was one of those hooks that are made to extract stones from horses ' hoofs . [He]98-good opened it , and scratched round the ring with it . Finally [he]98-good worked it under , and levered away gently for fear of breaking the hook . The ring began to move . Being of stone it had not rusted fast in all the centuries it had lain there , as would have been the case had it been of iron . Presently it was upright . Then [he]98-good thrust [his]98-good hands into it and tugged with all [his]98-good force , but nothing budged .

" Let [me]0-i try , "[0-i] [I]0-i said impatiently , for the situation of the stone , right in the angle of the corner , was such that it was impossible for two to pull at once . [I]0-i took hold and strained away , but no results .

Then [Sir Henry]97-sir henry tried and failed .

Taking the hook again , Good scratched all round the crack where [we]2339-we felt the air coming up .

" Now , [Curtis]97-sir henry , "[98-good] [he]98-good said , " tackle on , and put [your]97-sir henry back into it ; [you]97-sir henry are as strong as two . Stop , "[98-good] and [he]98-good took off a stout black silk handkerchief , which , true to [his]98-good habits of neatness , [he]98-good still wore , and ran it through the ring . " [Quatermain]107-quatermain , get [Curtis]97-sir henry round the middle and pull for dear life when [I]98-good give the word . Now . "[98-good]

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry put out all [his]97-sir henry enormous strength , and [Good]98-good and [I]0-i did the same , with such power as nature had given [us]2339-we .

" Heave ! heave ! it 's giving , "[97-sir henry] gasped [Sir Henry]97-sir henry ; and [I]0-i heard the muscles of [his]97-sir henry great back cracking . Suddenly there was a grating sound , then a rush of air , and [we]2339-we were all on [our]2339-we backs on the floor with a heavy flag - stone upon the top of [us]2339-we . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's strength had done it , and never did muscular power stand [a man]2655-a man in better stead .

" Light a match , [Quatermain]107-quatermain , "[98-good] [he]98-good said , so soon as [we]2339-we had picked [ourselves]2339-we up and got [our]2339-we breath ; " carefully , now . "[98-good]

[I]0-i did so , and there before [us]2339-we , [Heaven]158-heaven be praised ! was the first step of a stone stair .

" Now what is to be done ? "[493-good] asked [Good]493-good .

" Follow [the stair]4252-the stair , of course , and trust to [Providence]228-providence . "[158-heaven]

" Stop ! "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry ; " [Quatermain]107-quatermain , get the bit of biltong and the water that are left ; [we]2339-we may want them . "[97-sir henry]

[I]0-i went , creeping back to [our]2339-we place by the chests for that purpose , and as [I]0-i was coming away an idea struck [me]0-i . [We]2339-we had not thought much of the diamonds for the last twenty - four hours or so ; indeed , the very idea of diamonds was nauseous , seeing what they had entailed upon [us]2339-we ; but , reflected [I]0-i , [I]0-i may as well pocket some in case [we]2339-we ever should get out of this ghastly hole . So [I]0-i just put [my]0-i fist into the first chest and filled all the available pockets of [my]0-i old shooting - coat and trousers , topping up - this was a happy thought - with a few handfuls of big ones from the third chest . Also , by an afterthought , [I]0-i stuffed [Foulata]99-foulata 's basket , which , except for one water - gourd and a little biltong , was empty now , with great quantities of the stones .

" [I]0-i say , [[you]107-quatermain fellows]3640-you fellows , "[0-i] [I]0-i sang out , " wo n't [you]107-quatermain take some diamonds with [you]107-quatermain ? [I]0-i 've filled [my]0-i pockets and the basket . "[0-i]

" Oh , come on , [Quatermain]107-quatermain ! and hang the diamonds ! "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry . " [I]97-sir henry hope that [I]97-sir henry may never see another . "[97-sir henry]

As for Good , [he]97-sir henry made no answer . [He]97-sir henry was , [I]0-i think , taking [his]97-sir henry last farewell of all that was left of [the poor girl who had loved [him]97-sir henry so well]2369-the poor girl who had loved him so well . And curious as it may seem to [you]2370-you , [[my]0-i reader]2371-my reader , sitting at [home]2616-home at ease and reflecting on the vast , indeed the immeasurable , wealth which [we]2373-we were thus abandoning , [I]0-i can assure [you]2370-you that if [you]2370-you had passed some twenty - eight hours with next to nothing to eat and drink in [that place]638-that place , [you]2370-you would not have cared to cumber [yourself]2370-you with diamonds whilst plunging down into the unknown bowels of [the earth]632-the earth , in the wild hope of escape from an agonising death . If from the habits of a lifetime , it had not become a sort of second nature with [me]0-i never to leave anything worth having behind if there was the slightest chance of [my]0-i being able to carry it away , [I]0-i am sure that [I]0-i should not have bothered to fill [my]0-i pockets and that basket .

" Come on , [Quatermain]107-quatermain , "[2376-sir henry , who was already standing on the first step of the stone stair] repeated [Sir Henry , who was already standing on the first step of the stone stair]2376-sir henry , who was already standing on the first step of the stone stair . " Steady , [I]2376-sir henry , who was already standing on the first step of the stone stair will go first . "[2376-sir henry , who was already standing on the first step of the stone stair]

" Mind where [you]2376-sir henry , who was already standing on the first step of the stone stair put [your]2370-you feet , there may be some awful hole underneath , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered .

" Much more likely to be [another room]4254-another room , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , while [he]97-sir henry descended slowly , counting the steps as [he]97-sir henry went .

When [he]97-sir henry got to " fifteen "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry stopped . " Here 's the bottom , "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry said . " Thank goodness ! [I]97-sir henry think it 's [a passage]4255-a passage . Follow [me]97-sir henry down . "[97-sir henry]

[Good]98-good went next , and [I]0-i came last , carrying the basket , and on reaching the bottom lit one of the two remaining matches . By its light [we]2377-we could just see that [we]2377-we were standing in [a narrow tunnel]2378-a narrow tunnel , which ran right and left at right angles to [the staircase [we]2377-we had descended]2379-the staircase we had descended . Before [we]2377-we could make out any more , the match burnt [my]0-i fingers and went out . Then arose the delicate question of which way to go . Of course , it was impossible to know what [the tunnel]936-the tunnel was , or where [it]936-the tunnel led to , and yet to turn one way might lead [us]2377-we to safety , and the other to destruction . [We]2377-we were utterly perplexed , till suddenly it struck [Good]98-good that when [I]0-i had lit the match the draught of [the passage]2184-the passage blew the flame to the left .

" Let [us]2377-we go against the draught , "[98-good] [he]98-good said ; " air draws inwards , not outwards . "[98-good]

[We]2377-we took this suggestion , and feeling along the wall with [our]2377-we hands , whilst trying the ground before [us]2377-we at every step , [we]2377-we departed from [that accursed treasure chamber on [our]2377-we terrible quest for life]2382-that accursed treasure chamber on our terrible quest for life . If ever it should be entered again by [living man]3922-living man , which [I]0-i do not think probable , [he]3922-living man will find tokens of [our]2377-we visit in the open chests of jewels , the empty lamp , and the white bones of [poor Foulata]99-foulata .

When [we]2377-we had groped [our]2377-we way for about a quarter of an hour along [the passage]2184-the passage , suddenly it took a sharp turn , or else was bisected by another , which [we]2377-we followed , only in course of time to be led into a third . And so it went on for some hours . [We]2377-we seemed to be in a stone labyrinth that led nowhere . What all [these passages]2385-these passages are , of course [I]0-i can not say , but [we]2377-we thought that [they]2385-these passages must be [the ancient workings of [a mine]2387-a mine]2386-the ancient workings of a mine , of which the various shafts and adits travelled hither and thither as the ore led [them]2385-these passages . This is the only way in which [we]2377-we could account for such a multitude of galleries .

At length [we]2377-we halted , thoroughly worn out with fatigue and with that hope deferred which maketh the heart sick , and ate up [our]2377-we poor remaining piece of biltong and drank [our]2377-we last sup of water , for [our]2377-we throats were like lime - kilns . It seemed to [us]2377-we that [we]2377-we had escaped [Death]152-death in the darkness of [the treasure chamber]2313-the treasure chamber only to meet [him]152-death in the darkness of [the tunnels]2389-the tunnels .

As [we]2377-we stood , once more utterly depressed , [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i caught a sound , to which [I]0-i called the attention of [the others]595-the others . It was very faint and very far off , but it was a sound , a faint , murmuring sound , for [the others]595-the others heard it too , and no words can describe the blessedness of it after all those hours of utter , awful stillness .

" By heaven ! it 's running water , "[98-good] said [Good]98-good . " Come on . "[98-good]

Off [we]2377-we started again in the direction from which the faint murmur seemed to come , groping [our]2377-we way as before along the rocky walls . [I]0-i remember that [I]0-i laid down the basket full of diamonds , wishing to be rid of its weight , but on second thoughts took it up again . [One]337-one might as well die rich as poor , [I]0-i reflected . As [we]2377-we went the sound became more and more audible , till at last it seemed quite loud in the quiet . On , yet on ; now [we]2377-we could distinctly make out the unmistakable swirl of rushing water . And yet how could there be running water in [the bowels of [the earth]632-the earth]2393-the bowels of the earth ? Now [we]2377-we were quite near [it]2395-it , and [Good , who was leading]2396-good , who was leading , swore that [he]2396-good , who was leading could smell it .

" Go gently , [Good]493-good , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , " [we]2377-we must be close . "[97-sir henry] Splash ! and a cry from [Good]98-good .

[He]98-good had fallen in .

" Good ! Good ! where are [you]98-good ? "[2377-we] [we]2377-we shouted , in terrified distress . To [our]2377-we intense relief an answer came back in a choky voice .

" All right ; [I]98-good 've got hold of a rock . Strike a light to show [me]98-good where [you]98-good are . "[98-good]

Hastily [I]0-i lit the last remaining match . Its faint gleam discovered to [us]2377-we a dark mass of water running at [our]2377-we feet . How wide it was [we]2377-we could not see , but there , some way out , was the dark form of [[our]2377-we companion]2397-our companion hanging on to a projecting rock .

" Stand clear to catch [me]98-good , "[98-good] sung out [Good]98-good . " [I]98-good must swim for it . "[98-good]

Then [we]2377-we heard a splash , and a great struggle . Another minute and [he]98-good had grabbed at and caught [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's outstretched hand , and [we]2377-we had pulled [him]98-good up high and dry into [the tunnel]936-the tunnel .

" [My]98-good word ! "[98-good] [he]98-good said , between [his]98-good gasps , " that was touch and go . If [I]98-good had n't managed to catch that rock , and known how to swim , [I]98-good should have been done . It runs like a mill - race , and [I]98-good could feel no bottom . "[98-good]

[We]2377-we dared not follow [the banks of [the subterranean river]2400-the subterranean river]2399-the banks of the subterranean river for fear lest [we]2377-we should fall into [it]2400-the subterranean river again in the darkness . So after [Good]98-good had rested a while , and [we]2377-we had drunk [our]2377-we fill of the water , which was sweet and fresh , and washed [our]2377-we faces , that needed it sadly , as well as [we]2377-we could , [we]2377-we started from [the banks of [this African Styx]2402-this african styx]2401-the banks of this african styx , and began to retrace [our]2377-we steps along [the tunnel]936-the tunnel , [Good]98-good dripping unpleasantly in front of [us]2377-we . At length [we]2377-we came to [another gallery leading to [our]2377-we right]2404-another gallery leading to our right .

" [We]2377-we may as well take it , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry wearily ; " all [roads]4257-roads are alike here ; [we]2377-we can only go on till [we]2377-we drop . "[97-sir henry]

Slowly , for a long , long while , [we]2377-we stumbled , utterly exhausted , along [this new tunnel]2405-this new tunnel , [Sir Henry]97-sir henry now leading the way . Again [I]0-i thought of abandoning that basket , but did not .

Suddenly [he]97-sir henry stopped , and [we]2377-we bumped up against [him]97-sir henry .

" Look ! "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry whispered , " is [my]97-sir henry brain going , or is that light ? "[97-sir henry]

[We]2377-we stared with all [our]2377-we eyes , and there , yes , there , far ahead of [us]2377-we , was a faint , glimmering spot , no larger than a cottage window pane . It was so faint that [I]0-i doubt if any eyes , except those which , like [ours]2377-we , had for days seen nothing but blackness , could have perceived it at all .

With a gasp of hope [we]2377-we pushed on . In five minutes there was no longer any doubt ; it was a patch of faint light . A minute more and a breath of real live air was fanning [us]2377-we . On [we]2377-we struggled . All at once [the tunnel]936-the tunnel narrowed . [Sir Henry]97-sir henry went on [his]97-sir henry knees . Smaller yet it grew , till it was only the size of a large fox 's earth - it was earth now , mind [you]2407-you ; [the rock]2408-the rock had ceased .

A squeeze , a struggle , and [Sir Henry]97-sir henry was out , and so was Good , and so was [I]0-i , dragging [Foulata]99-foulata 's basket after [me]0-i ; and there above [us]2377-we were the blessed stars , and in [our]2377-we nostrils was the sweet air . Then suddenly something gave , and [we]2377-we were all rolling over and over and over through grass and bushes and soft , wet soil .

The basket caught in something and [I]0-i stopped . Sitting up [I]0-i halloed lustily . An answering shout came from below , where [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's wild career had been checked by some level ground . [I]0-i scrambled to [him]97-sir henry , and found [him]97-sir henry unhurt , though breathless . Then [we]2377-we looked for Good . A little way off [we]2377-we discovered [him]97-sir henry also , hammed in a forked root . [He]97-sir henry was a good deal knocked about , but soon came to [himself]97-sir henry .

[We]2377-we sat down together , there on the grass , and the revulsion of feeling was so great that really [I]0-i think [we]2377-we cried with joy . [We]2377-we had escaped from that awful dungeon , which was so near to becoming [[our]2377-we grave]2409-our grave . Surely some merciful Power guided [our]2377-we footsteps to [the jackal hole]2410-the jackal hole , for that is what it must have been , at the termination of [the tunnel]936-the tunnel . And see , yonder on [the mountains]2771-the mountains the dawn [we]2377-we had never thought to look upon again was blushing rosy red .

Presently the grey light stole down [the slopes]2413-the slopes , and [we]2377-we saw that [we]2377-we were at the bottom , or rather , nearly at the bottom , of [the vast pit in front of the entrance to [the cave]3037-the cave]2414-the vast pit in front of the entrance to the cave . Now [we]2377-we could make out the dim forms of [the three Colossi who sat upon [its]2417-its verge]2416-the three colossi who sat upon its verge . Doubtless those awful passages , along which [we]2377-we had wandered the livelong night , had been originally in some way connected with [the great diamond mine]2418-the great diamond mine . As for [the subterranean river in the bowels of [the mountain]659-the mountain]2419-the subterranean river in the bowels of the mountain , [Heaven]158-heaven only knows what it is , or whence it flows , or whither it goes . [I]0-i , for one , have no anxiety to trace its course .

Lighter it grew , and lighter yet . [We]2377-we could see [each other]373-each other now , and such a spectacle as [we]2377-we presented [I]0-i have never set eyes on before or since . [Gaunt - cheeked , hollow - eyed wretches , smeared all over with dust and mud , bruised , bleeding]2422-gaunt - cheeked , hollow - eyed wretches , smeared all over with dust and mud , bruised , bleeding , the long fear of imminent death yet written on [our]2377-we countenances , [we]2377-we were , indeed , a sight to frighten the daylight . And yet it is a solemn fact that [Good]98-good 's eye - glass was still fixed in [Good]98-good 's eye . [I]0-i doubt whether [he]98-good had ever taken it out at all . Neither the darkness , nor the plunge in [the subterranean river]2400-the subterranean river , nor the roll down [the slope]2424-the slope , had been able to separate [Good]98-good and [his]98-good eye - glass .

Presently [we]2377-we rose , fearing that [our]2377-we limbs would stiffen if [we]2377-we stopped there longer , and commenced with slow and painful steps to struggle up the sloping sides of [the great pit]2425-the great pit . For an hour or more [we]2377-we toiled steadfastly up the blue clay , dragging [ourselves]2377-we on by the help of the roots and grasses with which it was clothed . But now [I]0-i had no more thought of leaving the basket ; indeed , nothing but death should have parted [us]2377-we .

At last it was done , and [we]2377-we stood by [the great road]3117-the great road , on that side of [the pit which is opposite to [the Colossi]2428-the colossi]2427-the pit which is opposite to the colossi .

At the side of [the road]2952-the road , a hundred yards off , a fire was burning in front of [some huts]2430-some huts , and round the fire were [figures]2431-figures . [We]2377-we staggered towards [them]2431-figures , supporting [one another]620-one another , and halting every few paces . Presently one of [the figures]2433-the figures rose , saw [us]2377-we and fell on to the ground , crying out for fear .

" Infadoos , [Infadoos]162-infadoos ! it is [we]2377-we , [[thy]2434-he friends]4258-thy friends . "[2434-he]

[He]2434-he rose ; [he]2434-he ran to [us]2377-we , staring wildly , and still shaking with fear .

" Oh , [[my]2434-he lords]3091-my lords , [[my]2434-he lords]3091-my lords , it is indeed [you]3091-my lords come back from the dead ! - come back from the dead ! "[2434-he]

And [the old warrior]2435-the old warrior flung [himself]2435-the old warrior down before [us]2377-we , and clasping [Sir Henry]97-sir henry 's knees , [he]2435-the old warrior wept aloud for joy .

CHAPTER XIX

IGNOSI 'S FAREWELL

Ten days from that eventful morning found [us]2377-we once more in [[our]2377-we old quarters at [Loo]3-loo]2436-our old quarters at loo ; and , strange to say , but little the worse for [our]2377-we terrible experience , except that [my]0-i stubbly hair came out of [the treasure cave]2437-the treasure cave about three shades greyer than it went in , and that Good never was quite the same after [Foulata]99-foulata 's death , which seemed to move [him]2434-he very greatly . [I]0-i am bound to say , looking at the thing from the point of view of [an oldish man of [the world]248-the world]2438-an oldish man of the world , that [I]0-i consider [her]99-foulata removal was a fortunate occurrence , since , otherwise , complications would have been sure to ensue . [The poor creature]1000-the poor creature was [no ordinary native girl]2441-no ordinary native girl , but [a person of great ,]2442-a person of great , [I]0-i had almost said stately , beauty , and of considerable refinement of mind . But no amount of beauty or refinement could have made an entanglement between [Good]98-good and [herself]98-good a desirable occurrence ; for , as [she]99-foulata [herself]99-foulata put it , " Can the sun mate with the darkness , or the white with the black ? "[99-foulata]

[I]0-i need hardly state that [we]2377-we never again penetrated into [[Solomon]222-solomon 's treasure chamber]2798-solomon 's treasure chamber . After [we]2377-we had recovered from [our]2377-we fatigues , a process which took [us]2377-we forty - eight hours , [we]2377-we descended into the great pit in the hope of finding [the hole by which [we]2377-we had crept out of [the mountain]659-the mountain]2444-the hole by which we had crept out of the mountain , but with no success . To begin with , rain had fallen , and obliterated [our]2377-we spoor ; and what is more , the sides of [the vast pit]2446-the vast pit were full of ant - bear and other holes . It was impossible to say to which of these [we]2377-we owed [our]2377-we salvation . Also , on the day before [we]2377-we started back to [Loo]3-loo , [we]2377-we made a further examination of the wonders of [the stalactite cave]250-the stalactite cave , and , drawn by a kind of restless feeling , even penetrated once more into [the Chamber of [the Dead]4156-the dead]2448-the chamber of the dead .
