Passing beneath the spear of the White Death [we]2377-we gazed , with sensations which it would be quite impossible for [me]0-i to describe , at the mass of rock that had shut [us]2377-we off from escape , thinking the while of priceless treasures beyond , of [the mysterious old hag whose flattened fragments lay crushed beneath it]2450-the mysterious old hag whose flattened fragments lay crushed beneath it , and of [the fair girl of whose tomb it was the portal]2451-the fair girl of whose tomb it was the portal . [I]0-i say gazed at the " rock , "[0-i] for , examine as [we]2377-we could , [we]2377-we could find no traces of the join of the sliding door ; nor , indeed , could [we]2377-we hit upon the secret , now utterly lost , that worked it , though [we]2377-we tried for an hour or more . It is certainly a marvellous bit of mechanism , characteristic , in [its]2452-its massive and yet inscrutable simplicity , of the age which produced it ; and [I]0-i doubt if [the world]248-the world has such another to show .

At last [we]2377-we gave it up in disgust ; though , if the mass had suddenly risen before [our]2377-we eyes , [I]0-i doubt if [we]2377-we should have screwed up courage to step over [Gagool]122-gagool 's mangled remains , and once more enter [the treasure chamber]2313-the treasure chamber , even in the sure and certain hope of unlimited diamonds . And yet [I]0-i could have cried at the idea of leaving all that treasure , the biggest treasure probably that in [the world]248-the world 's history has ever been accumulated in one spot . But there was no help for it . Only dynamite could force its way through five feet of solid rock .

So [we]2377-we left it . Perhaps , in some remote unborn century , [a more fortunate explorer]2456-a more fortunate explorer may hit upon [the " Open Sesame]4261-the " open sesame , "[0-i] and flood [the world]248-the world with gems . But , [myself]0-i , [I]0-i doubt it . Somehow , [I]0-i seem to feel that the tens of millions of pounds ' worth of jewels which lie in the three stone coffers will never shine round the neck of an earthly beauty . [They]2458-they and [Foulata]99-foulata 's bones will keep cold company till the end of all things .

With a sigh of disappointment [we]2377-we made [our]2377-we way back , and next day started for Loo . And yet it was really very ungrateful of [us]2377-we to be disappointed ; for , as [the reader]502-the reader will remember , by a lucky thought , [I]0-i had taken the precaution to fill the wide pockets of [my]0-i old shooting coat and trousers with gems before [we]2377-we left [[our]2377-we prison - house]2335-our prison - house , also [Foulata]99-foulata 's basket , which held twice as many more , notwithstanding that the water bottle had occupied some of [its]2461-its space . A good many of these fell out in the course of [our]2377-we roll down the side of the pit , including several of the big ones , which [I]0-i had crammed in on the top in [my]0-i coat pockets . But , comparatively speaking , an enormous quantity still remained , including ninety - three large stones ranging from over two hundred to seventy carats in weight . [My]0-i old shooting coat and the basket still held sufficient treasure to make [us]2377-we all , if not [millionaires]2462-millionaires as the term is understood in [America]80-america , at least exceedingly [wealthy men]2463-wealthy men , and yet to keep enough stones each to make the three finest sets of gems in [Europe]81-europe . So [we]2377-we had not done so badly .

On arriving at [Loo]3-loo [we]2377-we were most cordially received by [Ignosi]169-ignosi , whom [we]2377-we found well , and busily engaged in consolidating [his]169-ignosi power , and reorganising [the regiments which had suffered most in the great struggle with [Twala]64-twala]2464-the regiments which had suffered most in the great struggle with twala .

[He]169-ignosi listened with intense interest to [our]2377-we wonderful story ; but when [we]2377-we told [him]169-ignosi of old [Gagool]122-gagool 's frightful end [he]169-ignosi grew thoughtful .

" Come hither , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi called , to [a very old Induna or councillor]2465-a very old induna or councillor , who was sitting with others in a circle round [the king]2791-the king , but out of ear - shot . [The ancient man]2467-the ancient man rose , approached , saluted , and seated [himself]2467-the ancient man .

" [Thou]2791-the king art aged , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi .

" Ay , [[my]2467-the ancient man lord [the king]2791-the king]3188-my lord the king ! [[[Thy]2791-the king father]4264-thy father 's father]4265-thy father 's father and [I]2467-the ancient man were born on the same day . "[2467-the ancient man]

" Tell [me]2467-the ancient man , when [thou]2791-the king wast little , didst [thou]2791-the king know [Gagaoola]100-gagaoola [the witch doctress]3399-the witch doctress ? "[2467-the ancient man]

" Ay , [[my]2467-the ancient man lord [the king]2791-the king]3188-my lord the king ! "[2467-the ancient man]

" How was [she]100-gagaoola then - young , like [thee]2791-the king ? "[2467-the ancient man]

" Not so , [[my]2467-the ancient man lord]3088-my lord [the king]2791-the king ! [She]100-gagaoola was even as [she]100-gagaoola is now and as [she]100-gagaoola was in the days of [[my]2467-the ancient man great grandfather]4271-my great grandfather before [me]2467-the ancient man ; old and dried , very ugly , and full of wickedness . "[2467-the ancient man]

" [She]100-gagaoola is no more ; [she]100-gagaoola is dead . "[2467-the ancient man]

" So , [O king]3343-o king ! then is an ancient curse taken from [the land]3165-the land . "[2467-the ancient man]

" Go ! "[2467-the ancient man]

" [Koom]167-koom ! [I]2467-the ancient man go , [Black Puppy]229-black puppy , who tore out the old dog 's throat . [Koom]167-koom ! "[2467-the ancient man]

" [Ye]2791-the king see , [[my]169-ignosi brothers]3621-my brothers , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi , " this was [a strange woman]4275-a strange woman , and [I]169-ignosi rejoice that [she]100-gagaoola is dead . [She]100-gagaoola would have let [you]2791-the king die in [the dark place]4276-the dark place , and mayhap afterwards [she]100-gagaoola had found a way to slay [me]169-ignosi , as [she]100-gagaoola found a way to slay [[my]169-ignosi father]2882-my father , and set up [Twala]165-twala , whom [her]100-gagaoola black heart loved , in [his]165-twala place . Now go on with the tale ; surely there never was its like ! "[169-ignosi]

After [I]0-i had narrated all the story of [our]2468-us escape , as [we]2468-us had agreed between [ourselves]2468-us that [I]0-i should , [I]0-i took the opportunity to address [Ignosi]169-ignosi as to [our]2468-us departure from [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland .

" And now , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " the time has come for [us]2468-us to bid [thee]169-ignosi farewell , and start to see [[our]2468-us own land]4278-our own land once more . Behold , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [thou]169-ignosi camest with [us]2468-us [a servant]3465-a servant , and now [we]2468-us leave [thee]169-ignosi [a mighty king]4280-a mighty king . If [thou]169-ignosi art grateful to [us]2468-us , remember to do even as [thou]169-ignosi didst promise : to rule justly , to respect the law , and to put [none to death]4281-none to death without a cause . So shalt [thou]169-ignosi prosper . To - morrow , at break of day , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [thou]169-ignosi wilt give [us]2468-us an escort who shall lead [us]2468-us across [the mountains]2771-the mountains . Is it not so , [O king]3343-o king ? "[0-i]

[Ignosi]169-ignosi covered [his]169-ignosi face with [his]169-ignosi hands for a while before answering .

" [My]169-ignosi heart is sore , "[169-ignosi] [he]169-ignosi said at last ; " [your]169-ignosi words split [my]169-ignosi heart in twain . What have [I]169-ignosi done to [you]169-ignosi , [Incubu]150-incubu , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , and [Bougwan]144-bougwan , that [ye]169-ignosi should leave [me]169-ignosi desolate ? [[Ye]169-ignosi who stood by [me]169-ignosi in rebellion and in battle]4284-ye who stood by me in rebellion and in battle , will [ye]169-ignosi leave [me]169-ignosi in the day of peace and victory ? What will [ye]169-ignosi - [wives]3706-wives ? Choose from among [the maidens]4286-the maidens ! A place to live in ? Behold , [the land]3165-the land is [yours]169-ignosi as far as [ye]169-ignosi can see . [[The white man]243-the white man 's houses]4289-the white man 's houses ? [Ye]169-ignosi shall teach [[my]169-ignosi people]3730-my people how to build [them]4289-the white man 's houses . Cattle for beef and milk ? [Every married man]4291-every married man shall bring [you]169-ignosi an ox or a cow . Wild game to hunt ? Does not the elephant walk through [[my]169-ignosi forests]4292-my forests , and the river - horse sleep in the reeds ? Would [ye]169-ignosi make war ? [[My]169-ignosi Impis]4293-my impis wait [your]169-ignosi word . If there is anything more which [I]169-ignosi can give , that will [I]169-ignosi give [you]169-ignosi . "[169-ignosi]

" Nay , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , [we]4294-we want none of these things , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered ; " [we]4294-we would seek [[our]4294-we own place]4295-our own place . "[0-i]

" Now do [I]169-ignosi learn , "[169-ignosi] said [Ignosi]169-ignosi bitterly , and with flashing eyes , " that [ye]169-ignosi love the bright stones more than [me]169-ignosi , [[your]169-ignosi friend]4296-your friend . [Ye]169-ignosi have the stones ; now [ye]169-ignosi would go to [Natal]12-natal and across [the moving black water]4297-the moving black water and sell them , and be rich , as it is the desire of [a white man]662-a white man 's heart to be . Cursed for [your]169-ignosi sake be the white stones , and cursed [he]662-a white man who seeks them . Death shall it be to [him]662-a white man who sets foot in [the place of Death]4061-the place of death to find [them]4300-them . [I]169-ignosi have spoken . [White men]2713-white men , [ye]169-ignosi can go . "[169-ignosi]

[I]0-i laid [my]0-i hand upon [his]169-ignosi arm . " [Ignosi]169-ignosi , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " tell [us]2713-white men , when [thou]4302-thou didst wander in [Zululand]4-zululand , and among [the white people of [Natal]12-natal]4303-the white people of natal , did not thine heart turn to [the land [[thy]4302-thou mother]4305-thy mother told [thee]4302-thou of , [[thy]4302-thou native place]4306-thy native place , where [thou]4302-thou didst see the light , and play when [thou]4302-thou wast little , [the land where [thy]4302-thou place was]4307-the land where thy place was]4304-the land thy mother told thee of , thy native place , where thou didst see the light , and play when thou wast little , the land where thy place was ? "[0-i]

" It was even so , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn . "[0-i]

" In like manner , [Ignosi]169-ignosi , do [our]2713-white men hearts turn to [[our]2713-white men land]3713-our land and to [[our]2713-white men own place]4295-our own place . "[0-i]

Then came a silence . When [Ignosi]169-ignosi broke it , it was in a different voice .

" [I]0-i do perceive that now as ever [thy]0-i words are wise and full of reason , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn ; that which flies in the air loves not to run along the ground ; [the white man]243-the white man loves not to live on the level of the black or to house among [his]243-the white man kraals . Well , [ye]0-i must go , and leave [my]0-i heart sore , because [ye]0-i will be as dead to [me]0-i , since from where [ye]0-i are no tidings can come to [me]0-i .[0-i]

" But listen , and let all [[your]0-i brothers]4311-your brothers know [my]0-i words . [No other white man]4312-no other white man shall cross [the mountains]2771-the mountains , even if [any man]4314-any man live to come so far . [I]0-i will see [no traders]4315-no traders with [their]4315-no traders guns and gin . [[My]0-i people]3730-my people shall fight with the spear , and drink water , like [[their]3730-my people forefathers before [them]3730-my people]4317-their forefathers before them . [I]0-i will have [no praying - men]4318-no praying - men to put a fear of death into [men]326-men 's hearts , to stir [them]326-men up against the law of [the king]2791-the king , and make a path for [the white folk who follow to run on]4321-the white folk who follow to run on . If [a white man]662-a white man comes to [[my]0-i gates]4323-my gates [I]0-i will send [him]662-a white man back ; if [a hundred]4324-a hundred come [I]0-i will push [them]4324-a hundred back ; if armies come , [I]0-i will make war on [them]4324-a hundred with all [my]0-i strength , and [they]4324-a hundred shall not prevail against [me]0-i . [None]2774-none shall ever seek for the shining stones : no , not an army , for if [they]4324-a hundred come [I]0-i will send [a regiment]1750-a regiment and fill up the pit , and break down the white columns in [the caves]4327-the caves and choke [them]4327-the caves with rocks , so that none can reach even to that door of which [ye]4328-ye speak , and whereof the way to move it is lost . But for [you]4328-ye three , [Incubu]150-incubu , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , and [Bougwan]144-bougwan , the path is always open ; for , behold , [ye]4328-ye are dearer to [me]0-i than aught that breathes .[0-i]

" And [ye]4328-ye would go . Infadoos , [[my]169-ignosi uncle]3102-my uncle , and [[my]169-ignosi Induna]4330-my induna , shall take [you]4328-ye by the hand and guide [you]4328-ye with [a regiment]1750-a regiment . There is , as [I]169-ignosi have learned , another way across [the mountains]2771-the mountains that [he]0-i shall show [you]4328-ye . Farewell , [[my]169-ignosi brothers]3621-my brothers , [brave white men]3908-brave white men . See [me]169-ignosi no more , for [I]169-ignosi have no heart to bear it . Behold ! [I]169-ignosi make a decree , and it shall be published from [the mountains]2771-the mountains to [the mountains]2771-the mountains ; [your]4328-ye names , [Incubu]150-incubu , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , and [Bougwan]144-bougwan , shall be "[169-ignosi] hlonipa " even as the names of [dead kings]4337-dead kings , and [he]0-i who speaks [them]4337-dead kings shall die . 1 So shall [your]4328-ye memory be preserved in [the land]3165-the land for ever .[169-ignosi]

" Go now , ere [my]169-ignosi eyes rain tears like [a woman]272-a woman 's . At times as [ye]4328-ye look back down the path of life , or when [ye]4328-ye are old and gather [yourselves]4328-ye together to crouch before the fire , because for [you]4328-ye the sun has no more heat , [ye]4328-ye will think of how [we]4340-we stood shoulder to shoulder , in that great battle which [thy]4328-ye wise words planned , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn ; of how [thou]4328-ye wast the point of the horn that galled [Twala]165-twala 's flank , [Bougwan]144-bougwan ; whilst [thou]4328-ye stood in the ring of the Greys , Incubu , and [men]326-men went down before thine axe like corn before a sickle ; ay , and of how [thou]4328-ye didst break that wild bull [Twala]165-twala 's strength , and bring [his]165-twala pride to dust . Fare [ye]4328-ye well for ever , [Incubu]150-incubu , [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , and [Bougwan]144-bougwan , [[my]169-ignosi lords]3091-my lords and [[my]169-ignosi friends]3487-my friends . "[169-ignosi]

[Ignosi]169-ignosi rose and looked earnestly at [us]2469-us for a few seconds . Then [he]169-ignosi threw the corner of [his]169-ignosi karross over [his]169-ignosi head , so as to cover [his]169-ignosi face from [us]2469-us .

[We]2469-us went in silence .

Next day at dawn [we]2469-us left [Loo]3-loo , escorted by [[our]2469-us old friend]2470-our old friend [Infadoos]162-infadoos , who was heart - broken at [our]2469-us departure , and by [the regiment of [Buffaloes]194-the buffaloes]2471-the regiment of buffaloes . Early as was the hour , all [the main street of [the town]1164-the town]2472-the main street of the town was lined with multitudes of [people]1237-people , who gave [us]2469-us the royal salute as [we]2469-us passed at the head of [the regiment]1853-the regiment , while [the women]1414-the women blessed [us]2469-us for having rid [the land of]2477-the land of [Twala]165-twala , throwing flowers before [us]2469-us as [we]2469-us went . It was really very affecting , and not the sort of thing [one]337-one is accustomed to meet with from [natives]661-natives .

One ludicrous incident occurred , however , which [I]0-i rather welcomed , as it gave [us]2469-us something to laugh at .

Just before [we]2469-us reached [the confines of [the town]1164-the town]2480-the confines of the town , [a pretty young girl]2482-a pretty young girl , with some lovely lilies in [her]2482-a pretty young girl hand , ran forward and presented them to [Good]98-good - somehow [they]2483-them all seemed to like Good ; [I]0-i think [his]2484-his eye - glass and solitary whisker gave [him]2484-his a fictitious value - and then said that [she]2482-a pretty young girl had a boon to ask .

" Speak on , "[2484-his] [he]2484-his answered .

" Let [[my]2482-a pretty young girl lord]3088-my lord show [[his]3088-my lord servant]4345-his servant [his]3088-my lord beautiful white legs , that [[his]3088-my lord servant]4345-his servant may look upon them , and remember [them]2483-them all [her]4345-his servant days , and tell of them to [[her]4345-his servant children]4347-her children ; [[his]3088-my lord servant]4345-his servant has travelled four days ' journey to see [them]2483-them , for the fame of [them]2483-them has gone throughout [the land]3165-the land . "[2482-a pretty young girl]

" [I]2485-good excitedly 'll be hanged if [I]2485-good excitedly do ! "[2485-good excitedly] exclaimed [Good excitedly]2485-good excitedly .

" Come , come , [[my]97-sir henry dear fellow]4350-my dear fellow , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , " [you]4350-my dear fellow ca n't refuse to oblige [a lady]4351-a lady . "[97-sir henry]

" [I]98-good wo n't , "[98-good] replied [Good]98-good obstinately ; " it is positively indecent . "[98-good]

However , in the end [he]98-good consented to draw up [his]98-good trousers to the knee , amidst notes of rapturous admiration from all [the women present]2486-the women present , especially [the gratified young lady]2487-the gratified young lady , and in this guise [he]98-good had to walk till [we]2488-we got clear of [the town]1164-the town .

[Good]98-good 's legs , [I]0-i fear , will never be so greatly admired again . Of [his]98-good melting teeth , and even of [his]98-good " transparent eye , "[93-the kukuanas] [the Kukuanas]93-the kukuanas wearied more or less , but of [his]98-good legs never .

As [we]2488-we travelled , [Infadoos]162-infadoos told [us]2488-we that there was another pass over the mountains to the north of [the one followed by [Solomon 's Great Road]68-solomon 's great road]2490-the one followed by solomon 's great road , or rather that there was a place where it was possible to climb down the wall of cliff which separates [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland from [the desert]2742-the desert , and is broken by the towering shapes of [[Sheba]121-sheba 's Breasts]2788-sheba 's breasts . It appeared , also , that rather more than two years previously [a party of [Kukuana hunters]2494-kukuana hunters]2493-a party of kukuana hunters had descended this path into [the desert]2742-the desert in search of ostriches , whose plumes are much prized among [them]2493-a party of kukuana hunters for war head - dresses , and that in the course of [their]2493-a party of kukuana hunters hunt [they]2493-a party of kukuana hunters had been led far from [the mountains]2771-the mountains and were much troubled by thirst . Seeing trees on the horizon , however , [they]2493-a party of kukuana hunters walked towards [them]2493-a party of kukuana hunters , and discovered [a large and fertile oasis some miles in extent]2497-a large and fertile oasis some miles in extent , and plentifully watered . It was by way of [this oasis]2498-this oasis that [Infadoos]162-infadoos suggested [we]2488-we should return , and the idea seemed to [us]2488-we a good one , for it appeared that [we]2488-we should thus escape the rigours of [the mountain pass]2499-the mountain pass . Also [some of [the hunters]2501-the hunters]2500-some of the hunters were in attendance to guide [us]2488-we to [the oasis]2502-the oasis , from which , [they]2500-some of the hunters stated , [they]2500-some of the hunters could perceive [other fertile spots far away in [the desert]2742-the desert]2503-other fertile spots far away in the desert . 2

Travelling easily , on the night of the fourth day 's journey [we]2488-we found [ourselves]2488-we once more on the crest of [the mountains that separate [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland]2505-the mountains that separate kukuanaland from [the desert]2742-the desert , which rolled away in sandy billows at [our]2488-we feet , and about twenty - five miles to [the north of [Sheba 's Breasts]61-sheba 's breasts]2507-the north of sheba 's breasts .

At dawn on the following day , [we]2488-we were led to the edge of [a very precipitous chasm]2508-a very precipitous chasm , by which [we]2488-we were to descend the precipice , and gain [the plain]725-the plain two thousand and more feet below .

Here [we]2488-we bade farewell to [that true friend and sturdy old warrior , [Infadoos]162-infadoos , who solemnly wished all good upon [us]2488-we]2510-that true friend and sturdy old warrior , infadoos , who solemnly wished all good upon us , and nearly wept with grief . " Never , [[my]162-infadoos lords]3091-my lords , "[162-infadoos] [he]162-infadoos said , ' shall [mine]162-infadoos old eyes see the like of [you]2488-we again . Ah ! the way that [Incubu]150-incubu cut [[his]150-incubu men]1692-his men down in the battle ! Ah ! for the sight of that stroke with which [he]150-incubu swept off [[my]0-i brother]2648-my brother [Twala]165-twala 's head ! It was beautiful - beautiful ! [I]0-i may never hope to see such another , except perchance in happy dreams . "[0-i]

[We]2488-we were very sorry to part from [him]162-infadoos ; indeed , [Good]98-good was so moved that [he]162-infadoos gave [him]162-infadoos as a souvenir - what do [you]2513-you think ? - an eye - glass ; afterwards [we]2488-we discovered that it was a spare one . [Infadoos]162-infadoos was delighted , foreseeing that the possession of such an article would increase [his]162-infadoos prestige enormously , and after several vain attempts [he]162-infadoos actually succeeded in screwing it into [his]162-infadoos own eye . Anything more incongruous than [the old warrior]2435-the old warrior looked with an eye - glass [I]0-i never saw . Eye - glasses do not go well with leopard - skin cloaks and black ostrich plumes .

Then , after seeing that [[our]2488-we guides]1054-our guides were well laden with water and provisions , and having received a thundering farewell salute from [the Buffaloes]194-the buffaloes , [we]2488-we wrung [Infadoos]162-infadoos by the hand , and began [our]2488-we downward climb . A very arduous business it proved to be , but somehow that evening [we]2488-we found [ourselves]2488-we at the bottom without accident .

" Do [you]0-i know , "[97-sir henry] said [Sir Henry]97-sir henry that night , as [we]2488-we sat by [our]2488-we fire and gazed up at [the beetling cliffs above [us]2488-we]2516-the beetling cliffs above us , " [I]97-sir henry think that there are [worse places than [Kukuanaland]2-kukuanaland in [the world]248-the world]4353-worse places than kukuanaland in the world , and that [I]97-sir henry have known unhappier times than the last month or two , though [I]97-sir henry have never spent such queer ones . Eh ! [[you]0-i fellows]3640-you fellows ? "[97-sir henry]

" [I]493-good almost wish [I]493-good were back , "[493-good] said [Good]493-good , with a sigh .

As for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i reflected that all 's well that ends well ; but in the course of a long life of shaves , [I]0-i never had such shaves as those which [I]0-i had recently experienced . The thought of that battle makes [me]0-i feel cold all over , and as for [our]2488-we experience in the treasure chamber - !

Next morning [we]2488-we started on a toilsome trudge across [the desert]2742-the desert , having with [us]2488-we a good supply of water carried by [[our]2488-we five guides]2519-our five guides , and camped that night in the open , marching again at dawn on the morrow .

By noon of the third day 's journey [we]2488-we could see the trees of [the oasis of which [the guides]2521-the guides spoke]2520-the oasis of which the guides spoke , and within an hour of sundown [we]2488-we were walking once more upon grass and listening to the sound of running water .

1 This extraordinary and negative way of showing intense respect is by no means unknown among [African people]2522-african people , and the result is that if , as is usual , the name in question has a significance , the meaning must be expressed by an idiom or other word . In this way a memory is preserved for generations , or until the new word utterly supplants the old .

2 It often puzzled [all of [us]2488-we]2523-all of us to understand how it was possible that [[Ignosi]169-ignosi 's mother]2524-ignosi 's mother , bearing [the child]3250-the child with [her]2524-ignosi 's mother , should have survived the dangers of [her]2524-ignosi 's mother journey across [the mountains]2771-the mountains and [the desert]2742-the desert , dangers which so nearly proved fatal to [ourselves]2488-we . It has since occurred to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i give the idea to [the reader]502-the reader for what it is worth , that [she]2524-ignosi 's mother must have taken this second route , and wandered out like [Hagar]230-hagar into [the wilderness]430-the wilderness . If [she]2524-ignosi 's mother did so , there is no longer anything inexplicable about the story , since , as [Ignosi]169-ignosi [himself]169-ignosi related , [she]2524-ignosi 's mother may well have been picked up by [some ostrich hunters]2530-some ostrich hunters before [she]2524-ignosi 's mother or [the child]3250-the child was exhausted , was led by [them]2530-some ostrich hunters to [the oasis]2502-the oasis , and thence by stages to [the fertile country]646-the fertile country , and so on by slow degrees southwards to [Zululand]4-zululand . - A.Q.

CHAPTER XX

FOUND

And now [I]0-i come to perhaps the strangest adventure that happened to [us]2488-we in all this strange business , and one which shows how wonderfully things are brought about .

[I]0-i was walking along quietly , some way in front of [the other two]2534-the other two , down the banks of [the stream which runs from [the oasis]2502-the oasis]2535-the stream which runs from the oasis till [it]2535-the stream which runs from the oasis is swallowed up in [the hungry desert sands]2537-the hungry desert sands , when suddenly [I]0-i stopped and rubbed [my]0-i eyes , as well [I]0-i might . There , not twenty yards in front of [me]0-i , placed in a charming situation , under the shade of a species of fig - tree , and facing to [the stream]896-the stream , was [a cosy hut]2539-a cosy hut , built more or less on the Kafir principle with grass and withes , but having a full - length door instead of [a bee - hole]2540-a bee - hole .

" What the dickens , "[0-i] said [I]0-i to [myself]0-i , " can a hut be doing here ? "[0-i] Even as [I]0-i said it the door of [the hut]1095-the hut opened , and there limped out of it [a white man clothed in skins , and with an enormous black beard]2542-a white man clothed in skins , and with an enormous black beard . [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i must have got a touch of the sun . It was impossible . [No hunter]2543-no hunter ever came to such a place as this . Certainly [no hunter]2543-no hunter would ever settle in [it]1095-the hut . [I]0-i stared and stared , and so did [the other man]318-the other man , and just at that juncture [Sir Henry]97-sir henry and [Good]98-good walked up .

" Look here , [[you]2547-us fellows]3640-you fellows , "[0-i] [I]0-i said , " is that [a white man]662-a white man , or am [I]0-i mad ? "[0-i]

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry looked , and [Good]98-good looked , and then all of a sudden [the lame white man with a black beard]2546-the lame white man with a black beard uttered a great cry , and began hobbling towards [us]2547-us . When [he]2546-the lame white man with a black beard was close [he]2546-the lame white man with a black beard fell down in a sort of faint .

With a spring [Sir Henry]97-sir henry was by [his]2546-the lame white man with a black beard side .

" [Great Powers]231-great powers ! "[97-sir henry] [he]97-sir henry cried , " it is [[my]97-sir henry brother]2648-my brother [George]110-george curtis ! "[97-sir henry]

At the sound of this disturbance , [another figure , also clad in skins]2548-another figure , also clad in skins , emerged from [the hut]1095-the hut , a gun in [his]2548-another figure , also clad in skins hand , and ran towards [us]2547-us . On seeing [me]0-i [he]2548-another figure , also clad in skins too gave a cry .

" [Macumazahn]138-macumazahn , "[2548-another figure , also clad in skins] [he]2548-another figure , also clad in skins halloed , " do n't [you]138-macumazahn know [me]2548-another figure , also clad in skins , [Baas]123-baas ? [I]2548-another figure , also clad in skins 'm [Jim the hunter]4359-jim the hunter . [I]2548-another figure , also clad in skins lost the note [you]138-macumazahn gave [me]2548-another figure , also clad in skins to give to [the Baas]123-baas , and [we]2547-us have been [here]2924-here nearly two years . "[2548-another figure , also clad in skins] And [the fellow]2550-the fellow fell at [my]0-i feet , and rolled over and over , weeping for joy .

" [[You]2550-the fellow careless scoundrel]4361-you careless scoundrel ! "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " [you]2550-the fellow ought to be well sjambocked "[0-i] - that is , hided .

Meanwhile [the man with the black beard]2551-the man with the black beard had recovered and risen , and [he]2551-the man with the black beard and [Sir Henry]97-sir henry were pump - handling away at [each other]373-each other , apparently without a word to say . But whatever [they]2553-they had quarrelled about in the past - [I]0-i suspect it was [a lady]4351-a lady , though [I]0-i never asked - it was evidently forgotten now .

" [[My]97-sir henry dear old fellow]4362-my dear old fellow , "[97-sir henry] burst out [Sir Henry]97-sir henry at last , " [I]97-sir henry thought [you]4362-my dear old fellow were dead . " 1[97-sir henry]

" [I]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue tried to cross [Solomon 's Mountains]82-solomon 's mountains nearly two years ago , "[2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue] was the answer , spoken in the hesitating voice of [a man who has had little recent opportunity of using [his]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue tongue]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue , " but when [I]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue reached here a boulder fell on [my]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue leg and crushed it , and [I]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue have been able to go neither forward nor back . Then [I]0-i came up . " How do [you]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue do , [Mr. Neville]108-neville ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said ; " do [you]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue remember [me]0-i ? "[0-i]

" Why , "[2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue] [he]2555-a man who has had little recent opportunity of using his tongue said , " is n't it [Hunter Quatermain]105-quatermain , eh , and Good too ? That evening , over the camp fire , [George Curtis]110-george curtis told [us]2556-us [his]110-george curtis story , which , in its way , was almost as eventful as [our]2556-us own , and , put shortly , amounted to this . A little less than two years before , [he]110-george curtis had started from [[Sitanda]232-sitanda 's [Kraal]83-kraal]2557-sitanda 's kraal , to try to reach [[Suliman]118-suliman 's Berg]50-the suliman berg . As for the note [I]0-i had sent [him]110-george curtis by [Jim]109-jim , that [worthy]110-george curtis lost it , and [he]110-george curtis had never heard of it till to - day . But , acting upon information [he]110-george curtis had received from [the natives]2682-the natives , [he]110-george curtis headed not for [Sheba 's Breasts]61-sheba 's breasts , but for the ladder - like descent of [the mountains down which [we]2556-us had just come]2559-the mountains down which we had just come , which is clearly a better route than that marked out in [old [Dom Silvestra]128-da silvestra 's plan]2560-old dom silvestra 's plan . In [the desert]2742-the desert [he]110-george curtis and [Jim]109-jim had suffered great hardships , but finally [they]2562-they reached [this oasis]2498-this oasis , where a terrible accident befell [George Curtis]110-george curtis . On the day of [their]2562-they arrival [he]110-george curtis was sitting by [the stream]896-the stream , and [Jim]109-jim was extracting the honey from the nest of a stingless bee which is to be found in [the desert]2742-the desert , on the top of [a bank immediately above [him]110-george curtis]2566-a bank immediately above him . In so doing [he]110-george curtis loosened a great boulder of rock , which fell upon [George Curtis]110-george curtis 's right leg , crushing it frightfully . From that day [he]110-george curtis had been so lame that [he]110-george curtis found it impossible to go either forward or back , and had preferred to take the chances of dying in [the oasis]2502-the oasis to the certainty of perishing in [the desert]2742-the desert .

As for food , however , [they]2562-they got on pretty well , for [they]2562-they had a good supply of ammunition , and [the oasis]2502-the oasis was frequented , especially at night , by large quantities of game , which came thither for water . These [they]2562-they shot , or trapped in pitfalls , using the flesh for food , and , after [their]2562-they clothes wore out , the hides for clothing .

" And so , "[110-george curtis] [George Curtis]110-george curtis ended , " [we]2562-they have lived for nearly two years , like [a second [Robinson Crusoe]233-robinson crusoe and [[his]233-robinson crusoe man]4369-his man Friday]4368-a second robinson crusoe and his man friday , hoping against hope that [some natives]4370-some natives might come here to help [us]2562-they away , but [none]2774-none have come . Only last night [we]2562-they settled that [Jim]109-jim should leave [me]110-george curtis , and try to reach [[Sitanda]232-sitanda 's [Kraal]83-kraal]30-sitanda 's kraal to get assistance . [He]109-jim was to go to - morrow , but [I]110-george curtis had little hope of ever seeing [him]109-jim back again . And now [you]4372-you , of [all people in [the world]248-the world]4373-all people in the world , [you]4372-you , who , as [I]110-george curtis fancied , had long ago forgotten all about [me]110-george curtis , and were living comfortably in old [England]18-england , turn up in a promiscuous way and find [me]110-george curtis where [you]4372-you least expected . It is the most wonderful thing that [I]110-george curtis have ever heard of , and the most merciful too . "[110-george curtis]

Then [Sir Henry]97-sir henry set to work , and told [him]97-sir henry the main facts of [our]2570-our adventures , sitting till late into the night to do it .

" By [Jove]221-jove ! "[110-george curtis] said [George Curtis]110-george curtis , when [I]0-i showed [him]110-george curtis some of the diamonds : " well , at least [you]110-george curtis have got something for [your]110-george curtis pains , besides [[my]0-i worthless self]4375-my worthless self . "[0-i]

[Sir Henry]97-sir henry laughed . " They belong to [Quatermain]105-quatermain and [Good]493-good . It was a part of the bargain that [they]4377-they should divide any spoils there might be . "[97-sir henry]

This remark set [me]0-i thinking , and having spoken to [Good]98-good , [I]0-i told [Sir Henry]97-sir henry that it was [our]2570-our joint wish that [he]97-sir henry should take a third portion of the diamonds , or , if [he]97-sir henry would not , that [his]97-sir henry share should be handed to [[his]97-sir henry brother]376-his brother , who had suffered even more than [ourselves]2570-our on the chance of getting them . Finally , [we]2570-our prevailed upon [him]97-sir henry to consent to this arrangement , but [George Curtis]110-george curtis did not know of it until some time afterwards .

Here , at this point , [I]0-i think that [I]0-i shall end [my]0-i history . [Our]2570-our journey across [the desert]2742-the desert back to [Sitanda 's Kraal]30-sitanda 's kraal was most arduous , especially as [we]2570-our had to support [George Curtis]110-george curtis , whose right leg was very weak indeed , and continually threw out splinters of bone . But [we]2570-our did accomplish it somehow , and to give its details would only be to reproduce much of what happened to [us]2570-our on the former occasion .

Six months from the date of [our]2570-our re - arrival at [[Sitanda]232-sitanda 's]2573-sitanda 's , where [we]2570-our found [our]2570-our guns and other goods quite safe , though [the old rascal in charge]2574-the old rascal in charge was much disgusted at [our]2570-our surviving to claim them , saw [us]2570-our all once more safe and sound at [[my]0-i little place on [the Berea]41-the berea]2575-my little place on the berea , near [Durban]10-durban , where [I]0-i am now writing . Thence [I]0-i bid farewell to [all who have accompanied [me]0-i through the strangest trip [I]0-i ever made in the course of a long and varied experience]2576-all who have accompanied me through the strangest trip i ever made in the course of a long and varied experience .

P.S. - Just as [I]0-i had written the last word , [a Kafir]291-a kafir came up [[my]0-i avenue of orange trees]2578-my avenue of orange trees , carrying a letter in a cleft stick , which [he]291-a kafir had brought from the post . It turned out to be from [Sir Henry]97-sir henry , and as it speaks for itself [I]0-i give it in full .

October 1 , 1884 . [Brayley Hall]86-brayley hall , [Yorkshire]87-yorkshire .

[My]0-i Dear [Quatermain]105-quatermain ,

[I]0-i send [you]105-quatermain a line a few mails back to say that the three of [us]2579-we , [George]110-george curtis , [Good]493-good , and [myself]0-i , fetched up all right in [England]18-england . [We]2579-we got off [the boat]409-the boat at [Southampton]88-southampton , and went up to [town]2582-town . [You]105-quatermain should have seen what [a swell Good]2583-a swell good turned out the very next day , beautifully shaved , frock coat fitting like a glove , brand new eye - glass , etc . , etc . [I]0-i went and walked in [the park]2584-the park with [him]2583-a swell good , where [I]0-i met [some people [I]0-i know]2585-some people i know , and at once told [them]2585-some people i know the story of [his]2583-a swell good " beautiful white legs . "[2583-a swell good]

[He]2583-a swell good is furious , especially as [some ill - natured person]2586-some ill - natured person has printed it in a Society paper .

To come to business , [Good]98-good and [I]0-i took the diamonds to [Streeter 's]89-streeter 's to be valued , as [we]2579-we arranged , and really [I]0-i am afraid to tell [you]105-quatermain what [they]89-streeter 's put them at , it seems so enormous . [They]89-streeter 's say that of course it is more or less guess - work , as such stones have never to [their]89-streeter 's knowledge been put on the market in anything like such quantities . It appears that with the exception of one or two of the largest they are of the finest water , and equal in every way to the best Brazilian stones . [I]0-i asked [them]89-streeter 's if [they]89-streeter 's would buy [them]89-streeter 's , but [they]89-streeter 's said that it was beyond [their]89-streeter 's power to do so , and recommended [us]2579-we to sell by degrees , over a period of years indeed , for fear lest [we]2579-we should flood the market . [They]89-streeter 's offer , however , a hundred and eighty thousand for a very small portion of [them]89-streeter 's .

[You]105-quatermain must come [home]2616-home , [Quatermain]105-quatermain , and see about these things , especially if [you]105-quatermain insist upon making the magnificent present of the third share , which does not belong to [me]0-i , to [[my]0-i brother]2648-my brother [George]110-george curtis . As for Good , [he]2589-he is no good . [His]2589-he time is too much occupied in shaving , and other matters connected with the vain adorning of the body . But [I]0-i think [he]2589-he is still down on [his]2589-he luck about [Foulata]99-foulata . [He]2589-he told [me]0-i that since [he]2589-he had been [home]2616-home [he]2589-he had n't seen [a woman]272-a woman to touch [her]272-a woman , either as regards [her]272-a woman figure or the sweetness of [her]272-a woman expression .

[I]0-i want [you]2592-you to come [home]2616-home , [[my]0-i dear old comrade]2594-my dear old comrade , and to buy [a house near here]2595-a house near here . [You]2592-you have done [your]2592-you day 's work , and have lots of money now , and there is a place for sale quite close which would suit [you]2592-you admirably . Do come ; the sooner the better ; [you]2592-you can finish writing the story of [our]2596-we adventures on [board ship]2597-board ship . [We]2596-we have refused to tell the tale till it is written by [you]2592-you , for fear lest [we]2596-we shall not be believed . If [you]2592-you start on receipt of this [you]2592-you will reach here by Christmas , and [I]0-i book [you]2592-you to stay with [me]0-i for that . [Good]493-good is coming , and [George]110-george curtis ; and so , by the way , is [[your]2592-you boy]2599-your boy [Harry]97-sir henry there 's a bribe for [you]2592-you . [I]0-i have had [him]97-sir henry down for a week 's shooting , and like [him]97-sir henry . [He]97-sir henry is [a cool young hand]2600-a cool young hand ; [he]97-sir henry shot [me]0-i in the leg , cut out the pellets , and then remarked upon the advantages of having [a medical student with every shooting party]2601-a medical student with every shooting party !

Good - bye , [old boy]2602-old boy ; [I]0-i ca n't say any more , but [I]0-i know that [you]2592-you will come , if it is only to oblige

[[Your]2592-you sincere friend]2603-your sincere friend , [Henry Curtis]97-sir henry .

P.S. - The tusks of the great bull that killed [poor Khiva]101-khiva have now been put up in [the hall here]2604-the hall here , over the pair of buffalo horns [you]2592-you gave [me]0-i , and look magnificent ; and the axe with which [I]0-i chopped off [Twala]165-twala 's head is fixed above [my]0-i writing - table . [I]0-i wish that [we]2605-we could have managed to bring away the coats of chain armour . Do n't lose poor [Foulata]99-foulata 's basket in which [you]2592-you brought away the diamonds .

H.C.

To - day is Tuesday . There is [a steamer going on Friday]2606-a steamer going on friday , and [I]0-i really think that [I]0-i must take [Curtis]97-sir henry at [his]97-sir henry word , and sail by [her]2603-your sincere friend for [England]18-england , if it is only to see [you]2592-you , [Harry]97-sir henry , [[my]0-i boy]266-my boy , and to look after the printing of this history , which is a task that [I]0-i do not like to trust to [anybody else]2311-anybody else .

[ALLAN QUATERMAIN]92-allan quatermain .
